loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 39 years old. She is married and has 6 children aged between 2 and 16 years, 5 of them go to school. She has a shop and has been working in this business for 10 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, salt, biscuits and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 40 years old. She is married and has 5 children aged between 5 and 16 years, all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running this business for 20 years. With this loan, she would like to buy lotion, umbrellas and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Providence

texts.en: Providence is 35 years old. She is married with one child who is 1 year old and does not yet go to school. She has a shop and has been doing business for 2 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more small fish, rice and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and increase her welfare.

loans.use: buy fish, rice & sugar

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en: Theogene is 40 years old. He is married and has 5 children aged between 9 and 22 years, all of them go to school. He has a shop and has been running this business for 19 years. With this loan, he would like to buy saucepans, towels and soap to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy pans, towels & soap

loans.name: Marie Odette

texts.en: Marie Odette is 50 years old. She is married with three children aged between 21 and 25 years, and all of them go to school. She has a mini market and has been running the business for 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy milk, bread, eggs and fruits to sell. The profits from the business will be used pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana lives in the village of Sarigyugh in the Tavush region with her parents-in-law, husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two infant grandchildren. This big and beautiful family is happy with its farming and agricultural occupations. Liana's husband has a truck with which he makes transfers around his region.

Besides working in the household, Liana is also a skilled farmer. On her farm she has two cows, three calves, a pig, and 40 chickens. On her plot of land, she also cultivates potatoes, wheat, plums, apples, and pears, which she also sells. Since Liana's husband is busy with his transfers, the farming is fully Liana's occupation, in which she has already spent more than 20 years.

This loan will greatly help Liana to buy a cow, three sheep, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, 3 sheep, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Abaterimbere Group

texts.en: ABATERIMBERE is a group led by Daphrose who is 46 years old. The group's name means “developer” in English. Daphrose has been a group leader for 10 years. She has a shop and has been selling in a business for 10 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sugar, soap and rice for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: buy sugar, soap and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en: Iluminada thought she was in the right place when she became a regular member of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business.  Iluminada has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business.  Iluminada wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed & vitamins

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is driven by passion for selling. At the age of 45, Rita is a mother of two children in Bato, Plaridel.  She runs a store that is the primary support for her family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending her store. 

Rita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repaid her obligations without records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to restock items for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to sell and attract more customers. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Merelu

texts.en:
Merelu is 39 years old and has four children. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to 6,000 PHP to purchase new nets. 

As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize the chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets to maximize fish catch

loans.name: Ive

texts.en:
Ive is 33 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. She has a half hectare of rice field.  She has had this business for 10 years.  This month is the harvest and she requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation for the next cropping to continue her income and sustain the needs of her family.  

Ive has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes that God will always blessed her rice field and have more sales.

loans.use: pay for harvest & seedbed preparation

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 42 years old, married and has 3 beautiful children. She has been a wholesaler of bananas in her town for almost 10 years. From this long time experience of selling, she has high knowledge in dealing in this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Juliet still gets more customers above the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and has managed to save more money for her family. 

Juliet  is planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business, which is creating a small pigpen, for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase more bananas wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventoru and rolls up her capital to gain more profit.  Everyday she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently Alma approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a hardworking mother from Bato Plaridel, Philippines. She is 44 years old and is a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this.  Maria  has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit.  Maria has an opportunity to own a portion of land and has applied a loan of PHP 12,600 to pay for the small parcel of coco land with 50 coconut trees. Through this, Maria hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: buy land

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia makes good earnings on her farming activities in Lopez Jaena. This is how she supports her family and sends her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially now that she has higher cost of living when her children entered college. Virginia approached Paglaum for a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and additional rice fertilizer for more production. She has high hopes that she will have good production this crop season.

loans.use: buy a sprayer & fertilizer

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en: Alexis age 33. He is married with two children aged between 1 and 4 years, and they do not yet go to school. He is a technician and has been doing the business for four years. With the loan, he would like to buy secondhand telephones and DVD’s for repairing. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy secondhand telephones and DVD's for repairing.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is 58 years old and married. She lives in Unidos, Plaridel. For the past 25 years, Dioscora has been a farmer, and farming is her family's main source of income.   Dioscora is a new member of PMPC.  She is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to have a good production of her crops. In the future, she hopes to expand her rice farm to continuously provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard, 36, is a hardworking bachelor who is always out in the streets to sell his repacked dishes. He is a very diligent roving food vendor who works twice as hard to sustain his needs and pay his house rental each month. He is from Looc Proper, Plaridel. Richard has applied for his membership with PMPC, and he appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op. Richard is in need of capital to purchase raw ingredients so that he can cook more dishes to sell. He asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 7,000 PHP, and he is thankful to them for financing his capital needs. In addition, he wants to expand his business and to manage it well for his loyal customers. Richard deeply wishes that someday he could own a space where he can position his small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to cook more dishes to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a widow and is known in her neighborhood as being a hardworking mother.  Eva receives a monthly pension from her retirement. She became a member of PMPC and is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. 

Eva hopes to live comfortably in a decent house.  For that purpose she applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and lumber for her house. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record.  It matters that she has been given a priority, as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing need are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: improve her house

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena. She is 46 years old and married.  Delia owns and operates a sari-sari store. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Unfortunately she almost lost her capital when her husband got in a motor accident.  To Delia PMPC came as a rescue to give her access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Delia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase store inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy inventory

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe has signed up her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (convenient store) business.  She is thankful for the capital extended by PMPC to a small time borrower like herself.  

Phoebe is now able to turn the tide in her favor and has had good sales days since she installed a videoke machine in her store for entertainment, drawing more customers to buy in her store.  She wants to take advantage of the good fortune.  Recently, she obtained a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, noodles, sugar, soap and shampoo.  

In the future, she hopes to build a descent home and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, soap and shampoo for resale.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Shaban has been working hard to manage his retail shop  which sells essential items like sugar and soap. He also has a poultry farm where he sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Shaban has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items and also add more chickens for sale, and will help Shaban to generate greater profits and improve his business standards. Shaban hopes that in the future he will be able to have  a good and healthy family. 

Shaban is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shaban who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 36-year-old married mother of four children, and she is a wife of one of our clients. Today, Zainab is acquiring this loan to pay her children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. 

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Zainab hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 50 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.  She is married with 6 adult-aged children.  She has operated a seafood and fish vending business for the past 14 years, earning approximately 2,500 PHP each month, which has been very helpful in supporting her family's income.

Maria Fe has requested a loan to purchase additional kilos of seafood and fish for retail.  She has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her seafood and fish vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of seafood and fish.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 46 years old, and she lives in the village of Sarigyugh in the Tavush region. She lives with her son’s family, and she already has a two-year-old grandchild. Alvard's son, in addition to farming, also earns money by working at a local gas station. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, and her daughter-in-law is a pharmacist. 

After many years being occupied in agriculture, Alvard has become very skilled at farming, since it is the important source of income for her large family. On her farm she has 12 piglets, one mother pig, and 50 hens, and she also cultivates wheat, haricots, and potatoes on her land. She has apple, plum, nut, pear, quince, cherry, and peach trees.

Alvard sells the harvested crops to wholesalers from surrounding areas. Alvard's son helps her in their agricultural and farming activities, and together they try to sustain their family's needs.

Alvard has now applied for this loan and asks lenders to support her. The loan will enable her to purchase wheat seeds and to cover cultivation costs.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena and her family raise sheep and poultry on their farm. They used to gather their animals' waste and pile it up just outside their home, until Azucena decided to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. The system allows her to use this waste as a resource to produce her own biogas and biofertilizer. 

This investment will significantly reduce the operating costs on her farm, as she will displace the expensive fossil fuel she currently uses (LP gas), replacing it with renewable energy to cook and heat water. At the same time, her family's living environment will improve; there will be fewer flies, bad smells, and the waste will not contaminate watersheds anymore. This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining amount is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a persevering mother, who is out everyday to sell her food snacks like puto cheese and rice cakes for some money. She is very diligent and never gets tired of supporting her family. She is from Southern Looc, Plaridel. Elsa has applied her membership with PMPC, and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. 

Elsa is in need of additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cakes, because she wants to display her food snacks in any canteen and eatery in the area to generate more income. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 3,000 and is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand her business and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her family a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cakes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel owns a banana farm in Southern Looc, Plaridel. This is the primary source of income for her family. She makes it a point to care for her land so that she can have a maximum yield and a good income. She has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to hire workers to help irrigate her land. Her goals are to sustain her business and supply bananas in the local market and to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 54 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at adult-age.  Artemia has earned a living from a snack vending business, particularly “puto and biko” for more than five years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in redeeming their parcel of coco land, which was pawned to their family friend. Artemia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to establish her own snack and food hauz business.

loans.use: to redeem their parcel of coco land.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina, a 59-year-old married mother of nine, has been earning her living. by raising pigs in the Philippines for the past nine years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Adelina is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds as she works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Israelita

texts.en:
Israelita is 52 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with nine children, seven of whom are now at their adult age and the other two are still at their school age. Israelita has been engaged in operating a motorcycle for hire business for five years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of business activity. That income amount is so helpful for her to support her family as the sole breadwinner. 

She has requested a loan to be used to pay the processing fees for their motorcycle registration renewal. Israelita has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, she hopes to acquire an additional unit of motorcycle for hire.

loans.use: to pay the processing fees for their motorcycle registration renewal.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 61 years old and lives in Eastern Looc, Plaridel. He is married and the father of four adult-aged children. Francisco earns a living as a fisherman and owns a boat from which he earns approximately PHP 7,000 a month. He has requested a loan to buy equipment such as fishing nets. He has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a fishing business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 59 year old mother from Danao, Plaridel. Lilia personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 12,000 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize the chances of a low or zero catch. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. 

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 55-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 7 children. and she industriously cares for her fishing activities. She personally takes charge of their business, and her children work for her as support. The business is doing well. 

Elizabeth has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now, Elizabeth sees a good opportunity to expand her business. She is requesting PHP 18,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. She deeply wishes for a decent and comfortable life with her family and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 44 years old, single, and has one child. He does farming in Machakos town, where he grows maize, beans, and vegetables to sell. He has been in this business for the past four years. 

He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant on his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farming business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to expand his farming business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en: Rheza is a businesswoman who earns her income by retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy bags of cement and hollow blocks for the completion of her house. Rheza is on her way to finishing the building, and her goal is to live comfortably there with her family.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, a 53-year-old married mother of seven. has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines for the last seven years. She earns additional income farming rice.

Cecelia is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide and secure the future of her family.



.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Wilita

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Wilita, a 49-year-old jovial mother of five lovely children whom she refers to as her “heartbeat”. Wilita hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, a place that has produced some top elite athletes for the world who have broken world records in the Olympics. Nandi Hills has good weather patterns that favor tea and dairy farming. 

Wilita is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 25 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Wilita offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. 

Being a caring and loving mother, Wilita has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. Although Wilita reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing that is dragging her behind and preventing her from “reaching on top of the skies” is lack of enough land to farm. 

For this reason, Wilita is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to be able to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Wilita is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. 

Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions. Wilita is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good-quality life and securing her children's future. Wilita has gone through the repayment schedule and amount, and is comfortable with the plan.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mario Edgar

texts.es:
46 años de edad es la edad de Mario un hombre dedicada al servicio de mantenimiento de exostos, actividad para la cual tomo clases y la ejerce como gusto pues ama lo que hace, lo cual es una característica de los antioqueños que disfrutan su profesión  por eso siempre los veras sonreír. 
Mario quiere progresar y mejorar su negocio no quedarse en lo que tiene quiere tener siempre le pensamiento de mejorar y ampliarse por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de exostos, y materiales para la elaboración de exostos. 
Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y darles condiciones de vivienda digna a sus dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad.
texts.en: Mario is 46 years old.  He is dedicated to exhaust maintenance.  He took classes to learn this trade and he does his work happily because he loves what he does.  This is a trait of Antioqueños who enjoy their professions, which is why you always see them smiling.  Mario wants to advance and improve his business.  He does not want to become complacent, which is why he always thinks of getting better and expanding his business.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan to purchase exhaust pipes and supplies to make exhausts.  His dream is to improve his quality of life and give his 7 and 5 year old children proper living conditions.

loans.use: purchase exhaust pipes and supplies to make exhausts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with ten children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds to sell.

Helen has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, un hombre de 39 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Sahagún y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 4 años con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Carlos!
texts.en:
Carlos is a 39 year old man full of dreams and aspirations in his life.  He lives on a farm in the city of Sahagún and he earns his living raising and selling chickens and eggs.  Through this work, he supports his family, which is made up of his wife and their two children.  This is a line of work that he has been in for about four years.  

He is seeking a loan to purchase chickens, laying hens, feed and materials for his barn.  With this loan he will be able to consolidate his business and make it more sustainable.  By making a loan today you will be able to improve Carlos's life and business.

loans.use: purchase chickens, laying hens, feed and materials for his barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Sahagún, vive una mujer pujante y trabajadora llamada Maria, una mujer que con su carisma y gran capacidad de trabajo ha podido superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado en su vida.

Tiene un pequeñísimo negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanías en su propia casa, oficio que aprendió a través de la herencia de sus padres.
Sus artesanías son accesorios fabricados en cañaflecha.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una materia prima (cañaflecha) con la que podrá capitalizar su negocio y tendrá una mejor producción.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Maria!
texts.en:
Maria, a strong and hardworking woman lives in the city of Sahagún.  Through her charisma and great ability to work, she has been able to overcome the many obstacles that she has faced in life.  She has a very small business making and selling crafts from her home, a trade that she learned from her parents.  Her crafts are accessories made from wild cane.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase wild cane that she will use to capitalize on her business and increase her production.

Go ahead and lend to Maria's business!

loans.use: purchase wild cane.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, age 29, is a married woman. She has four children. One of her children is shown with her husband in the picture. Her husband deals in the  business of painting. He is an expert in doing his work and earns a good amount towards fulfilling family needs. 

In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Bushra has taken a murabaha loan of 10,000 PKR for the growth of her husband's business. It helped him purchase buckets of paint in different colors to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of paint in different colors to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 59 years old, lives with his wife and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

Their granddaughter came from the countryside to the capital in order to study computer systems design at the university. So he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a computer for her use. He has great hopes for his granddaughter and wants to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his granddaughter's use.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking Filipino mother who is always out in their house to sell "pan bisaya" (native bread) for some money. She is 58 years old, married, and lives in Bato, Plaridel. She is very diligent and she works as much she can to sustain their family needs. Thelma has applied her membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. 

Thelma is in need of additional capital to purchase three bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production of "pan bisaya" (native bread) to provide for more customers and to be able to accept orders. She asked financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 7,000 and is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand and improve her business. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production of "pan bisaya" (native bread) to provide for more customers.

loans.name: Polmar

texts.en:
Polmar is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents in Unidos, Plaridel. Polmar provides transport services with his own motor cab in order to earn money for his needs and to support his parents. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community, and he earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

In order to continue his business, Polmare has requested a loan to pay for spare motor parts and repair. He dreams of owning more motor units and being able to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for spare motor parts and repair

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Barbara is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Barbara has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Enkhbayar, 47 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an interior designer with his wife for more than 20 years. Their eldest son is an electrician at a power plant and their daughter studies at university. Enkhbayar requires a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay his daughter's tuition fee. He has great hope in his daughter and wants to help her study hard without worrying about paying the tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 64 years old and lives in SWP, Calamba, Philippines. She is married with three children. Gloria has a sari-sari store and has had this business for 5 years. 

For another source of income she requested a loan to buy 2 piglets and 2 sacks of feeds. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 61 years old, married and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Luz has been pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Javier Jesus

texts.es:
Al hablar de Javier se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial, que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de San Pelayo, Córdoba vive soltero y tiene dos hijos menores por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.

El se gana la vida con la compra y venta de queso y leche, tiene plena fe en su negocio y trabaja con alegría.

Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de leche y de queso para abastecer su negocio y poder continuar con su actividad.

El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.
texts.en:
When talking about Javier Jesus one can tell that he is a hard-working and helpful man and that everything that he does is for the good of his family and his own well-being. He lives in a humble home in the town of San Pelayo, Córdoba. He is single and has two young children for whom he has fought to give a dignified life and a quality education.

He makes a living buying and selling cheese and milk. He has complete faith in his business and works with joy. He is a hard-working and tenacious individual and loves his children.

He is asking for a loan to buy stock of milk and cheese to supply and continue with his business. He hopes to be able to find help in people with caring hearts.

loans.use: to buy stock of milk and cheese to supply his business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn works hard to support her family. Merlyn is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her welding shop.

Merlyn has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her welding shop

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 61 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like soft drinks, rice, sardines, etc.

Conchita has borrowed and paid off 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear products.

Conchita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soft drinks, rice, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio owns several sheep on his farm, and he also seeds and harvests corn and kidney beans for his family's own consumption. Before he decided to purchase his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, this small activity implied important expenses in chemical fertilizer, while Nicasio's wife was cooking and heating water in the house using wood and expensive LP gas. 

Nicasio was very enthusiastic about his investment in a biodigester, which gives him the opportunity to produce his own biogas and biofertilizer from his animals' manure. This allows him to close the natural cycle on his farm and to be self-sufficient, by transforming waste into a precious resource. 

Not only will he reduce his operating expenses, he will also eliminate the smoke in the kitchen, which is damaging his wife's health, by enabling her to cook with biogas. There will be fewer flies and bad smells around the piles of waste close to the house, and no more trees will be cut down to supply the family with wood.

This loan represents 16% of the cost of the biodigester, while the remaining amount is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is from Plaridel. He and his wife have some rice land and earn a living doing farming activities. 

Recently, Rene took a loan to pay for a small parcel of rice land in order to expand his rice farming activity. He hopes to  increase his harvest yield.

Rene deeply wishes to save enough for his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for a small parcel of land in order to expand his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en:
Sherry is a 38-year-old married man. He earns his living in Oroquieta City to support his family .
For many years, Sherry has been able to meet the needs of his family and was saving for their future needs. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for motorcycle maintenance. Now he is starting another business which is raising pigs for sale. He took a new loan recently to buy tires and two piglets for his new business activity. He plans to build a livestock shelter in the future.

loans.use: to buy tires and two piglets for his new business activity

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 60 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao, Philippines. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They plant bananas and are currently cultivating the area for peanut planting. 

They joined Paglaum Cooperatives because of the benefits and services they offer. Aside from that, Candelaria was also attracted by their savings scheme. 

She applied for a loan from Paglaum amounting to 30,000PHP, which she will use to support the education expenses of her graduating students. The remaining amount will be used to pay for the labor of cultivating the area for peanuts. 

Candelaria hopes and prays that her daughters graduate this coming March, and is very thankful to Paglaum for helping them.

loans.use: to support the education of her graduating students.

loans.name: Fanny Isabel

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Fanny, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Cerete, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño en la pequeña cocina de su casa.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su casa porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Fanny ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para realizar una adecuación a su cocina y para comprar surtido de ingredientes variados para sus preparaciones.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hard-working, that is how Fanny is.  She is a warrior woman who has devoted a great part of her life to taking care of her children.  She lives in the Cerete municipality, where she earns a living preparing various foods for lunches and breakfasts.  She does this in a small kitchen in her house.  Her food is known by her neighbors in the area.  They visit her house because they know that they will be able to eat delicious food.

Fanny has decided to improve her business and increase her sales.  For this reason, she turns to a loan to make an adjustment to her kitchen and to buy a stock of various ingredients for her food preparation.

This loan will allow her to get her business ahead and to get the needed income to give her the opportunity to support her family and her business.  

Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to make an adjustment to her kitchen and to buy a stock of various ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Nelsie Grace

texts.en:
Nelsie Grace is 50 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and milk.

Nelsie Grace has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Nelsie Grace aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and milk.

loans.name: Urantogos

texts.en:
Mrs. Urantogos, 36 years old, lives with her husband and daughters in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been teaching physics at high school since 2004. Her husband is a fireman at an emergency management agency. Their daughters go to high school. 

Using her previous loan, she has purchased an automobile for her husband. Now her husband renders taxi service during his day off. This time, she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to install an electric heater into her house in order to reduce coal usage for heating. Coal burning is considered to be the main contributor to air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: to install an electric heater in order to reduce coal usage.

loans.name: Naga Tegal Wangi Group

texts.en:
As in the agreement, the Naga Tegal Wangi group made their payment of 15,.000,000 IDR to MUK. Other members couldn't attend the meeting because of their activities and the payment was represented by the head, Ni Made. 

Ni Made, 32, is a housewife and she has 2 school age children. They are still in elementary school and junior high school. Ni Made feels the benefit for having this special loan. She can increase the population of her pigs. Now she manages sows and fattening. Although the price for feed is getting higher, Ni Made keeps up the fight to continue the effort. The results have proven to support her children's education. 

The Naga Tegal Wangi group received their new loan with the same loan size as before. This time they are focused on purchasing super quality feed to make sure the pigs grow fast and fat. Ni Made will use her portion of the loan to purchase feed. She already has piglets in her cage. She plans to sell pigs for fattening. She hopes her plan will go smoothly.

One member couldn't attend the meeting because of sickness.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gina has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Gina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Karen Roxana

texts.es:
Karen es una bella flor de 19 años de edad que decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de mercancía como bebidas poco vistas, y artículos de decoración, esta actividad la inicio por vocación y gusto al trabajo independiente y gracias a este trabajo puede ayudar en los gastos del hogar y pagar sus estudios pues se sueña convertida en una gran profesional. 
Gracias al apoyo que interactuar está brindando a los nuevos emprendedores Karen puede solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía en grandes cantidades para que su gestión de ventas no tenga límites y pueda tener un gran empresa a futuro
texts.en: Karen is a beautiful 19 year old woman who has decided to start her own company selling merchandise such as hard-to-find spirits and decorative items. She began this occupation as she was drawn to this field and she likes to work independently. With her job, she can help to pay for household expenses and pay for her education as she dreams of becoming an excellent professional. Thanks to the support that Interactuar is providing for new entrepreneurs, Karen can apply for a loan that will allow her to purchase large quantities of merchandise so that her sales processing will have no limits and she can have a large business in the future.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as hard-to-find spirits and accessories

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es:
Comprar una casa propia es el sueño de una madre cabeza de familia llamada Martha, es una mujer de 46 años de edad con un hijo de 6 años que se dedica a la venta de comida que ella misma labora en su casa, a pesar de tantas negativas y malos pensamientos de que tiene un sueño muy ambicioso y con su negocio no lo pueden ejecutar ella sigue levantándose a preparar sus alimentos y ahorrar cualquier moneda para acercarse a pequeños pasos a ese sueño. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos para elaborar sus comidas víveres y empaques y gracias a interactuar puede pasar de dar pequeños pasos a grandes pasos pues tendrá mayor capital para producir más mercancía
texts.en:
Buying a home is the dream of a mother, head of household named Martha.  She is a 46-year-old woman, with a 6 year old, who sells food that she prepares at home. 

Despite many negatives and bad thoughts which cross her mind that her dream might be too ambitious, and that she might not be able to achieve it with the business that she runs, she continues to pick herself up and prepares food to save any money that can help her, step by step, achieve her dream.

She requests a loan for the purchase of food products to prepare meals, buy groceries and food packaging. She is thankful and hopes that she can go from small steps to large ones since she will have more capital to generate more goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase products to prepare meals, buy groceries and food packaging

loans.name: Lunimar

texts.en:
Lunimar is 27 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, spices, etc. Lunimar has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, spices, etc.

loans.name: Walter Rafael

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Walter, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 1 año trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días.

El decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras que transporta en un vehículo de su propiedad

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico para comprar un amplio surtido de verduras para abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilamente sus alimentos sin necesidad de transportarlos por toda la ciudad.
texts.en:
Selling fruits and vegetables is Walter Rafael's business. He is a man with the initiative and perseverance necessary to make a success out of his own business. He has made a living from this business for more than a year, working everyday starting early in the morning.

He decided to start this project upon seeing the necessity of earning more income for his family. He didn't have the education necessary for a different career, so he opted for selling fruits and vegetables that he transports in his own vehicle. He is a friendly and helpful man, always available to address the the concerns and desires of his clients.

He is asking for a loan to buy a large amount of fruits and vegetables to stock up and sell a greater quantity. His dream is to have a shop where he can calmly sell his foods without needing to transport them all over the city.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of fruits and vegetables to stock up and sell a greater quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Josephine is engaged in retail sales of ready to wear clothes, footwear, and cosmetic products. This is the source of her income. Josephine is sitting next to her products with her youngest daughter.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like ready-to-wear clothes, shoes and footwear, fashion accessories, and cosmetic products. This will help her improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Josephine hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like ready-to-wear clothes, shoes and footwear, fashion accessories, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 53 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lopez Jaena with her family. 

She has a retail store that sells assorted rice to generate additional income. Nelfa has been in this field for five years. She is working well every day in order to provide income for the family and to help improve their living situation.

Nelfa requested this loan to purchase more rice to sell in her store in order to increase her sales. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she could possibly repair their house for a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell in her store in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, coconut, rice grains, etc.

Aileen has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, coconut, rice grains, etc.

loans.name: Rogelio Vasquez

texts.es:
Rogelio de 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, estudio hasta noveno grado está acompañado desde hace 11 años, su pareja se dedica a oficios domésticos y por el momento cuida de su madre quien está pasando por momentos difíciles de salud, él trabaja como motorista desde hace 17 años, comenzó trabajando en una comercial donde tomo experiencia, después fue mensajero y trabajo repartiendo encomiendas y ahora trabaja con personas de su comunidad
 El dinero lo necesita para gastos medicinales de su uegra a quien cuida su compañera de vida esto le ayudara a mejorar la salud de ella por lo tanto estarán menos preocupados, si esa persona que es parte su familia está bien, una de sus hijas quiere estudiar para enfermera y él está dispuesto a apoyarle así como también a su hijo que quiere ser profesor el otro aun no estudia pero está dispuesto a darles lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 36 years old and has 3 children. He studied until Grade 9. He has been in a relationship for the past 11 years. His spouse does the housework and right now is also taking care of her mother. She is having problems with her health.

He has worked as a driver for 17 years. He started working in a company where he gained experience, then he worked as a messenger and worked delivering packages. Now he works with people from his community.

He needs the money for medical expenses for his mother-in-law who his wife is caring for. This will help her improve her health and they will be less worried if this person who is part of their family is well.

One of his daughters is studying to be a nurse and he is ready to support her as well as his son who wants to become a teacher. The youngest doesn't study yet. He is prepared to give them what they need.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses for his mother-in-law.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is a 34-year-old garment-factory worker. She is married with a teenaged child. She lives in Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. Her only child attends school. 

Her husband is 40, a farmer, and also a motorcycle taxi driver. Together, they can earn approximately $11 per day. 

Now Sophal would like to request a loan to change the house pillars. This loan will help her have a stronger house for living. 

In the future, she wants to help her child to get higher education.

loans.use: to change the house pillars.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is a woman who stands out for searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family. 

Five years ago she began making a living selling Tupperware. She thanks God and her clients for this occupation, since the results of these sales have been very rewarding and her products were fast - selling. 

Based on this success, Leizel is asking for a loan to buy more Tupperware products to sell to increase her sales. She has to move forward for the better education of her three children in the future.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware products to sell to increase her sales

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a 38-year-old sari-sari store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She has been in the retail business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income.

Jinky would like to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do it. For this reason, she joined CEVI and is now requesting a loan to buy more stocks for her store like rice, animal feed, school supplies such as notebooks, paper, and pencils. A loan will help her improve her inventories, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

She believes that she can improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store like rice, animal feed, and school supplies such as notebooks, paper, and pencils.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Suzette works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Suzette is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Suzette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rams for his business

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin is 55 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Merlin has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya, 31 years old, lives with her mother and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia.  She has been teaching high school for seven years. Her mother has retired from work, gets a state pension, and stays at home, looking after her grandson. 

Gantuya is requesting a loan of 40,000,00 MNT to buy an electric car for transportation. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. The distance between her workplace and home is so great that it takes several buses to reach her workplace.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for office equipment, business license, and advertising needs

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno moved to the US from Sao Paulo, Brazil in 2007.  When a car accident left him temporarily unable to work, an uncle gave him the opportunity to start a business in the fire security market (products like fire detectors). 

Two years later, he is running the company and employing one person. “It was just something that life gave me the opportunity and I grabbed,” Bruno says. In 2013, Bruno started using eBay as a sales platform and has over 150 positive reviews!

Bruno has been able to secure vending contracts with major companies, but worries that “when the demand for certain products is so high that I run out of stock and so my suppliers and we have to wait two to three weeks for more products to arrive.” 

This is a real concern as Bruno’s company is working to meet growing demand, not just from the US but from Canada as well. Bruno needs a loan to purchase more inventory. In the future, Bruno plans on hiring a few more employees, as well as expanding his warehouse space.

loans.use: to purchase fire security inventory to ensure a steady supply of high demand items

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 36, is married and has five children.  She lives in Lopez Jaena with her family. 

For the past three years, Alma has operated a grocery store that sells assorted goods.  She works hard every day in order to provide income for her family and improve their living situation.  Alma is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.  This will allow her to increase her sales. 

Alma's goal is to develop her business and increase her profits so she can repair her house and ensure a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en:
Sonny is 46 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, soap, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Sonny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nonalie

texts.en:
Nonalie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with three children. 

For the past four years, Nonalie has earned a living by raising pigs. She also earns additional income from selling rice.  Nonalie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Nonalie is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to puchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana is 42 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Rossana has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Rossana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 28 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar para salir adelante con su familia, buscando diferentes maneras de ganarse la vida y poder disfrutar y cuidar a sus hijos, es por ello que decidió vender antojitos típicos en su vivienda, pero además para aprovechar los clientes también vende productos de belleza por catalogo demostrando que es una mujer muy trabajadora, también los fines de semana vende ropa para dama y caballero obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos. La vivienda de Sonia está construida en un terreno con varios niveles por lo que se vieron obligados a construir gradas para desplazarse, pero con el paso de los años el pasamanos que daba mayor seguridad a estas, ha perdido fuerza presentando áreas deterioradas, por lo que ella pensando en la seguridad de su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un pasamanos en las gradas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sonia Elizabeth is a 28-year-old, hard-working woman that has worked from the time she was young to keep her family going. She has searched for different ways to make a living and be able to enjoy and take care of her children, and for this reasons decided to sell eyeglasses in her shop. She makes the most of her clients by also selling beauty products from a catalogue, demonstrating that she is a very hard-working woman. On the weekends she also sells men's and women's clothing, earning more income. 

Sonia's home is built on terrain with various levels, making stairs necessary to get around. But with the passing of the years, the handrails that made them safer have weakened and are showing deteriorated areas. This led her to, thinking about the safety of her family, decide to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build handrails on the stairs in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build handrails on the stairs in her home.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, a 45-year-old married mother of two, has been operating a retail store in their village to make a living. She has been doing this for over five years, earning well for the family. She used her profit to buy piglets to raise for additional income. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. She is now taking a new loan to buy more grocery goods, such as noodles, sugar, flour, canned goods, and other home products, in order to increase her sales. 

She plans to renovate her house to have a comfortable and safe living for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods, such as noodles, sugar, flour, canned goods, and other home products, in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her business.

Ma. Gina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Ma. Gina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, 30, is a married woman and the mother of two from Leyte, Philippines. She is a hardworking woman and in addition to taking care of her children, she also runs a small sari-sari or variety store business. She sells goods and items to the people in her place. For more than five years now, this business has become her source of income.

Jovelyn needs a loan for the business. She is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, soda, beverages, biscuits, candies, soap and toiletries. This loan will enable her to increase her store's inventory, which will attract more buyers.

In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve their way of living. She also wants to save money which will be used to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, soda, beverages, biscuits, candies, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca has a rag making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional linen and old clothes to make rags.

Rebecca has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional linen and old clothes to make rags.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Hoy en día la fabricación de artesanías es una actividad con la cual muchos habitantes del municipio de Sahagún se ganan la vida y aspira a un futuro prospero.

Tal es el caso de Andres, un hombre que con su habilidad y responsabilidad se ha podido forjar una buena reputación en el medio artesanal.

El fabrica elementos en materiales naturales y sintéticos con sus propias manos.

Con esta actividad aspira a salir adelante y tener una vejez tranquila al lado de su esposa ya que sus 8 hijos son mayores y ya no viven con él.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima como agujas, pinzas y cañaflecha.

Haz que los sueños de Andres Se hagan realidad con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Nowadays, many villagers living in Sahagún are making a living by selling handicrafts in order to have a more prosperous future.

Such is the case of Andres, a man who has been able to build a good reputation within the field of handicrafts for his abilities and the responsible way he approaches his work.

He makes his items by hand using both natural and synthetic materials.

He hopes that his profession will allow him to better his situation and enjoy his old age with his wife now that their eight children are grown and no longer living with him. 

He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as needles, tweezers and wild cane. Please help Andres to make his dreams a reality with this loan!

loans.use: buy raw materials such as needles, tweezers and wild cane.

loans.name: Francacio

texts.en: Francacio is a 60-year-old man. He settled to earn his living in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Over four years, Francacio was able to manage his farm and absolutely meet his needs. Until now, the farm has still been doing well and is giving enough cash flow that he needed. Recently, he took a new loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve his farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Francacio expects an increase in sales so as to expand his farm and make home renovations for a safe and comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve his farm

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Her name is Aileen, 39, and she is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Freddie, a barangay kagawad (elected government official). They have five children; one is in college, two are in high school, and two are in elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her four children to school.

Aileen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells fish and has a boarding house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 3000 a day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh fish, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. Part of the loan she will also use for repair of her rooms for rent. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source for meeting their daily expenses and sending her children to school. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Aileen hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives so hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, fish and repair her rooms for rent.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia junto con su esposo (ver foto) labora en una cafetería de ya mucha tradición pues en el sector llevan operando 14 años, ofreciendo sus servicios y su buena disposición a sus clientes, su negocio lo aprendió empíricamente y gracias a este puede disfrutar un sano pasar del tiempo junto con la persona que ama su esposo, es madre de 2 hijos ya mayores de edad con sus familias y ella puede solventar sus gastos gracias a su cafetería.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en general, pero principalmente comprara granos (arroz, Frijol, café, azúcar, sal) que son los productos que mayor movimiento de venta tienen.
Su sueño es seguir operando, tener salud para trabajar y atender a esos clientes que fielmente le compra un producto diario.
texts.en:
Ligia and her husband (also shown in the photo) work in a cafe that has a good amount of history, given that they have been in business for 14 years, offering their services to customers with a pleasant attitude. She knows the business well and, thanks to this, she is able to live a good life with the person she loves, her husband. She has two adult children who have families of their own, and she is able to help support them with her cafe.

She is applying for a loan to purchase general goods, but mainly to buy staples items (such as rice, beans, coffee, sugar, and salt) which are the products that they sell the most.

Her dream is to continue running her business and to be healthy so that she can continue to work and serve her regular customers who buy from her every day.

loans.use: buy sundry items, mainly staple items (rice, beans, coffee, sugar, and salt) which are the products that sell the most.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 56-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in selling Purchase Order (PO) cards to the people in her place. This card can be used to purchase goods and items in the supermarket or grocery store as a substitution for money. Julieta has been in the business for several years now.

Julieta is asking for a loan to buy more Purchase Order cards. With this, she will be able to sell more PO cards to her customers.

She hopes to make her business sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more Purchase Order cards.

loans.name: Nelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelis, radicada zona rural del municipio de Valencia, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva varios años con su propia cría de pollos y cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de animales para criar y solicitó a la Corporación un crédito con el que adquirirá varios pollos, cerdos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos. 

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus hijos a quiénes intenta sacar adelante.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nelis, based out of a rural area in the city of Valencia, has always worked in the agricultural field along with her family, where she learned these chores.

She has had her own farm raising broiler chickens and pigs for several years, selling and distributing in several areas of her village.

She dreams of increasing the number of animals being raised and requested a loan from the cooperative. With this, she will acquire several chickens, pigs and the ingredients for feeding and sustaining them. The earnings obtained from increasing her animals will be much more and will allow her to have a better standard of living without such financial difficulty. 

Her children, whom she intends to get ahead, depend on this business. Her greatest dream is to have her own home and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to acquire several chickens, pigs and the ingredients for feeding and sustaining them.

loans.name: Olga Susana

texts.es:
Olga una responsable, protectora y celosa madre de dos hijas muy jóvenes de 15 y 7 años las cuales ha podido mantener gracias a su negocio de confección y con el que ha levantado su casa y ha sabido superar las adversidades económicas que se le han presentado. 
Siempre trabaja para mejorar su calidad de vida, de darles que vestir a estas dos mimadas niñas que ven en su madre un gran heroína que trabaja y trabaja por su bienestar. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como telas, hilos, y demás para confeccionar marca propia que sale a vender. 
Apoyen esta heroína que trabaja incansablemente por mejorar el bienestar económico de sus hijas y el de ella.
texts.en:
Olga is a responsible, protective, and vigilant mother of two very young daughters, 15 and 7 years old, who she has been able to support thanks to her dressmaking business. With it, she has built her home and has overcome the economic adversities that have presented themselves to her.

She always works to improve her quality of life, to give clothes to these two darling girls who see in their mother a great heroine that works and works for their well-being.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as cloth, thread, and more to make her own brand that she goes out to sell.

Support this heroine who works tirelessly to improve the economic well-being of her daughters and herself.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and dressmaking supplies, and give her darling daughters a better life.

loans.name: Loregen

texts.en:
