Loregen is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc, Leyte. She is engaged in retail sales of various goods and items to the people in her place.

Loregen is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like soap and toiletries, canned goods and noodles, powdered juice, and frozen goods like sausages and other items.

Through this loan, Loregen will be able to improve her store to attract more buyers.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap and toiletries, canned goods and noodles, powdered juice, and frozen goods like sausages.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from furniture making and raising pigs.  Mila is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Bella has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa inicio la venta de ropa y variedades hace 10 años atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, busco esta actividad como un alternativa de generar dinero y como mujer pujante, verraca pero ante todo delicada y bella busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por su esposo y un hijo. 

Debido al alza de los precios de la canasta familiar, del arriendo, gastos escolares, Rosa se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos y es por este motivo que necesita un crédito que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa, accesorios y lociones para añadirlos a su portafolio de productos. 

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén y sabe que está por buen camino.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena started selling clothes and assorted products 10 years ago, a business learned thanks to a friend. She searched out this business as an alternative way to generate money. As a thriving, mighty, but above all delicate and beautiful woman she desperately looks for support for her home, made up of her husband and son.

Due to the increase of the prices of the cost of living, rent and school expenses, Rosa has found it necessary to generate a larger volume of income. It is for this reason that she needs a loan to help her increase the variety of products that she displays and that she offers daily to her clients and to people door-to-door.

She is asking for a loan to buy stock of clothes, accessories and lotions to add them to her portfolio of products. Her dream is to be able to become the owner of a market, and she knows that she is on track with this goal.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes, accessories and lotions.

loans.name: Len Len

texts.en:
Len Len is 19 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Len Len has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Len Len aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Gerwen

texts.en:
Gerwen is 46 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Gerwen has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Dencita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Dencita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Dencita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her business. Dencita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her children are in school. Her husband has been running his own business of selling clothes for three years. He alone is responsible for feeding the entire family and supporting the household.

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Aliya is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits with the help of this loan. 

Aliya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for her husband's business to resell

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi is 43 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Rubi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purposes.

Therefore, Rubi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Rubi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 20 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết Mai operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Tuyết Mai is 19 years old and married with one child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 20 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. Tuyết Mai lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyết Mai has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Nhung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Nhung is 50 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Celestia

texts.en:
Celestia took her first loan from PMPC in 2008. She is from Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 58 years old and is married. 

Celestia and her husband raise their family together with each other's help. They were stretching their resources to sustain the family's needs especially the education of their children. Celestia liked the idea of starting a bakery business, since she and her husband have baking skills. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers. And she has planned to ramp up her additional revenue for the fast approaching holiday season. 

Celestia is thankful for financing of her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, and yeast to increase her production and provide for more customers

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina has mastered her hog raising business in Dampalan, Lpez Jaena. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. 

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. In the same way as she takes care of her hog raising business, so it is with her PMPC membership. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she always has somewhere to turn to for any financing needs. 

Now, a loan of PHP 5,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that would provide better sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen.

location.town: Plaridel - Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Nhóm 18 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thanh is 46 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 18 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members.  Thanh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 19 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lân operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Lân is 42 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 19 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members.  Lân lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Lân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Yolanda Marina

texts.es: Yolanda de 46 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo comidas rápidas como tortas de pan con aguacate, lechuga, aderezos, jamón, y carne, además vende panes con salchichas, y es gracias a ellos que logra sostener la economía de su hogar. Ella desde hace 7 años cuenta con una vivienda propia en la que habita junto a sus 3 hijos dos niñas de 18 y 15 años y un varón de 10 años de edad y su compañero de vida el cual le apoya con los gastos de su hogar. Yolanda desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este desde hace algún tiempo está presentando filtraciones, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI Para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda Marina, 46 years old, is a hard-working woman that makes a living selling fast food like loaves or bread, avocados, lettuce and dressing, ham, beef and sausage sandwiches. It is thanks to these that she manages to maintain her home economically. 

She has had her own home for 7 years and lives with her three children, two girls of 18 and 15 years of age and a 10-year-old boy, and her life partner who helps her with household expenses. Yolanda wants to improve her living conditions and it is because of this that she decided to replace the roof of her home, which for some time now has had leaks. It is for this reason that she has asked FUSAI for a loan to invest in sheet metal, wood and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make repairs on his taxi. Therefore, Kousar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Kousar's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Kousar also plans to save the profits from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Kousar is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 62 years old. She is married and lives in Dampalan, Lopez Jaena. 

Cerila was truly grateful when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to take on the hog raising business after she learned she can get financial assistance for her chosen business. Cerila has maintained her membership in good standing without any records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hog. This will help give her hog raising income a big boost. She sells one pig at a time, and has planned to buy four piglets after the sale. 

Cerila wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively so that she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hog.

location.town: Plaridel - Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with five children,  all whom are adults and are independent. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mbeyu has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KESs 20,000 she wants to purchase clothing materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Tươi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tươi operates a food stall selling fish. 

Tươi is 38 years old and married with four children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tươi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in making handicrafts and accessories like necklaces, earrings, bracelets and other items. This is the source of her income. For more than five years, Minerva has made and sold accessories in the market for a good price.
 
Minerva is asking for a loan to buy materials for making bracelets and other accessories like wire and string, shells, carved coconut shells, wood and other items. This will enable her to make more and sell more in the market.

In the future, Minerva hopes to improve her way of living and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bracelets and other accessories like wire and string, shells, carved coconut shells and wood

loans.name: Thông

texts.en:
Thông is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thông operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Thông's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Thông hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thảo

texts.en:
Thảo, a 44-year-old married mother of four, lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a service business shipping goods for six years.

One of the critical difficulties concerning Thảo is the absence of a hygienic latrine. She is now requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thảo hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, her children will do well in school, and that she will be able to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thìn

texts.en:
Thìn is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependants.

Thìn works in agriculture planting fruits trees. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

This is Thìn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund forPoor Women.
 
The main hardship that Thìn faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thìn hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to a build toilet.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Dolores works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling curtains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  

Dolores is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional curtains to sell for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream: to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy additional curtains to sell

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Con su gran empuje y perseverancia, Pedro ha salido adelante y ha podido educar y sostener a su numerosa familia conformada por 12 hijos y su esposa.

Siempre ha buscado la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, tanto así que ha pasado por numerosos trabajos en el municipio de Sahagún.

Hoy en día, después de haber decidido por su independencia, trabaja en la fabricación de artículos y objetos artesanales en el material llamado cañaflecha.

Por esta y muchas más razones solicita un préstamo para compra materia prima como cañaflecha e insumos como agujas y pegas.

Con este préstamo podrá asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por ende de su familia.

Si prestas a este crédito estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
With great effort and perseverance, Pedro has gotten ahead and has been able to educate and sustain his numerous family, which consists of his 12 children and his wife.

He has always looked for ways to obtain income for his family, so much so that he has gone through numerous jobs in the town of Sahagún.

Now, after having decided to be independent, he works in making artisanal articles and objects using the material called "caña flecha" [a vegetable fiber that comes from a type of cane].

For this and many more reasons, he is applying for a loan to purchase basic material such as caña flecha and supplies such as needles and glues.

With this loan, he will be able to insure the sustainability of his business and hence that of his family.

If you lend to this borrower, you will be supporting progress and Colombian initiative!

loans.use: to buy materials such as caña flecha [a cane fiber] and supplies such as needles and glue

loans.name: Mary Jill

texts.en: Mary Jill is a 42-year-old mother who owns and manages a retail store within the local community. She aims to further improve her business and increase her income to sustain their daily necessities and provide the financial needs of her children in school. She wants to acquire more items to resell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders of PHP 50,000 to buy more inventories of grocery items, fish, dressed chicken, frozen foods and vegetables to resell. Being a diligent and hard working mother, she believes that someday, she will become successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more inventories of grocery items, fish, dressed chicken, frozen foods and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than three years now. 

Edelita is requesting a loan to buy additional  piglets and animal feed. These purchases will help her improve her business, thereby enabling her to raise healthy pigs. 

In the future, Edelita hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional  piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Fred has been working hard to manage his coffee store, which sells coffee. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of coffee to sell, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and take good care of his family. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business more. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coffee to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids. One of her children attends school and the other is still young. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwanamisi has a fish selling business, which has been operational for the past two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit lives in Gladzor village with her husband. Their son currently lives and works abroad. Margarit works in agriculture. She runs a farm raising two cows, a calf and 30 hens. Margarit's husband works at a local gas fueling station and also helps Margarit with farming work. 

To be prepared for winter, Margarit needs to improve her farm. She asks for this loan to be able to pay for a cow, forage for feeding the livestock, and renovation costs of the barn. The loan will be a huge support to this hardworking and responsible woman, and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, forage for feeding the livestock, and renovation costs of the barn

loans.name: Dúo Peronia Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: DUO PERONIA VILLA NUEVA El cual esta integrado por Leslie Nohemi quien es propietaria de una verdulería y productos desechable y es madre de un niño el cual es de muy temprana edad, la señora Leslie a pesar de ser muy joven de edad ella desde muy pequeña comenzó a negociar y ahora gracias a ello tiene un local el cual va prosperando y creciendo cada día, ella con los ingresos de su negocio ha logrado surtir muy bien su negocio y también ha podido contribuir con algunos proyectos que tiene para su casa y familia ya que dentro de los sueños grandes y prósperos que ella tiene es poder crecer mas y avanzar en su negocio y mas adelante poder aperturar   otro y por eso ella toca la puertas de la fundación para poder invertir aun más en su negocio en la compra de verduras y productos de sechable y con ello poder logra mas ingresos y ganancias y de antemano agradece que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud……
texts.en:
The group "Duo Peronia Villa Nueva" was formed by Leslie Nohemi, who is the proprietor of a stand where she sells fruit and disposable products. She is the mother of a son who is of very young age. Señora Leslie, in spite of being very young, began to do business when she was very little, and now, thanks to that, she has a shop which is prospering and growing every day. 

With the income from her business, she has managed to stock her business very well, and she has also been able to contribute to some projects that she has for her house and for her family, since among her great and flourishing dreams is being able to grow more and advance in her business, and later be able to open another. For this reason, she knocked at the door of the foundation in order to be able to invest even more in her business by buying vegetables and disposable products, and with that, to be able to achieve more income and earnings. 

She is grateful in advance that you consider her request.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and disposable products to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a food vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is 62 years old and has four grown up children. Lucia makes a living through selling home cooked snack foods like suman or rice cake. 

Lucia wants to improve her business. As of now, she is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, coconut milk, ginger, salt and others. With a loan, Lucia will be able to cook and sell more snack foods to the people in her place thus augmenting her income.

In the future, Lucia dreams of making her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, coconut milk, ginger, salt and others

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo de 76 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida con la compra y venta de ganado bovino y porcino actividad que realiza desde hace 30 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia logra obtener muy buenos ingresos. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 18 años de edad desde hace 40 años. Gonzalo siempre busca la manera de apoyar y sacar adelante a su familia, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, para evitar que sus pertenencias se deterioren con las filtraciones que se presentan cada día que cae la lluvia.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 76 years old, and a hard worker who earns a living by buying and selling cattle and hogs.  He has practised this activity for 30 years.  Thank to his experience he manages to obtain very good earnings. 

He has lived in his own house with his wife for 40 years.  Their 18 year old daughter lives with them as well.  

Gonzalo is always looking for ways to support and raise his family, which is why he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: galvanized metal sheet, wood and nails to change the roof of his home, in order to prevent the deterioration of their belongings caused by leaks that occur every time the rain falls.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analina works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruits and root vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

Analina is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fruits and root vegetables to sell for her business. Analina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and root vegetables to sell

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
Dally is 40 years old and blessed with two children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she engages herself in hog-raising to help her husband to generate income. She and her husband aspire to improve their living standards in order to give their children a better life. 

In this regard, she wants to acquire more pigs to raise, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Having this financial assistance, Dally believes that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with two children, one who attends school and the other who is still young. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. With the 30,000 KES loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 50 years old with six children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

This is Belinda's first loan from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Belinda aspires to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Chari has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gent's suits for sale at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase clothing materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Shirinjon

texts.ru: Ширин женщина 45 лет ,замужем, мать четверых детей. Она выросла в сельской местности и с детства помогала родителям ухаживать за скотом, выращивать фрукты и овощи. В настоящее время Ширин работает продавцом кухонных изделий. На рынке она арендует помещение, где и занимается продажей. Так как семья у Ширин большая ,денег от продажи не хватает. Поэтому она ещё подрабатывает швеёй. В скором времени Ширин хочет женить своего сына, но  перед этим хочет привести дом в порядок. Она планирует приобрести мебель ,но на данный момент не имеет нужной суммы .Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Ширин заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Shirinjon is 45, married, and a mother of four children.  She grew up in a rural area, where she helped her parents raise livestock and grow fruits and vegetables as a child.  These days, she earns her living selling kitchenware from a shop she rents at a marketplace.  As she has a large family, Shirinjon is hard-pressed to make ends meet, which is why she also works as a seamstress on the side.  

Shirinjon wants to see her son wed in the near future, and wants to properly outfit her home before the ceremony.  She'd like to buy some furniture, but lacks the money to do so.  To that end, she's seeking a loan from MDO Arvand, and would like to thank them in advance for their support and trust.

loans.use: buy furniture

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from the village of Qaraglukh, where she lives with her husband and 11-year-old son. Her husband is an army officer, and Anahit herself is occupied in agriculture.

She has been running their family farm for 6 years already and perfectly manages to have a successful farming business. On the farm, Anahit keeps 4 cows, 2 calves and some hens. The milk, meat and eggs she gets is processed to dairy products, so Anahit is able to gather income for her family.

To be able to feed the livestock in the winter, and also to purchase a truck for her farm, Anahit asks for this loan. She hopes for lenders' goodwill and support as this loan is very helpful and important for her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed her livestock and to make a prepayment on a truck

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María de 59 años de edad es una mujer admirada por su incansable labor sacando adelante a su familia, vendiendo una gran variedad de verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años recorriendo los cantones y comunidades cercanas. Ella habita junto a sus 4 hijos de 1 año, 9 años, 14 y 18 años de edad que son su razón de existir. María sabe que él techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y evitar así que sus pocas pertenencias se sigan deteriorando por las filtraciones del techo.
texts.en: María, 59 years old, is a woman admired for her tireless work getting her family ahead, selling a large variety of vegetables, work she has done for the past 20 years, travelling around the nearby cantons and communities. She lives with her four children, ages 1, 9, 14 and 18, who are her reason for living. María knows that the roof on her home is deteriorated, so she has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to replace the roof on her home, and in this way prevent her few possessions from continuing to be ruined by the leaks in the roof.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime helps his wife manage their general store for a living. He used his previous loan to buy additional canned goods and assorted grocery items for sale. Aside from this business, he manages their farm and has been raising pigs to sell. With his generated income, he was able to renovate his house and buy a motorcycle for his transportation. He took a new loan recently, to buy new tires and a portion to buy additional grocery goods for his store. He wants to expand the store in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his motorcycle and additional grocery goods for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various groceries like toiletries, soft drinks, canned goods and seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to improve his garden by weeding it and buying sprays

loans.name: Rafael Emilio

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras en el municipio de Montelibano aprovechando que este servicio es muy poco común en su sector, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener a su esposa.

Es un hombre muy aplicado y emprendedor con grandes deseos de salir adelante y ser empresario.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de 5 lavadoras, con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su esposa todo lo que necesite.

Apoya el proyecto de un hombre emprendedor Colombiano!
texts.en:
Rafael is a man with all the energy and disposition to face the world and improve himself.

He wants to open a business renting washing machines in the municipality of Montelibano, making the most of the fact that this service is rare in his sector. With this business, he would be able to have an income to support and sustain his wife.  

He is a very diligent and enterprising man with great desire to get ahead and be a businessman.

He asks for a loan to purchase 5 washing machines, with this loan he will be able to realize his dream of being independent and giving his wife everything that she needs.

Support the project of an enterprising Colombian man!

loans.use: to purchase 5 washing machines.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mesaidi operates a grocery vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and competition. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan de 25 años de edad es un joven trabajador que buscando la manera de ganarse la vida hace 6 años decidió dedicarse a la elaboración pan, actividad que realiza hasta la fecha lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres, su hermano y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad, desde hace muchos años por lo que es muy conocido por sus vecinos que dan muy buenas referencias de él. Juan desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia encementando el piso, sobre todo por su pequeño hijo ya que el piso de tierra con el que cuentan no es el más adecuado para que su hijo habite, y para encementar el piso de su vivienda Juan solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan, 25 years old, is a hard-working young man who, looking for the way to earn a living, decided 6 years ago to work making bread, a job that he does to the present date, which has allowed him to get his family ahead. He has lived in his own house with his parents, his brother, and his young 1-year-old daughter for many years, so he has become well known by his neighbors who give him good references. Juan wants to improve his family's living conditions by cementing the floor, above all for his small child since the dirt floor with which they currently live is not adequate for his child to live with, and to cement the floor of his house, Juan asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and pay labor costs to cement the floor of his house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and pay labor costs to cement the floor of his house.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
El timbre de recreo anuncia la llegada de los niños, todos esperan ser atendidos por Josefina quien ya tiene tres años de tener un quiosco de venta de todo tipo de golosinas y frutas, jugos, y el cual espera seguir atendiendo y hasta ofertar otros productos, desde tempranas horas Josefina se prepara para comenzar un nuevo día de trabajo, el cual obtendrá ganancias que le ayudaran a sustentar la economía de su familia. Josefina tiene una hija que está cursando la universidad y que siempre la ha apoyado en sus estudios, la oportunidad de tener su propio negocio le ha generado mayores ingresos y de esa manera podrá brindarle a su hija un futuro próspero de educación y valores. 
Josefina seguirá trabajando por el bienestar de su  familia y por una estabilidad económica que le brindara una mejor calidad de vida, Josefina solicita el crédito para poder diversificar sus productos y de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas y golosinas. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le ayudara a incorporar en su negocio una mayor cantidad de productos que son de fuerte demanda por sus mayores clientes, los niños, siempre pensando en la salud Josefina también ofrece frutas, para que los niños tengan una comida sana, como metas a futuro tiene incorporar una librería en su quiosco de esa manera seguirá creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
The recess bell announces the arrival of the children, they all wait to be served by Josefina who for three years has had a kiosk selling all sorts of candies and fruits, and juices, and which she hopes to continue running and even to offer other products. From the early hours, Josefina gets ready to begin a new work day, from which she will get earnings that will help her sustain her family economy. Josefina has a daughter who is in university and she has always supported her in her studies. The opportunity to have her own business has generated more income for her and in this way she will be able to offer her daughter a prosperous future of education and values.

Josefina will continue working for her family's well-being and for an economic stability which will afford her a better quality of life. Josefina asks for a loan to be able to diversify her products, and in this way she will be able to increase her sales and earnings. This loan will be used to purchase fruits and candies. She puts her confidence in the loan that will help her to incorporate a greater quantity of products in her business that are in high demand with her best customers, the children. Always thinking of health, Josefina also offers fruits, so the the children can have healthful food. For her future goal, she would like to incorporate a bookstall in her kiosk and in this way she will continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and candies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza lives in the town of Carles, Iloilo in the Philippines. She is 44 years old and has six children. She and her husband are engaged in the fishing business. For over 23 years now, this business has provided Analiza and her family with the income they need.

Analiza believes that fishing is a lucrative business, so she decided to invest in it more. She is now requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers, and hooks. This loan will help her and her husband in improving their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Analiza hopes to make their fishing venture more profitable and stable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers, and hooks

loans.name: Cheezer Kline

texts.en:
Cheezer Kline is 24 years old and single with children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc. to sell.

Cheezer Kline has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Cheezer Kline aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. Emily is married and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Emily has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman and has three school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her highest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, Anne has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling them at the market to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

She is currently requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Eladio Enrique

texts.es:
Eladio es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un negocio en el que vende pipetas de gas para viviendas. 

Inicio el negocio hace 7 años con gran entusiasmo y esperanzas. 

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar varias pipetas de gas más.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Eladio is a man with his batteries charged to face the work and have a full life thanks to his efforts. 

He has a business where he sells gas tanks for homes. 

He began the business 7 years ago with great enthusiasm and hope.

He wants to expand his offering of products and improve his sales, injecting capital into his business. For this reason, he asks for a loan to purchase more of a variety of gas tanks. 

He has great hopes for his business and thinks that his future can improve considerably thanks to the support of these entities that make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to purchase more of a variety of gas tanks.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 31 years old. Anabel works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Anabel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Anabel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Anabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Being a responsible mother, Virginia has been engaged in cooking and selling snack foods and some vegetables within her community. She is 34 years old and blessed with four children. She aims to cook more snack foods and acquire more vegetables to resell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients, seasonings and more vegetables to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and seasonings for cooking more snack foods, and more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Lou works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice farming. 

Mary Lou is borrowing 8,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Mary Lou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with one child whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelina is 54 years old now.

Angelina has a hat making business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her hat making business.

Angelina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her hat making business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with five children, two of them are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 41 years old.

Alma has a food vending business in the Philippines and she requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alma has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Geralyn has been in this business for 10 years. Geralyn earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Marlon Andres

texts.es:
El señor Marlon es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de salsamentaría y restaurante.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo y al apoyo que puede recibir de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar sillas, mesas y surtido de ingredientes en gran variedad, de esta forma podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un veterano lleno de vida y empuje para su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Marion is a very entrepreneurial and creative man. For a long time, he has wanted to be independent and have his own business of a delicatessen and restaurant.

Now he can make his dream real, thanks to his great capacity for work and the help that he can receive from the people who want him to get ahead.

He is applying for economic support to buy chairs, tables, and a stock of a great variety of ingredients. In this way he will be able to accomplish his dream of being independent.

With a loan, you will be able to support a veteran full of life and initiative for his family.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and a stock of a greater variety of ingredients.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 
	
Elina operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over six years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Elina dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 10,000 KES loan she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Bervina

texts.en:
Bervina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bervina is 34 years old and has five children who are in school.

Bervina has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Bervina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Bervina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Bervina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 39 years old and has six children. Andrea has five children who are in school.

Andrea is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Andrea requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Andrea has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Andrea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 48-year-old married woman and has five children, one of whom attends school. 

Victoria is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and she requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vitamins for her cattle.
She has been in the business for 5 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman and has been blessed with kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the school fees for her kids . 
	
Jane operates a poultry selling business which has been operational for over 1 year now. She mentioned that disease outbreak that may cause losses in her chicken as a challenge in the business, but she is working hard to ensure her business continuity.

With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase poultry feeds for her chicken. She joined Yehu to access this loan to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds for her chicken

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transportation cost.

For the past eight years, Julia has operated a clothes selling business; selling door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan that she is requesting, Julia wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access this loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has one child who is 13 years old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells kerosene. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of kerosene. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more stock of kerosene

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a welding service business where he offers welding services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more welding equipment. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big house. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more welding equipment

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a rice vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables. Elvira is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her rice vending business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell in her business

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 41 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Dionisia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables in the last 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Dionisia continues to work tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar paid back her first Kiva loan successfully and thanks to this loan she was able to greatly develop her business and earn good income from it. Now she hopes for her second loan. 

She is still running her business; she has her own shop where she sells fruits and vegetables, candies and juices, bread, butter, cheese, sausages, etc. Gohar’s store is located in a place where there are few shops, and this is why she still has many clients since she started in 1995. 

Gohar’s husband has no constant work so this shop provides the main income for their family needs.  Gohar lives in Sevan city with her husband and their two daughters. Her eldest daughter is a teacher, and the younger daughter is a student at Yerevan State University, studying in the department of philology. All her family members try to help Gohar in the business, especially on the days when Gohar comes to Yerevan city to buy more products for her shop.

Gohar is sure that if she gets her second Kiva loan it will again bring her a lot of income, since she will be able to refresh and enlarge her store’s assortment of goods.

loans.use: to refresh and enlarge her store’s assortment of items to sell.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampot province, Han is 51 years old and a mother of seven children. Nowadays, she needs to support five children, two of whom are in school and one is in university. To support her living, she grows rice on one hectare of land as her main source of income. Moreover, she sells khmer noodles (Nom Banh Jok) to supplement her income. For Han, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more raw materials to make boxes. His business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a quality life and improved profits. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make boxes

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes to sell. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more raw materials to make boxes. His business goal is to have a bigger stall and more production within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have better living standards and improved profits. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make metallic boxes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alma is 37 years old and three of her children are in school.

Alma has a seaweed business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials to use in her business.

Alma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use in her seaweed business

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is a married mother of nine children, all of whom are adults and they provide for themselves. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business; selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Silver has been working hard to manage his store, which sells coffee. 

To help expand his business, Silver has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of coffee to sell, and will help Silver to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Silver hopes that in the future he will be able to see his business expand. 

Silver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Silver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coffee for sale.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
Amadeo de 25 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, entro a una escuela de agricultura donde se graduó como agrónomo y hoy en día está a un paso de graduarse de la universidad en la carrera de administración de negocios. Únicamente vive con su madre.


Amadeo es empleado, trabaja para una institución micro financiera, atendiendo varias comunidades de la zona rural, antes era agricultor, oficio que aprendió trabajando con sus hermanos. El crédito lo necesita para cancelar los gastos de graduación ya que se encuentra en el proceso final de su carrera. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa dar una mejor calidad de vida a su mamá y tener una familia.
texts.en:
Amadeo is 25 years old, single and has no children.  He goes to an agricultural school where he graduated as an agronomist and today is on the verge of graduating from college in a business management career. He currently lives with his mother.

Amadeo is employed.  He works for a micro financial institution, serving several communities in the rural area where he was formerly a farmer.  This is a trade he learned while working with his brothers.

The loan will be used to pay graduation expenses as he is in the final stages of his development. His dream is to finish building his house give a better life to his mom and have a family.

loans.use: to pay the costs of graduation.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 28 años de edad con el cual se apoyan para sacar adelante su hogar. Él es un hombre muy reconocido en su cantón por su solidaridad y su entrega al trabajo, ya que desde hace 9 años se desempeña como albañil independiente realizando trabajos en toda la zona de su departamento. José es un hombre que siempre se esfuerza por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda para tener mas comodidad en la misma.
texts.en:
Jose is 48 years old and lives in his own house with his son,  28 years of age, whom he supports to get ahead.

He is a man well known in the county for his solidarity and commitment to work.  For the last 9 years, he has been an independent mason doing work in the whole area of his county.

Jose is a man who always strives to improve his living conditions and that is why he has decided to apply for a FUSAI loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a room in your home to have more comfort in it.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melly works hard to support her family.

She has a business where she buys and sells coconuts in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.  Melly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional coconuts to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 46 years old and has four children. Bebiana is a married woman and all of her children are in school.

Bebiana is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Bebiana has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins for her cattle.

Bebiana has been in business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to help sustain her business.

In the future, Bebiana would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Yenny Liseth

texts.es:
Yenny, una joven de 27 años, vive en el municipio de Rionegro, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Esta joven de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios para vestir.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Yenny podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara sus estudios y aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido de ropa al por mayor para iniciar con un bien inventario.

Colabora a una joven emprendedora, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Yenny, a 27-year old, lives in the town of Rio Negro, a small town where opportunities to get ahead are difficult and competition in business is pretty tough.

This young entrepreneur with great desires to go forward is planning to start a business selling clothes and accessories.

With the help of a loan, Yenny can fulfill her dream of being independent and able to generate her own income.  With this income, she will pay for her studies and cover to the household expenses.

The money will be invested in the purchase of assorted clothing purchased wholesale to start with a good inventory.

You are invited to contribute to an enterprising, young, creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing wholesale to start with a good inventory.

loans.name: Icyerekezo Group

texts.en: Icyerekezo is a group led by Beatha who is 36 years old. The group name means “vision” in English. She has been a group leader for eight years. She sells clothes and has been doing this for the past eight years. The group members sell different products and they have some ideas for changing their business for a better future. With the loan she would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a male Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more raw materials to make boxes. His business goal is to have improved production within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a better life and improved profits. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make metallic boxes.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a male Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. His business is located in a fertile area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large farm within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a large scale business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Ne

texts.en: A farmer living in Kampong Chhnang province, Ne is 43 years old and a mother of two children. For her family, she earns income to improve her living conditions via rice cropping and pig raising. In addition, her husband climbs palm trees to earn more income. This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Economics. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Economics.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Bernadette is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bernadette has been farming sugarcane for five years and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Khadija operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Cliffton

texts.en: Cliffton is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a carpentry business where he makes sofa sets. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of capentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a pick up for transport. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.  He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soap, bread, drinks, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an area with availability of customers and good infrastructure and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be his small business space. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, sweets, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and educate his children. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to develop his residential place and pay bills.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, sweets, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large farm within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a large scale business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large farm within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area good for business, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cornelia is 55 years old and has one child who is in school.
