Cornelia has a crabs business in the Philippines. Cornelia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials to use like nets, etc..

Cornelia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Cornelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nets to use in her crab business

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes for sale. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a big tailoring shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a better life and improved business profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Crestina

texts.en:
Crestina is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Crestina is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Crestina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Crestina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her business.

Crestina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Crestina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Estrella Alfarina

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad y aun viven con ella, una de ellos estudia en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Estrella es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito, el mismo que  se dedica a la agricultura cultivando arroz, maíz  y verduras en toda época del año ya que tiene terrenos con riego, el cuenta con bombas que llevan el agua desde el rio que está cerca hasta sus cultivos, por lo general son tres cosechas de estos productos que realiza al año y de esta forma ellos logran salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes e insecticidas para tener buenas cosechas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the credit group Amigas Solidarias (United Friends) meet in the parish of Crucita in Puertoviejo Canton.  This lovely place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it which are often visited by domestic and international tourists.  It is known by the name of "Crucita the Beauty."

This is where Estrella lives.  She is 49 and married and has three adult children from this marriage who still live with her.  One of them studies at university.  Her spouse makes a living in agriculture.  Estrella is a good wife and she is taking out a loan to help her husband. She also makes a living cultivating rice, corn, and vegetables year-round since she has irrigated land with pumps that transport water from the nearby river to her crops.  In general, they harvest three times a year and that is how they are able to move forwards.  

She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides so that she can have a good harvest.  She has been in this credit group since the beginning.  Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be competitive. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own many motorcycles within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are honest. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to be a supplier of meat within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 44 years old and widowed with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Azucena has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet David, a 47-year-old father of four adorable children that always bring a pleasant feeling when they are all at home. He hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that is a city of champions because of producing so many elite athletes. 

Being a father of four comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work; hence, David has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of his family. David started farming just after finishing high school since he never advanced his education. Because of the high unemployment rate, he ventured into farming, and he has never regretted this because of the profits he has been making. 

David practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in his village because he is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also doing crop farming. David is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges he has faced is lack of enough capital. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. 

Through the loan David is confident that his life will be transformed and his dream of providing a secure future for his children will be achieved. David is relieved to know that his life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small-scale and aspiring men such as David.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sreypich's Group

texts.en:
Sreypich, a mother of three schoolchildren, is 34 years old and a villager from Kampong Cham province. To overcome the family’s hardship, she sells wood and charcoal as her single source of her income. She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 38,800 KHR(Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the second loan cycle for Sreypich with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her loan to run a new business (grocery items selling). She hopes that she can earn more income from her new business.

loans.use: to run a new business of selling grocery items.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 41 years old, married and blessed with five children. She and her husband are aiming for a happy and successful life to give their children a bright future. With this regard, she helps her husband in gaining income through buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within the local community. She wants to acquire more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional of PHP 7,000 to buy more stocks of cabbages, squash, beans, onions, bananas, potatoes and eggplants to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, squash, beans, onions, bananas, potatoes and eggplants to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells plates, cups, basins and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a secure location and his primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport problems. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, plates, cups and other items. He hopes that in the future he will have a bigger shop. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, plates, cups and other items to sell.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a chemist where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport problems. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of medicine. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of medicine.

loans.name: Cristena

texts.en:
Cristena is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristena is 35 years old and has one child in school.

Cristena has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional clothes, etc. to sell.

Cristena has been in this business for two years. In the future, Cristena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 50 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

Flordeliza has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more curtains, towels, pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more curtains, towels, pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married and has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Catherine operates a retail shop where she sells flour, sugar, washing soap, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be her low income. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking fat and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a different business with a higher income. 

This is Catherine's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open more businesses.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Chhunleng's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Chhunleng is 40 years old and a mother of four school children. To improve her living conditions, she earns an income from rice cropping, and this earns her about 37,400 KHR per day. 

For Chhunleng, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan successfully. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy cucumber and corn seed for her new business. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and corn seed for her new business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Theophil

texts.en:
Theophil is a married man and has 3 children. He describes himself to be organised. 

Theophil operates a retail shop where he sells drinks, and has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are adults. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. 

This is Theophil's second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: Taracisio

texts.en:
Taracisio is married and has four children. He describes himself to be innovative. 

Taracisio operates a retail shop where he sells fruits and vegetables, and has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables. 

This is Taracisio's sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has three children. 

Rose operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.use: buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Prey Veng province, Na is 51 years old and a mother of six children. 

Na secures the needs of her family from rice cropping. She can earn about 34,300 KHR per day to support her family. For Na, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get new a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy cucumber seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to run her new business. She hopes that she can improve her business better than before.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to run her new business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a single woman and has one child. She describes herself to be responsible and faithful. 

Magdaline operates a retail business where she sells rice, phone air time, beauty products and other items. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are faithful. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock and price variations. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, spices, air time, and other items. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. 

This is Magdaline's second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of rice, spices, air time, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, salt, bread and other items.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman and has one child. 

Alice operates a retail business where she sells bananas, onions, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, onions, bananas and other items. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. 

This is Alice's second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, onions, bananas and other items.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 28 years old and works very hard to provide her daily needs.

Cristine has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities. She has now requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Cristine would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Miguel Emiro

texts.es:
Padre de 2 hijos y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señor Miguel de 42 años de edad a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de cerdos pues aspira que con este humilde empleo brindarles una educación universitaria a todos sus hijos.

Ya que para poder progresar y sacar a su familia adelante debe ser capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos y sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para realizar adecuaciones locativas al corral donde tiene albergados sus animales.
 
Miguel está muy motivado con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que su padre se sienta más que orgulloso de sus hijos
texts.en:
A father to two children and with a great desire to see them become professionals is the motivation that fills 42-year-old Miguel with enthusiasm and drive to work indefatigably in his pig pen. With this humble job, Miguel wants to give all of his children a university education.

In order to progress and help his family to get ahead, Miguel must be able to earn enough money to cover costs and not neglect household expenses. Miguel has identified a need to apply for a loan in order to make improvements to the pen where he keeps his animals.

Miguel is very motivated with his plans as his children have good attitudes at school and the ability to do well and make their father even prouder of his children.

loans.use: to make improvements to the pen where he keeps his animals.

loans.name: Maria Lucy

texts.es: Iniciar su empresa, ser alguien en la vida, apoyar a mi hija en todo lo que necesite, darle una oportunidad de estudio, que ella pueda tener una mejor vida que le que le toco vivir, son todas estas preocupaciones que aquejan a la señora María quien quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercancía de la canasta familiar y esa foto que ven es lo que esta mujer quiere comprar e iniciar una nueva vida gracias a interactuar quien llego a sectores tan descuidados por el gobierno dándoles una mano para que sean autosuficientes,
texts.en: Starting a business.  Becoming someone in life.  Supporting her daughter with everything that she needs and giving her the opportunity to study so that she can have a better life than she has had.  These are the worries that trouble Maria, wants to take out a loan to buy household necessities merchandise.  The woman in this photo wants to use these purchases to start a new life thanks to Interactuar, who has arrived in areas that have been neglected by the government to give them a hand towards being self-sufficient.

loans.use: to start her general store business by buying a site and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the walls and floor of her home

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Maria, de 40 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Puerto Salgar, en este negocio vende almuerzos, pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Maria trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar un horno industrial, insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria, 40 years old, has opted to start a food business in her home in the town of Peurto Salgar where she will sell lunches, savory chicken pastries, empanadas, and donuts, among other things.  

Maria works every day from 6 in the morning until 6 at night.  She is a very responsible and sensible woman who is committed to her business.  

One of her unrealized dreams is to have a restaurant that offers different kinds of food and provides employment opportunities.  

She is asking for the economic support to capitalize her business and buy an industrial oven and ingredients such as chicken, oil, and flour, among other things.  

The loan will have a very favorable impact on her life and her business since she will be able to fulfill her dream and offer a wider variety of food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and ingredients such as chicken, oil, and flour, among other things

loans.name: Asolatkhon

texts.en:
Asolatkhon is a hardworking woman, married, she has two children, and she lives in a small village in Tajikistan.

Asolatkhon has always worked in agriculture, growing corn, potatoes, onion and watermelon. She has worked hard in this field for four years. She works from early morning till late evening. She sells this harvest in the local market and that is how she makes an income to provide for the family. 

She always tries to develop her business. Asolatkhon is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds to and to pay for hired workers. This loan will help her to continue her business deal. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
To generate additional income, Melba operates their motorcycle transport within their community. She is 28 years old and has three children. She and her husband work hand-in-hand to earn sufficient income and meet the necessities of their family. 

To continuously operates their motorcycle, Melba needs a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Having this financial assistance, Melba believes that she will earn a higher income and provide a safe transportation to her passengers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, du charbon de bois et de gâteau.
Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente OUMOU, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de gâteaux. Elle compte acheter du sachet plastique, 2 sacs de farine boulangère, 1 sac de sucre, de l’huile et du bicarbonate sur place chez les grossistes et les transforme en gâteaux. Après une heure de cuisson les gâteaux sont ensachés.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group consists of married women who on average are 28 years old with two children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla, part of the Dioïla district in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are active in catering and the commerce of condiments, charcoal and cakes. The Kotognontala group of women are on their fifth group loan. To meet their customers' huge demands, they resort to Soro Yiriwaso.

Group member Oumou, the first person standing from left to right, is illiterate and is currently a vendor of cakes. She plans to buy from local wholesalers plastic bags, 2 bags of baker's flour, 1 bag of sugar, oil and baking powder, to be baked into cakes. After an hour of cooking the cakes are bagged.

Retail sales are made for cash, from her home and sometimes as an itinerant vendor, to a mixed clientele. She expects monthly profits of 45,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to bake cakes

loans.name: Lewis

texts.en:
Lewis is a single man. He describes himself as determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers and goods using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a taxi. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Meren

texts.en:
Meren is 37 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Meren has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Meren requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Meren has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Meren would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Khouloud Group

texts.en:
Khouloud is the featured borrower for Khouloud Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living standards at the same time.

Khouloud is a 38-year-old married mother of two children who started nine years ago working in handicrafts to help her husband in satisfying the needs and expenses of their family.

Due to the increasing living costs, Khouloud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Khouloud is the first lady on the right. With respect to the other group members, Najwa is the lady sitting in the middle, and Fatima is the lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 52-year-old single lady. She is the sole earner of the two members of her family. She started her own tailoring business a year ago.

Alia is a hard-working woman who puts a lot of effort into developing herself especially when she took her first step towards establishing her own business after being employed.

Alia's income is increasing gradually, but she still needs an external financial support to develop her business. Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special textiles and fabrics necessary for her business development, specially for the winter season as she can release her new collection.    

She hopes to expand her business in the future and diversify her services.

loans.use: To buy special textiles and fabrics necessary for her business development.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Aileen is 34 years old and all of her children are in school.

Aileen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her fishing business.

Aileen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her fishing business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 56 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Susana has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Susana has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en:
Arlie is 30 years old, married and has a kid in school.

Arlie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlie has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estelita is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Estelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

Estelita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech, 48, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampot province. She is a mother of seven children, three of whom are in school and one who is in university. To earn a living, she grows rice and raises pigs to improve her family's condition. 

For Pech, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Accounting. She really hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Untak

texts.en:
A young man living in Kampong Thom province, Untak is 24 years old and single. To support himself, he earns income from rice cropping and working for others for a fee. 

This is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his loan portion to pay his school fees - he is majoring in Agriculture. He hopes that he can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay his school fees for his major in Agriculture.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Priston

texts.en:
Priston has a welding shop in Kisumu town. He is 35 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 3 children.

He will use this loan to buy another welding machine as as to be able to serve more customers and earn more income. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to have a prosperous business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children are in school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Alma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is 56 years old and he lives with his family in Kapan city of Syunik region. As Eduard says he will be very happy to have what is already his second Kiva loan, since his first one he paid back fluidly and on time.

For many years, Eduard worked at the shoe factory. But as it closed like many other factories in his region during that period, he established his small business. Using his own car, he gives taxi services around the whole region. This time Eduard’s cooperation with Kiva and Nor Horizon is also connected with his taxi. 

He needs this loan in order to fix a gas cylinder on his car so as to save a lot of money. He must also do some repair works on his car.

loans.use: to fix a gas cylinder on his car and also do some repair works on his car.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, du bois de chauffe et de boisson.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MARIAM, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 1 carton de poisson fumé, du sel, de la potasse, du cube Maggi et des boites de concentrée  de tomate chez les grossistes à Bamako
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group consists of married women, who on average are 37 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, part of the Dioïla district in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are active in catering and trade condiments, firewood and beverages. The Djiguisseme group of women are on their second group loan. To meet their customers' huge demands, they resort to Soro Yiriwaso.

Group member Mariam, the second person sitting from right to left, is illiterate and is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to buy one carton of smoked fish, salt, potash, Maggi cubes and cans of tomato concentrate from wholesalers in Bamako.

Retail sales are conducted from her home to a mixed clientele. She expects monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Jeiner

texts.es:
El señor Jeiner es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños, es por esto que siempre ha querido montar su propio taller de mecánica y hoy en día ve muy posible poder cumplir su sueño de ser independiente. 

El solicita un préstamo para comprar herramienta de mano, una mesa de trabajo y un soporte para motocicletas.

De este modo podrá iniciar con este proyecto y tendrá una mejor motivación para trabajar.
texts.en:
Jeiner is a very experienced mechanic who can work on motorcycles and cars.  He has acquired many capabilities through short courses in various schools and learned other parts of the work in practice.

He is a very hard-working, well-respected man who knows the value that automobiles have for their owners.  This is why he has always wanted to set up his own garage, and today Jeiner sees the possibility of fulfilling his dream of becoming an independent businessman.  Jeiner is asking for a loan to buy hand tools, a work table, and a stand for motorcycles.  With these, he can begin this effort and be well-motivated to work.well

loans.use: to buy hand tools, a work table and a stand for motorcycles

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 41 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc..

Evangeline has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Khim, aged 40, is living in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province and has five children. Nowadays, she needs to support three of children, two of whom are in school and one is in university. She grows rice as her single source of her income. Her family’s daily income is approximately 30,000 KHR per day. 

Khim’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Khim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BADEGNA ont en moyenne 46 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des fruits, des céréales et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur 16 ème   prêt solidaire. NANA, 2  ème  femme  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 paniers de bananes et  des sacs d’oranges. Elle s’approvisionne sur place avec les vergers. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 46 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Badegna group are on average 46 years old with six children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tene / Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship ties and are active in buying and selling fruit, cereals and condiments. Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of the Badegna group are on their 16th group loan.

Nana, the second woman from right to left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 20 baskets of bananas and bags of oranges. She resupplies in local orchards and conducts her sales to both women and men customers, for cash and often on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 46,000 CFA francs that will be spent on health, food, clothing, school fees; the remainder to be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Hugo Alejandro

texts.es:
Hugo un hombre del campo, muy responsable, trabajador, humilde y honrado que heredó de su padre el negocio de cría de cerdos y ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para mejorar lo que su padre le dejo y poder en un futuro dárselo a un hijo que pudiera tener. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar el cuido de cerdo pues este tiene un costo muy elevado y no tiene capital para comprarlo y quiere comprar suficiente para tener para las temporadas que vienen y pensando también en los largos desplazamientos que tienen que hacer para comprarlo. 
Su sueño es poder mejorar las ventas y hacer del negocio de su padre un modelo para los nuevos empresarios criadores de cerdos que nacen cada día.
texts.en:
Hugo, a man from the country, who is responsible, hard-working, humble and well-respected, inherited from his father a business raising pigs.  He has worked hard to improve on what his father left him and be able in the future to pass it on to a son, if he has one.

He is asking for a loan to buy food for pigs becaue this costs a great deal and he has no capital for buying.  Hugo wants to buy enough so that he will have what's needed in the seasons ahead.  He is also thinking about the long trips he has to make to buy the food.  

Hugo's dream is to improve sales and make his father's business a model for the new businessmen in the pig-raising business who are being born every day.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs since due to its high price he can't afford it

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maricel is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maricel has a seaweed business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials to use in her business.

Maricel has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 60 years old, married and has six children. 

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzviminda has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sonora

texts.en:
Sonora is 57 years old and married with nine children. With two children in school, Sonora works very hard to provide for them.

Sonora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Sonora has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Sonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages.

loans.name: Jingkie

texts.en:
Jingkie is 28 years old and married. Jingkie works very hard to provide for their daily needs.

Jingkie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc..

Jingkie has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, eggs, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future, Jingkie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is 28 years old and single.

Renelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like spices, canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

Renelyn has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Renelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like spices, canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

loans.name: Lily Anne Joyce

texts.en:
Lily Anne Joyce is 32 years old and with two children who are in school, Lily Anne Joyce works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, shampoo, etc.

Lily Anne Joyce has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Lily Anne Joyce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, shampoo.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine, an accountant by profession, has been involved in beekeeping for already 7 years. She lives with her husband in Malishka village and currently keeps 30 colonies of bees. As a very skilled farmer, Narine gets high quality honey and sells it locally. 

Narine now asks for this loan to be able to purchase 20 more bees, and sugar as a forage for bees. Narine will be very thankful if lenders help her to fund the needed amount and develop her beekeeping business.

loans.use: to pay for 20 bees, beehives and sugar as a forage for bees.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is an industrious mother from Dulag, Leyte. She is operating a sari-sari (variety) store, and sells items like powdered milk, chips, cooking oil, soap and canned goods. She has been in this kind of business for more than 10 years.  Aside from operating a store, she also operates a motorcycle transport services, where they cater for passengers, transporting them from one place to remote areas, for a fixed fee.  
  
She is married and has five children. Her youngest child is 12. Aileen has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy assorted goods for the store and repair and do maintenance on the motorcycle. 

In the future, Aileen would like to expand both her business to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store and do repair and maintenance on the motorcycle.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and all of her children are in school. She also takes care of one additional family member.

Sauda sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years, and she works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation costs. 

Sauda's goals and aspirations are to build rental houses in the future. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Pheobe has a retail shop which she has been running for 3 years. She is 25 years old and single. She also has a mobile money transfer business and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to pay for her university school fees. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to repay the loan. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: To pay her university school fees.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla is a 45-year-old married mother of five children who has worked as a tailor for 21 years to help her husband in making their living. She works from her house because she can’t afford to open a separate business while she is working hard to develop it as much as she can.

Today, Leyla is requesting her second loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her son's university tuition fees. Her previous loan was invested in buying necessary products and equipment to improve the quality of her productions, and she used part of the loan to help her son to pay for some home construction materials to continue building his own house. 

As for the future, Leyla still hopes to and is working on opening a separate shop outside her house for sewing clothes and is expecting more customers.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA  sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. , AWA  1ère  femme assise de la gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des 10 cartons de savons, 20 paquets de cube Maggi, 50 paquets de biscuits, 50 paquets de bonbons. Elle s’approvisionne à San et souvent à Bla. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 34500 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Siguidia group are on average 36 years old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana / Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship ties and are active in buying and selling various products, cereals and condiments. Having fully reimbursed their previous [individual] loans, the women in the Siguidia group are on their first group loan.

Awa, the first woman sitting on the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 10 cartons of soap, 20 packages of Maggi cubes, 50 packages of biscuits, and 50 packages of candy.

She resupplies in San and often in Bla. Her sales are made to a customer base of women and men, for cash and often on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 34,500 CFA francs to be spent on health, food, clothing, school fees; the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy various products

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma de 26 años d edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 10 años de edad que estudia 3° grado de educación básica; estudio hasta bachillerato, desde que tuvo a su hija trabaja día a día para mantenerla, actualmente vive con sus padres.

Emma es comerciante, vende productos de lencería y joyería desde hace tres años, su hermana le enseño trabajar en el negocio, la mercadería la compra en la ciudad, le acompaña su hermana mayor que ya tiene más experiencia, por las tardes ayuda a su madre con la venta de pupusas en su comunidad, en ocasiones se dedica a la floristería, aprendió desde muy joven este oficio.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar lociones, aretes, pulseras, collares, papel, plástico, alambre y flores de plástico; todo para su negocio de joyería y lencería y para hacer arreglos florales.  Emma sueña que con el fruto de su trabajo pueda construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Emma, 26 years old, is a single mother of a 10 year old girl who is in 3rd grade in primary school. She studied up to secondary school; since she had her daughter she worked day by day to support her. Currently, she lives with her parents.

Emma is a businesswoman, she has sold lingerie and jewelry for the past three years. Her sister taught her how to work in this business. She buys the merchandise in the city, and her older sister accompanies her since she has more experience. In the afternoons, she helps her mother sell pupusas in the community. At times she works as a florist, she learned this skill when she was very young. 

The loan will be used to purchase lotions, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, paper, plastic, wire, and plastic flowers, all for her jewelry and lingerie business and to make flower arrangements. Emma dreams that with the fruit of her labor will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, paper, plastic, wire, and plastic flowers, all for her jewelry and lingerie business and to make flower arrangements.

loans.name: Héctor Augusto

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive don Héctor, tiene 67 años de edad, está casado pero no ha tenido hijos. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Héctor es hombre muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo sacar adelante su hogar, el se dedica a la agricultura, siembra pimiento, pepino, maíz y verduras en  toda época del año ya que tiene terrenos con riego, con bombas que llevan el agua desde el rio que está cerca hasta sus cultivos, actualmente está recogiendo la cosecha de pimiento la cual una vez recolectada la lleva a entregar a comerciantes en el mercado de mayoristas en Portoviejo, así el se gana lo suficiente para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes e insecticidas para tener buenas cosechas. Lleva tres años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In Crucita parish of Portoviejo canton, the members of the Amigas Solidarias communal bank meet. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are very popular with domestic and international tourists. It is known by the name "Crucita the Beautiful".

Héctor lives in this place. He is 67 years old, married, but has not had children. His spouse is a housewife. 

Héctor is a very hard-working man who likes to get his household ahead with his efforts. He works in agriculture, he grows pepper, cucumber, corn, and vegetables all year round since he has irrigated land, with pumps that carry the water from the river that is nearby to his crops. Currently, he is harvesting the pepper, which when harvested he will bring to the business people in the wholesale market in Portoviejo, and in this way will earn enough to get ahead.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and insecticides to have good harvests. He has been in this communal bank for three years and he likes it for the help that the loans offer. His dreams are to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de condiments à l’image de RABOUA qui est la 1ère femme  debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 cartons de cube maggi, 5 cartons de concentrée de tomate avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of six married women who on average are 42 years old with five children. They live in traditional extended families in the Massablacoura area of the city of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacities and improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan was correctly reimbursed.

This group of women trades condiments like Raboua, the first woman standing in the photo from left to right. She intends use her loan to buy 10 cartons of Maggi cubes and 5 cartons of tomato concentrate from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects average monthly profits of 35.000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business activities and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Sokkhea

texts.en:
Sokkhea is a 38-year-old married farmer with three children living in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2005. Two of the children attend school. 

Sokkhea's husband is 37, and he has a removable shed, chairs and tables to rent for weddings or other ceremonies. Together, they can earn approximately $10 per day. 

To improve her husband's service, Sokkhea would like to request a loan for her husband to buy another removable shed and tables to rent. This loan will help her husband earn more income for the family. 

In the future, Sokkhea wants to run a small grocery store at home and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy more removable shed and tables for rent

loans.name: Amaury Alberto

texts.es:
Amaury, de 26 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidido a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Desea iniciar con un negocio de venta de mercancía como ropa y accesorios de vestir.
Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es un joven emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la vida para ser independiente

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables.

Impacta la vida de Amaury con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Amaury, 26 years old, is very clear about what he wants for his life and has decided to finish his education to continue onward and have a good life.

He wants to open a business selling merchandise such as clothing and accessories.

He wants to start this work with the eagerness of seeking out the necessary resources for its sustenance and for his schooling and also to be able to contribute to the household expenses.

He is an enterprising and very disciplined young man. 

He asks for a loan to purchase a wide variety of clothing in bulk and in this way take advantage of the opportunity life presents him to be independent. 

He has the hope to be able to progress as a businessman and have some more stable income. 

Impact Amaury's life with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Luchadoras De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo mujeres Luchadoras de buena Vista la señora Beatriz quien se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta de todo tipo de refacciones como tamales, paches, chuchitos, carnitas, chiles rellenos venta de chamarras mexicanas, nacionales y cosméticos como cremas, lociones, talcos, desodorantes para damas, caballeros y niños.  Nuevamente necesita otro préstamo para poder invertir en sus ventas, hay varios pedidos que le han hecho pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso pide otro préstamo y así poder comprar todo lo que le hace falta como la hoja del tamal, tomate por caja, diferentes tipos de carnes, desea aprovechar las ofertas de lociones que vienen en los catálogos, y comprar un poco de chamarras para no quedarles mal a sus clientes que siempre la visitan para comprar.  Su sueño sigue siendo tener un gran lugar propio para algún día dejar de ser vendedora ambulante.
texts.en: The Mujeres Luchadores group in Buena Vista includes Beatriz who has worked for 9 years selling all sorts of snacks such as tamales, paches (potato-based tamales), chuchitos (smaller, meat tamales with a tomato sauce), barbecued pork, and stuffed chiles. She also sells Mexican and national jackets and cosmetics such as creams, lotions, talcum power, and deodorants for women, men and children. She needs another loan to be able to invest in her sales. There are several orders that have been made but the money she has isn't enough, so she asks for another loan, to be able to purchase everything that she needs, such as tamal leaves, boxes of tomatoes, and a variety of meats. She wants to take advantage of the lotion sales that are in the catalogs, and purchase some jackets so as not to disappoint her customers who always come to buy things. Her dream is continues to be having her own nice place to be able someday to stop being a street vendor.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell snacks.

loans.name: Dúo Amarilis De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo Amarilis de Buena Vista La encargada de este grupo es la señora Amarilis quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general como tónicos, cremas, tratamientos para cabello, perfumes para damas caballeros y niños, cremas especiales para el rostro, labiales, delineadores, champo, colonias, talcos.  Hay varios pedidos de cremas especiales que le han pedido pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza desea comprar mas producto porque le están ofreciendo buenas ofertas por eso necesita más dinero para aprovechar los pedidos que tiene y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.
texts.en: The leader of the "Dúo Amarilis de Buena Vista" is Amarilis who works selling cosmetics like toners, creams, hair treatments, perfume and cologne, special facial creams, lipstick, eyeliner, shampoo and talc powder. She has a number of orders for special creams that clients have requested but the money she has is not sufficient to buy more product. They are offering good specials so she needs more money to take advantage of the requests that she has and not disappoint her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 39 years old and married. She owns and manages a retail store within her community. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to satisfy the necessities of her family and save for the future of their children. She aspires to increase her product offerings, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy more inventory of grocery items, rice, frozen foods and soft drinks to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of grocery items, rice, frozen foods and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOUTOURA est constitué de 5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  pagnes à l’image de AWA qui est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 6 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Soutoura group is made up of five married women who average 27 years of age with four children each. They live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura district of the town of Bougouni. They got to know each other as neighbors, through friendship and business. They joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to increase their financial capacity and carry out their businesses more effectively; they are on their second loan. The previous loan was repaid in full. 

This group of women have businesses selling "pagnes" (pieces of brightly-colored African cloth) and this is the case for Awa, who is the woman sitting in the photo. With her loan she is planning to buy six pieces of "pagne" fabric from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells her goods at the market and from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA which will be used to invest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marnie works hard to support her family.

Marnie has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marnie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Marnie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 53 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide their needs.

Julieta is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been in this business for 22 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Mila

texts.en:
Ma. Mila is 46 years old and married with four children who are all in school.

Ma. Mila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Mila has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ma. Mila aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 71 años de edad, tubo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta 4° grado. Es casado padre de 3 hijos.

José trabaja como ordenanza desde hace ocho años, él tiene un amigo el cual le ayudo a entrar a la empresa en sus ratos libres se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo para hacer este trabajo y su esposa le ayuda en las labores del hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera para la producción.

El sueño José es en un futuro obtener un crédito mas grande y aumentar su ganado y poder tener mejores ganancias las cuales invertirá en el pago del crédito y para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 71 years old and was able to study up to fourth grade. He is married and the father of three children.

José has been working as a general assistant for eight years. He has a friend who helped him get into the company. In his spare time, he works in agriculture and livestock with the help of his son. His wife helps him in household tasks.

He is asking for a loan to buy a dairy cow so that he can sell the milk.

José's dream is to get a larger loan in the future, buy more livestock and thus increase his earnings which he will then invest in repayment of the loan and in the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so that he can sell the milk

loans.name: Enri Jiovanny

texts.es:
Enri de 29 años de edad, está acompañado y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica, no pudo seguir estudiando porque su padre los abandono desde pequeños y su madre no pudo darle el estudio. Su pareja es comerciante, tiene una tienda y vende bebidas y bocadillos los fines de semana en la cancha de futbol. Vive con su madre hermanas y su pareja.

Enri realiza diversos trabajos, es ayudante de albañil, trabaja como agricultor, jornalero y en ocasiones ayuda a su pareja con la el negocio. El préstamo será utilizado para pagar mano de obra para cosechar el maíz y el frijol, una parte será invertida en el negocio y otra para cubrir unos gastos personales.

El sueño más añorado de Enri es construir su propia casa para vivir con su pareja.
texts.en:
Enri, 29 years old, is partnered and doesn't have children. He went to school up to 5th grade in primary school. He couldn't continue going to school because his father left them when they were little and his mother couldn't provide him with an education. His wife is a businesswoman, she has a a store and sells drinks and snacks on the weekends at the soccer fields. He lives with his mother, sisters, and partner. 

Enri does a variety of jobs, he is an assistant bricklayer, works as a farmer, a day labor, and sometimes helps his partner with her business. The loan will be used to pay labor costs to harvest corn and beans, a part will be invested in the business, and another part will be used to cover personal expenses. 

Enri yearns to build his own house to live with his partner.

loans.use: to pay labor costs to harvest the corn and beans, and a part will be invested in the business and another part to cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Blanca Maria

texts.es: Blanca tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 19 y 26 años de edad, Blanca vive con  su  esposo, dos hijos y un nieto de 4 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando,  Blanca se dedica al jornal y a la comercialización de ganado desde que era niña ya que dice que sus padres  la llevaban a los mercados a ayudarles en este negocio y es asi que adquirió experiencia en este negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de toretes para revenderlos en la feria de ganado y trabajando de esta manera es como logra traer el pan de cada dia a sus hijos y nieto.
texts.en:
Blanca is 45 years old, married and has 3 children aged 11, 19 and 26. Blanca lives with her husband, two of her children and a four-year-old grandson who goes to  school.  

Blanca has been working as a  day-labourer and raising and selling livestock since childhood. She says that her parents used to take her to help at the markets and so she gained experience in the business. She is going to invest this loan in buying young bull calves for resale at the cattle fair. This is how she is able to support her children and her grandchild.

loans.use: to buy young bull calves

loans.name: Braulio Group

texts.es:
Al grupo solidario Braulio lo integran tres socios emprendedores, es coordinado por la señora Norma, quien tiene la edad de 42 años, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, dependiendo económicamente uno de ellos, se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad y en uno de los mercados de la capital, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo, ya que este es uno de los productos que más demanda tiene, lo que le permite obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias, es el décimo octavo financiamiento que recibe para su negocio, por lo que asegura que los logros han sido múltiples como es que ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos en su negocio lo que le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
El resto de las integrantes son el señor Álvaro de 37 años de edad, quien elabora delantares y los comercializa en el mercado de la municipalidad y en el más populoso de la capital, y el señor Pedro de 26 años comerciante de productos varios como es cuadro para fotos, abanicos, colchas, etc., estos productos los comercializa en sectores aledaños a su comunidad.
texts.en:
The Braulio group is made up of three enterprising members. It is coordinated by Norma, who is 42 years old, partnered and mother of three children who depend on her economically. She works buying and selling crops in the municipal market and in one of the markets in the capital. The loan that she asks for is to purchase a tamarind crop, since it is one of the most demanded products, which will allow her to have a larger profit margin. This is the eighteenth loan that she is getting for her business, which shows that she has had multiple successes such as managing to diversify the products she offers in her business which has allowed her to improve her family's living conditions.

The other members are Álvaro, 37 years old, who makes aprons and sells them in the municipal market and in the largest market in the capital, and Pedro, 26 years old, who sells a variety of products such as photo frames, fans, quilts, etc., in sectors near his community.

loans.use: to purchase the tamarind crop.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUIDIA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution  de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de pagnes à l’image de OUMOU qui est la 1ère femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 7 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sigidia group is made up of five married women who are of an average age of 38 with four children. They live in nuclear families in the Torakabougou district in the town of Bougouni.
They met through family, business, and friendship contacts.
To increase their financial capacity in order to run their activities better, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is their second loan. The previous loan was repaid correctly. This group of women sells pagne traditional dresses like Oumo, who is the woman standing first on the left in the photo. With her loan she plans to buy seven pagnes from the wholesalers in Bougoni. She sells her products at the market and from home, for cash and for credit to a mixed clientele. 
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45.000FCFA that she will use to reinvest in her business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Solome

texts.en:
Solome lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children. All her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent for her shop. 

Solome operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to buy crates of soda. Her major business challenges are seasonality and electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a fridge so as to keep her soda and other drinks cold.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda

loans.name: Jacinta Carmita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacinta, tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es agricultor.
