Doña Jacinta es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella dedica a la preparación de alimentos, tiene un  pequeño comedor en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días y prepara deliciosos almuerzos los mismos que son muy apetecidos por sus clientes que siempre llegan a su local a comer, lleva seis años con este negocio el cual le da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles la mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the "Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias" communal bank meet in the Crucita Parish of Portoviejo Canton. It is known for it's beautiful beaches that surround this beautiful place, It is visited a lot by foreigners and nationals and is known by the name of 'Crucita the Beautiful'.

Jacinta lives here. She is 57 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has four adult children from this relationship and one of them still lives with her. Her husband is a farmer. Jacinta is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses.

She works making meals. She has a small cafe in her house. She works here every day and prepares delicious lunches which are fancied by her clients who always come to her place to eat. She has run this business for 6 years, which has provided her with enough to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy fish and other food to prepare her meals. She has been in the communal bank since it's initiation and she likes it because of the support provided by the loans. Her dream is to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and other food.

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Heremakono ont en moyenne 27 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, céréales (maïs), charbon du bois et tubercules. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïchatou (femme  arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de céréales (maïs). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aïchatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married into polygamous families, the four members of the Heremakono group are, on average, 27 years old and have 5 children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the commune of Mandé, in Kati. The group members know each other from neighborhood ties and their work in Kanadjiguila. 

The group members work in small-scale commerce, selling cereals (corn), firewood, and tubers. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their second group loan.

Aïchatou (the woman on the far right in the photo) is a large seller of cereals (corn). She plans to use her loan to buy 10 sacs of corn at wholesale in Médeine. Sales are made at retail in Kanadjiguila by traveling door-to-door to mostly female customers. 

With this loan, Aïchatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to meet her family's smaller needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Âgée de 62ans avec en charge 01 enfant, madame Ayaba est retraité. Pour mieux se prendre en charge, elle a démarré la vente des produits alimentaires à domicile en 1998 et se fait aidée par 01 personne. Pour renforcer son activité, elle demande un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
At 62 years old, with one child under her care, Ayaba is retired. To take better care [of her family], she started selling food products from her home in 1998. She is helped by one person.

To strengthen her business, she is seeking a second loan with WAGES to buy goods.

Profits will allow her to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Simean's Group

texts.en:
Simean, 32 years old, is a local farmer living in Kampong Speu province. She is the mother of two children: one is in school and the other one is too young. She grows rice as her main source of income. She can earn income of about 35,000 riels per day. 

This is Simean's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this group of eight members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family's access to clean water to use as other families have done.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, tiene la edad  de 66 años, está viuda, vive con un hijo y un nieto  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos pollos de engorde con el objetivo de darles una alimentación adecuada para poder venderlos con el peso adecuando a sus vecinos y lugares aledaños. Con esta actividad  espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rosa is 66 years old. She is a widow who lives with her son and a grandchild who are her main priorities. With this loan she plans to buy a number of chickens with the goal of giving them an adequate diet to be able to sell them at a good weight to her neighbors and the surrounding communities. With this business she hopes to obtain some profit and improve the living conditions of her family and also fulfill a few goals. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR . She has not had any loans from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Amélévi est une dame de 44ans qui se bat chaque fois pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer. Elle a pour mari un couturier et maman de 05 enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, Amélévi revend aussi des produits cosmétiques, des mèches et des pagnes dans son atelier qu’elle a ouvert en 2008. Avec son quatriéme crédit, elle va s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut assurer la stabilité de son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Amélévi is 44 years old and works hard each day to help her husband, who is a dressmaker, with the household expenses. She is the mother of five children.

A hairdresser by profession, Amélévi also sells cosmetics, hair extensions, and pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] in her shop, which she opened in 2008.

With her fourth loan, she is going to procure merchandise in order to better respond to her customer's needs. She wants ensure the stability of her business and her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for resale

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Horonya  ont en moyenne 28 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies, habits industriels, jus et charbon du bois. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sétou (femme arrêtée en 2èmeposition de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de friperies de plusieurs sortes (serviettes, culottes, chemises, draps de lit, etc.) Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  4 balles de friperies en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sétou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly into polygamous families, the five members of the Horonya group are, on average, 28 years old and have four children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the commune of Mandé, in Kati. The group members know each other from neighborhood ties and from their businesses in Kanadjiguila.

The group members work in small-scale commerce, selling used clothing, work clothing, juice, and charcoal.

In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their second group loan.

Sétou (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is a large seller of used clothing [and fabrics] of different kinds (towels, pants, shirts, linens, etc.). She plans to use this loan to buy four bales of used clothing at wholesale in Médine. Sales are made at retail by traveling around door-to-door in Kanadjiguila to mostly female customers.

With this loan, Sétou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to meet her family's smaller needs.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Mariavel

texts.en:
Mariavel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mariavel is 24 years old and two of her children are in school.

Mariavel has a seaweed business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials to use in her business.

Mariavel has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mariavel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use in her seaweed-growing business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, 32 years old, is a married woman with four children. Three children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melanie has been in this business for six years.

Melanie requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Analyn has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a 44-year-old married woman with eight children, six of whom are in school.

Estelita is in the agriculture business, selling livestock, in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock.

Estelita has been selling livestock for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Twifatanye Group

texts.en:
TWIFATANYE is a group led by Godelive who is 40 years old.  The group name means “be together” in English. Godelive has been a group leader for four years. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for four years. The group members sell different items and they have the same ideas for changing their businesses for a better future. 

With the loan requested, Godelive would like to buy more bananas and Irish potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs dixièmes prêts solidaires avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame SALIMATA  fait la vente de pagne wax réal dans ce groupe de femme DANAYA. Elle est débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 10 pièces de  pagnes wax réal  au grand marché,  elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses marchandises.
Elle les revend à OUAYERMA I à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 44 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Danaya group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have two children. They mostly live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular areas in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. The group is on their 10th group loan with Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. All of the previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Salimata, who standing first on the left in the photo, works selling real wax pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]. She is highly sought after by her customers because of her quality products. 

With this loan she plans to buy 10 lengths of real wax pagnes from the grand market. She makes her resales in Ouayerma I to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Salimata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 44,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and another part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy real wax pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Lomen

texts.en:
Lomen owns and operates a business selling food in her community to earn a living. She has been in her business for three years and is earning well to sustain their living. 

Improving the business has become easier with Lomen's access to Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase meat (pork, beef and chicken) and assorted drinks. She plans to take on catering services in order to gain more revenue. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat (pork, beef and chicken) and assorted drinks

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo vit avec son conjoint coiffeur et leurs 02 enfants de 14 et 6ans à Lomé. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Elle est couturière de profession et en même temps revendeuse de pagnes dans son atelier depuis 2012. Ses approvisionnements se font au Grand Marché de Lomé et son premier crédit lui servira à acheter des pagnes afin de répondre aux besoins des clients en cette période de fin d'année. Elle espère agrandir son activité et contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjo lives in Lomé with her husband, who is a hairdresser, and their two children, who are 14 years old and six years old. Both of the children go to school.

Adjo is a dressmaker by profession and has also been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] in her shop since 2012. She procures her goods from the Lomé Grand Market. This first loan will serve to buy pagnes in order to better respond to her customers during this end-of-the-year period.

She hopes to expand her business and help support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Emmieren

texts.en:
Emmieren is a 34-year-old married mother of 3 children and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has a retail store that sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income. 

Emmieren has been in this field for 3 years. She is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to help improve their living situation.

Emmieren requested this  loan to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and grains to sell in her store in order to increase her sales. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she could possibly repair their house for a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and grains to sell in her store in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Mirtha Soledad

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirtha, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Mirtha es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante y con esto  ayudarle a su marido el cual por motivos de enfermedad no puede trabajar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos de catalogo de Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres a cuatro  días a la semana a sus recorridos y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es justamente para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias" communal bank meets in the Crucita Parish of Portoviejo Canton. It is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this place. It is much visited by nationals and foreigners and is known by the name of "Crucita the Beautiful".

Mirtha lives here. She is 51 years old, is married and from this relationship has two adult independent children. Her husband does not work because of his health. Martha is a fighter who has had to work very hard to get ahead. Doing this she can help her husband who because of sickness cannot work.

She works in commerce, selling Yanbal products from catalogs (products for beauty, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She sells from door to door. She goes out 4 days a week on her rounds and also sells in her house to the clients she knows best. She leaves her products on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been doing this for 7 years and she makes her living through it.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, costume jewellery and cosmetics. She has been a member of the communal bank since it's beginning and she likes it because of the support that the loans provide. Her dream is to press on.

loans.use: to buy perfume. cream, costume jewellery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Seangmeng's Group

texts.en: Seangmeng is a resident in Kampong Cham province and a mother of two children. She is a doctor who raises chickens and ducks to earn extra income to support her family. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy piglets and pig feed to support her new business. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed to support her new business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 54-year-old married mother of ten children.

Delia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

Delia has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Channin

texts.en: Channin is a second-year student at university and a 20-year-old daughter living with her parents in Kratie province of Cambodia. Because of a lack of finances, she decided to secure a loan to pay her university fees. With this loan, she will finish her second year successfully. For her future, she wants to find a good job with a reasonable salary so she will be able to help her family.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar, a mother of two school-aged children, is involved in farming. On her farm, she keeps eight cows, calves, and hens. She has some income from her nice fruit garden as well, which gives a perfect harvest of peaches, cherries, quinces, figs and nuts. On her plot of land she cultivates sunflower, which she also sells in the local markets. 

This nice woman in the pic now asks lenders to support her farm. Gohar is asking for this loan in order to purchase animal fodder for her farm cattle. This will help her to feed the cattle during the winter and will be a big support for the farm.

loans.use: to pay for animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. Alima owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Alima has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jerusalen Group

texts.es: El grupo Jerusalén está conformado por tres mujeres, con edades y negocios diferentes, pero con un solo propósito, salir adelante en la vida y llevar de la mano a su familias, por quienes luchan cada día, para mejorar el bienestar, lo coordina la señora Cintia, una joven a quien la vida le enseno a trabajar a muy corta edad y de esta manera aprender la responsabilidad que se adquiere al tener un negocio, tiene 22 años de edad, soltera por lo cual invierte más tempo en el negocio, y con experiencia en la venta de perecederos, solicita el crédito para la compra de sandias, piñas, bananos y papayas. Los demás integrantes son, Elsa una señora de 46 años, con experiencia en lo que es el servicio de comida, principalmente a trabajadores de la zona franca cercana a su comunidad, y Estebana quien tiene la edad de 42 años propietaria de un tramo en el mercado de la municipalidad donde ofrece calzado para damas y caballeros.
texts.en: The Jerusalén group is made up of three women of different ages and with different businesses. They have one purpose: getting ahead in life and taking their families, for whom they fight every day, to a better well being. Cintia is the coordinator. Life taught her to work at a very young age and that is how she learned the responsibility acquired by having a business. She is 22 years old and single, so she invests more time into the business. With experience selling perishable goods, she is asking for the loan to buy watermelons, pineapples, bananas, and papayas. The other members are: Elsa, aged 46, who has experience in selling food mainly to workers in the free trade zone close to her community, and Estebana, who at 42 is the owner of a spot in the town market where she sells shoes for women and men.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende finos muebles, tiene 12 años de dedicarse al negocio y ya tiene clientes establecidos por la calidad de su trabajo y los buenos precios, ella esta  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old. She lives in her own house, together with her husband and their three children. She has a carpentry workshop where she makes and sells fine furniture. She has been working at this business for 12 years and has established customers through the quality of her work and her good prices. She is requesting a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in her business, in buying wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other articles that will attract more clients, so she can achieve her objective of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds and other items

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah has a secretarial services business, doing photocopying, scanning and typing among other services. She has been running this business for six  years. She is 30 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She also sells clothes and shoes.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria de 63 años de edad vive con sus dos nietos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de huevos su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 18 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es muy vendible y lo da a un precio muy accesible, ella está solicitando un  crédito para la compra de mas huevos por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 63 years old and lives with her grandchildren in a house she owns. She makes a living by selling eggs; her business has been located in her home for the last 18 years. With the earnings she obtains from her sales she manages to cover her household expenses. She has a lot of customers as her product is very popular and she sells it at a very affordable price. She is asking for a loan to buy more eggs wholesale to continue with her sales and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more eggs wholesale

loans.name: Kanouya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe   KANOUYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédants ont été correctement remboursé.
Madame  DOUBAKAN  débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes   KANOUYA, fait la vente des oignons.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 paniers des oignons au grand marché pour la revendre en détail à une clientèle composée des femmes au comptant et à crédit à OUAYERMA I. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the group called Kanouya are married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, four children each. They mostly live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their third solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Madame  Doubakan, the first person standing from right to left in this photo of women from the Kanouya group, sells onions. She intends to use her loan to buy two baskets of onions at the big market to resell, retail, to a clientele composed of women, for cash or credit, in Ouayerma I. She is much sought after by her clientele for the quality of her produce. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 28,000 francs CFA of which part will be used to repay the loan and its interest and the other part put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Dúo Alma Isabel De Buena Vista Isabel Group

texts.es: Dúo Alma Isabel de Buena Vista isabel La señora Alma es la encargada de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general como cremas, talcos, colonias, perfumes, ropa de catalogo como playeras, blusas, cubrecamas, joyería de cátalo como aretes, pulseras, anillos, juego de collares y mas desde hace 9 años.  Es vendedora ambulante también de chamarras y juegos de ollas, sartenes y picheles de aluminio.  Tiene varios pedidos que las personas le han hecho y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso necesita otro préstamo para comprar un poco de todo lo que vende para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y no fallarles en sus pedidos.
texts.en: The Alma Isabel Duo from Buena Vista. Alma is the leader of this group. She has been selling general cosmetics such as creams, powders, colognes, perfumes, and catalog clothing such as t-shirts, blouses, and bedspreads, as well as catalog jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, rings, and necklace sets for 9 years. She is a street seller and also sells jackets and aluminum sets of pots and pans and pitchers. She has several orders that people have made and the money she has isn't enough. That is why she needs another loan to buy a little of everything that she sells to offer to her customers and not leave their orders unfilled.

loans.use: to buy products for domestic use.

loans.name: Savsanby

texts.en:
Savsanby was born in 1969 year. She is a very kind woman. Savsanby is married and has four children. She always tries to offer a high quality of living conditions to her family. Savsanby’s husband is a migrant in Russia. She works in a local school. She is an experienced teacher, as she has worked more than 24 years in a school. She has a good rating among her colleagues.

Savsanby’s daughter studies at the university. She studies well. Savsanby must pay for tuition of her daughter at the university, and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition of her daughter at the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and high transportation costs. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dianca Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Dianca lo integran tres socios exitosos que dia a dia buscan el bienestar de su familia y su superación personal, quien lo coordina es Olga, a sus 51 años y con dos hijos a cargos es capaz de acomodar el tiempo entre su familia y su negocio, ofrece el servicio de venta comida principalmente a trabajadores de zona franca cercana a su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, plátano verde, plátano maduro, aceite, pastas, zanahorias, repollo, lechuga, etc., ya que con el crédito anterior logro comprar utensilios que le ayudan a brindar mejor calidad a su servicio; esta socia cuenta con un buen grupo de trabajo uno de ellos es Jesenia una mujer de 26 años de edad y quien tiene un año de experiencia en la venta de cosméticos, y Josué un joven emprendedor de 27 años, quien administra su negocio de venta de calzado y de pan, con experiencia de cuatro años.
texts.en: The Dianca support group is made up of three successful members who seek their family's well being and personal achievement. The coordinator is Olga. At 51 years old and with two children, she is capable of making time for her family and her business. She sells food mainly to worker in the free trade zone close to her house. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, green plantains, ripe plantains, oil, pasta, carrots, cabbage, lettuce, etc. With the previous loan, she was able to buy utensils to help her offer a higher quality service. She has a good work group. One of them is Jesenia, a 26 year old woman with a year's experience selling cosmetics, and Josué, a 27 year old entrepreneur who runs his business selling shoes and bread, with four years' experience.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives with her husband and daughter in the village of Qaradzor. From a young age, Karine has been farming with her husband, who with their son works as a migrant worker; in the winter season they come home. 

On her farm Karine has two calves, two cows, and 20 chickens. She also cultivates wheat, potatoes and cabbage as well as different fruit trees (apple, pear and nut). The farming activity fills Karine's day, and she is very happy with it. 

Karine is asking for this loan in order to purchase two calves and forage for feeding the livestock (hay).

loans.use: to pay for 2 calves and forage for feeding the livestock (hay)

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is a thirty-seven-year-old, married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She raises and sells hogs. Aside from raising hogs, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells items like noodles, canned goods, biscuits, sugar, and soap. She has been in that kind of business for five years. She and her husband have four children. Her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 2 years old.

Ana Mae has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will use it to buy three additional piglets and pig feed, and to put into her sari-sari store as additional capital. Because of these uses, she could now sell more goods, increasing her earnings from the store, as well as raise and sell more pigs in the coming months.

Ana Mae would like to expand her both businesses, in order to provide her children with quality education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three additional piglets and pig feed, and to grow her sari-sari store

loans.name: Meat

texts.en: A woman living in Kampong Chhnang province, Meat is 64 years old and a mother of five children. To support her family, she earns an income from selling wood and charcoal. This is Meat's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loan successfully. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy solar panels. She hopes that she can improve her family's access to electricity, as other families have.

loans.use: To buy solar panels.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Huon's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Huon is a mother of three children. She provides for the needs of her family via rice cropping; it earns her about 22,000 KHR per day. For Huon, this is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, Huon will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family can have clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Jagat Janani Group

texts.en:
In the year 2013, a women entrepreneur named Kamini of Bissamcuttack village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a group with twelve other women of her locality named “Jagat Janani” with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation. The lady standing first from the left, raising her hand in the photo, is Kamini. She is 46 years old, living with her husband and two daughters aged 12 and 18 years old. She belongs to a Below Poverty Line family (BPL), a segment living on less than a dollar a day. 

Kamini is doing vegetable vending with the support of her husband. She is selling vegetables at her home, whereas her husband moves around to all weekly markets to sell vegetables. Kamini herself started this enterprise five years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. Her family earns a monthly income of 6,500/- INR which is scarcely enough to manage the family with educational, domestic and business expenses.

 Due to lack of finances, Kamini is not able to complete the construction of her house. So she is planning to expand her business. From the present loan she will purchase a stock of brinjal (eggplant), tomatoes, green chili, ginger, garlic, curly flower, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers and all green vegetables with a large quantity of potatoes and onions. Kamini dreams of completing the construction of her house and giving better education to her children. 

The other twelve members of the group are doing vegetable vending, fast food, fish business, fruit business, chicken center, and puffed rice businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of brinjal (eggplant), tomatoes, green chili, ginger, garlic, curly flower, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers and all green vegetables with a large quantity of potatoes and onions

loans.name: Sambedana Shg Group

texts.en:
Smita, along with nine other women, is a member of Sambedna SHG, which is situated at Koraput district of Odisha, India. She is a 27-year-old woman and lives with her husband and children. Her husband is a daily wage labor and his income is not  sufficient to run their family. 

Smita is just a housewife but she has a skill of stitching  and she used to stitch when she was unmarried.  She wants to buy a sewing machine, so she has requested  a loan amount to get it. Through tailoring she wants to improve her way of living and also wants to send her children to school. She wants her children to be educated and  has a desire to live a peaceful life.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha is 44 years old, a married rice farmer with three children who lives in Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1995. Her first child is a garment-factory worker and two others are students. Her husband is 45; he buys coal and firewood to resell. Together, they can earn approximately $20 daily. To improve her rice farming, Sokha would like to request a loan to buy fertilizer. With this loan she will get better crops. For her future plans, she wants to buy cows to fatten and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 53 years old and widowed with 6 children. She has been in the farming business for 20 years. She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farming operations.

This is Christine's first loan from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business, make more income, and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc., all wholesale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce has been working with her husband, in their own farm, to make a living. She plans to start a retail business, in order to make more income for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy grocery goods for her store. She is hoping to build a store shelter for her business, in the near future.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her store.

loans.name: Kavindu

texts.en:
Kavindu is widowed and blessed with five school-going children. For the last 15 years she has been selling scrap metal materials, and now earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She has applied for her second loan of 15,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, and intends to use the money to buy more scrap metal for sale.

Kavindu will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal for sale

loans.name: Khley's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Speu province, Khley is 47 years old and a mother of two children. She can improve her family's conditions via rice cropping. She can earn income of about 20,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Khley’s group consists of six members and she has been with VisionFund for a fifth cycle. The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have uplifted her lifestyle gradually. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Khley, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can update her house and have clean water to drink.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Rosalina Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosalina tiene  44 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 44 years old, and she lives in her own house with her husband and their child.  She has been running a small grocery store from her home for several years and she has many customers, especially her neighbors, because of her good prices and the variety of products.

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc.  This way, she will be able to have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Dody

texts.en: Dody is a 30-year-old man who is married to Rosmawi, a 28-year-old woman. They have been blessed with 3 children: Cahaya, 4; Nasya, 2; and Rizky, 4 months. Dody is a fisherman. He is partnering with his brother by using his brother's boat. The fishmongers usually buy the fish from them and resell them in the market.  Dody's wife is an entrepreneur who sells toys and fireworks near Christmastime and New Year's Eve. In order to increase his income, Dody wants to sell his fish by himself in the market with his own container for the fish. Unfortunately, he does not have much money to do so. Therefore, he applied for an individual loan to TLM in amount of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on the container and cool box for the fish.

loans.use: to buy a container and cool box for fish

loans.name: Nieve Natividad

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Nieve, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Nieve es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido en su trabajo realiza el crédito para que lo utilice en sus faenas en el campo, el  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de arroz, maíz, pimiento, cebolla, frutas,  verduras, entre otras cosas,  siembra en toda época del año ya que cuenta con terrenos adecuados donde el agua está muy cerca y es fácil llevarla hasta los cultivos. Una vez recogida la producción el las lleva a entregar a comerciantes en el mercado de mayoristas en Portoviejo, así el logra  salir delante de una forma honrada. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes e insecticidas para tener buenas cosechas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede colaborar con su marido. Sus sueños tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo canton, the members of the Amigas Solidarias (Friends in Solidarity) loan group meet. This pretty place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it and that are visited often by national and foreign tourists. It is known as “The Beautiful Crucita”.

This is where Nieve lives. She is 61 years old, is married and has four adult, independent children from this relationship. Her husband is a farmer.

Nieve is a very good wife who is taking out the loan to help her husband so he can use it for his work in the fields. He makes a living in agriculture; he grows rice, corn, peppers, onions, fruit and vegetables, among other things. He plants during every season of the year since he has lands that are suitable where the water is very close and it is easy to bring it up to the crops. Once the production is harvested, he brings it to merchants in the wholesale market in Portoviejo. In this way he manages to get ahead in an honest manner. 

She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides in order to have good harvests. She has been with the loan group from the beginning and she likes it because she can collaborate with her husband in this way. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Zarinahon

texts.ru: Зарина- женщина 37 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей. Она родилась и выросла в сельской местности и с детства занимается животноводством. На своем участке земли Зарина ухаживает за крупным рогатым скотом. Молоко, полученное дойки от коров, она продаёт на рынке. Так же Зарина занимается шитьем одежды.А её муж подрабатывает на стройке. Сейчас Зарина хочет закупить корм для скота, но не имеет нужной суммы. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Она заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zarina is a married 37 year old woman with four children. She was born and raised in a rural area and has been raising animals since childhood. She raises cattle on her piece of land, and sells milk from the cows at market. Zarina is also a seamstress. Her husband works in construction on the side. Currently Zarina wants to buy animal feed but doesn't have adequate funds, so she contacted MDO Arvand for financial assistance. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and a young calf.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура швея, работающая у себя дома. Ей 47 лет. Последние 10 лет она занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Ей нравится шить и вышивать. Мастура научила своему ремеслу и свою единтсвенную дочь, чтобы в будущем она могла начать свое дело в этой сфере. А сейчас она усердно помогает матери в ее деле. Муж Мастуры работает в местной фирме. У них есть еще двое сыновей. Мастура со своей семьей живет в городе Душанбе. Недавно она начала ремонт дома и не может закончить его из-за финансового недостатка. Ей необходимо закупить недостающие стройматериалы и оплатить за услуги мастеров. Для этой цели ей нужно 2000 долларов США и эту сумму она просит в кредит. Поддержите Мастуру в трудную минуту! Ей необходимо завершить ремонт до прихода зимы.
texts.en: Mastura is a seamstress and works from home. She is 47 years old. For the past 10 years she has provided sewing services. She likes to sew and embroider. She taught this trade to her only daughter, so that in the future she can start her own business in this sphere. For now her daughter works hard to help with her mom's work. Mastura's husband works for a local business. They also have two sons. Mastura lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe. She recently began repairs to her home but doesn't have the money to finish. She needs to buy the remaining construction materials and pay for the contractors' work. To do so she will need 2000 USD, which she is asking for as a loan. Support Mastura in this time of need. She needs to finish the repairs before winter arrives.

loans.use: Make repairs to her home before winter

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 25 years old and married with two children.

Elsie is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been raising pigs for four years now.  She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: A man living in Kampong Speu province, Phalla is 43 years old and a father of two young children. To support his family, he grows rice as his single source of income. He has struggled with his business for ages.  It earns him about 15,000 KHR per day. For Phalla, this is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five members, he is the group leader. Phalla will spend his loan portion to buy a water filter. He hopes that his family will have clean water to drink.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: A mother of a young child living in Kampong Speu province, Sokhom is 24 years old. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family via working for others for a fee and rice cropping to earn more income. She can earn income of about 20,000 KHR per day. This is the first time for Sokhom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family can live in healthy conditions.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Utkal Janani Shg Group

texts.en:
Utkal Janani is a Self Help Group (SHG) organized and promoted by People's Forum. This group is situated at Koraput district of Odisha, India. At present there are 11 members in the group and all of them are very active and very interested in SHG activities. 

Manjulata is a member of this group who wanted to start a small business to support her family, as she belongs to a  very poor family where she has hardly any savings. Her family income was a mere 2,000 INR per month which was not sufficient to survive. But after associating with the SHG she started saving regularly and got into a milk-made food business, so that she can contribute some financial support to reduce the poverty level of her family and increase the standard of living.  

Manjulata started cooking food and selling it from her home. She was encouraged by the demand for her tasty food from neighbors.  And also she has a very good relationship with her customers because she cares about the quality and also about satisfying her customers' demand. Day by day her customers are increasing but she does not have proper resources to expand her business so,she thought of renting a shop in a nearby market and also wanted to buy some utensils. For that reason,  she, along with her group, has requested for a loan so that they can invest in their businesses to increase their business activities.

loans.use: to rent a shop for a food business

loans.name: Nath

texts.en: A woman from Kampong Chhnang province, Nath is 61 years old and a mother of 10 children. She grows rice on one and one-half hectares as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via fish-catching. For Nath, this is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy solar panels. She hopes that her house has electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy solar panels.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Tralach District

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Chhnang province, Salim is 43 years old and a mother of five children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cultivating and teaching in school to earn more income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can update her house and have electricity to use after she gets the solar panel.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Tralach District

loans.name: Bolkhumor

texts.ru:
Болхумор 55-летняя замужняя женщина из района Пяндж. Ее муж водитель и зарабатывает на жизнь перевозкой пассажиров. Сама Болхумор по профессии швея. Она в течение 5 лет предоставляет услуги швеи у себя дома и по заказу шьет женские платья национальных фасонов. За счет деятельности она получает доход и имеет много знакомых. Поэтому ей нравится то, чем она занимается. 
Болхумор мать троих детей. У нее две дочери и один сын. Одна ее дочь учительница и работает в местной школе. 
Болхумор сейчас хочет расширить свой швейный бизнес. Она за счет кредита собирается купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, чтобы брать больше заказов и увеличить количество клиентов. Болхумор стремится всегда вперед. В будущем она планирует открыть собственный швейный цех.
texts.en: Bolkhumor is a 55 year old married woman from the Pyandj region. Her husband is a driver and makes a living by providing transportation to people. She herself is a seamstress. For the past five years she has offered seamstress services from her home, and taken orders to sew traditional women's dresses. She earns income and has many friends from her work, which she enjoys. Bolkhumor has three children; two daughters and a son. One of her daughters is a teacher at a local school. Bolkhumor now wants to expand her sewing business. She plans to use a loan to buy a new, modern sewing machine so that she can take more orders and increase her number of clients. Bolkhumor is always looking ahead. In the future she plans to open her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy a new, up-to-date sewing machine to develop her business

loans.name: Noorparakuo

texts.en:
Noorparakuo is 40 years old, married, and together with her spouse blessed with 2 children. She runs a hotel and has been in this business for 10 years. She also keeps livestock. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000. 

She will be using this loan to open another hotel and also buy more stocks of sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour for use in the business. She will also buy more livestock to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her hotel business. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To open another hotel business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la elaboración y venta de puros, sus productos los vendes en los diferentes comercios de compra de puros y ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de tabaco por mayor para  seguir con sus ventas ya que es su único trabajo y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus hijas.
texts.en: Maria is 63 years old and lives in a house she owns with her two daughters. For the past 15 years she has made a living by making and selling cigars. She sells her products in various cigar stores and she already has a lot of established customers due to her good prices. She is asking for a loan to buy tobacco wholesale to continue with her sales, as this her only work. In this way she will be able to have a better quality of life with her daughters.

loans.use: to buy tobacco wholesale

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan is a 48-year-old widow with two children. She is a farmer and raises seasonal vegetables such as cucumbers, potatoes, tomatoes and greens. Her son helps his mother in this business. Reyhan's monthly income is 120 AZN.
 
Reyhan has been working in this field for 15 years and she knows everything about farming. She also knows that seasonal vegetables aren’t as profitable as she wants. But unfortunately she cannot raise other kinds of vegetables because of the cold climate in her region. People have a high demand for fresh vegetables, especially greens because they are very useful for health. People also use greens to prepare such national dishes as green qutab, dovgha, doghramaj, etc.

Reyhan's income is not enough for her to cover her family’s needs. She decided to build a greenhouse for her vegetables and buy additional vegetable seeds. That’s why she applied for a 1,500 AZN loan from the Credit Union. She believes that this will help her to increase her income and be able to avoid money debt in the future.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for her vegetables and buy additional vegetable seeds

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a married woman with five children. Her youngest child is 9 years old. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, and sells basic commodities like chips, bread, noodles, cooking oil, soap and seasonings. In addition to that, she engages in the food-vending business. She makes and sells chicken and meat barbeque. She has been operating a store for 10 years now. 

Ana Marie has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more stocks and additional capital for the food vending business. With the additional stocks, she can sell a variety of goods and sell more barbeque. 

 Ana Marie hopes to expand both businesses to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks and additional capital for the food vending business

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria tiene 65 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 8 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old and lives in her own house with her family. For 8 years she has owned a small shop located within her house. She has many customers due to her good prices and her friendliness when she is selling.

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread etc. and therefore have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread etc

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is a married man, and he lives in a rental home, with his wife and two kids. He has had a motorcycle transport business for more three years, now, operating from door to door. Baraka is a very self-sacrificing man. Previously, he did side jobs, in which he earned his other source of living.

He is requesting the loan to add to his savings, so he can purchase a second-hand motorcycle. This will enable him to meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 74 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with 10 children. He is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than 30 years. The business has been profitable.

He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, for planting in his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to grow his farming business and also to repay the loan.

This is Benjamin's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to expand his business, to be successful, and to live a happy life with his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo Lupita Group

texts.es: Dúo Lupita está integrado por doña Guadalupe  de 36 años  quien  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cuenta con un salón de belleza donde también distribuye a otras 40 personas en su comunidad  y les  vende sus productos de belleza (lociones, cremas, maquillajes, desodorante, talco, shampoo etc.)  tiene más 13 años  vendiendo ella solicita su crédito para comprar estrellas (combo de lociones, desodorantes, cremas, rollé etc.) ya que se acerca la temporada de gradaciones y temporada navideña  es donde ella aprovecha a  distribuir  más sus productos y los da a un menor  costo a sus clientes ya  que lo compra por mayor, su sueño es poder tener un carro para distribuir sus productos ya que actualmente ella tiene una moto para distribuir sus productos pero no tiene suficiente espacio para llevar sus productos.
texts.en:
36-year-old Guadalupe is a member of the Lupita Duo. She makes a living by selling beauty products and has a beauty salon where she also distributes to 40 other people in her community, selling them her beauty products (lotions, creams, makeup, deodorant, powder, shampoo etc.). She has been selling for more than 13 years. 

She is asking for her loan to buy sale packages (combos of lotions, deodorants, creams, roll-ons etc.) as the graduation and Christmas seasons are coming; this is when she takes advantage of distributing her products the most and gives them to her customers at a lower cost since she buys them wholesale. Her dream is to be able to have a car to distribute her products. Currently she has a motorcycle to distribute her products but it doesn't have enough space to carry them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition, for her studies at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of a 14-year-old son from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. Marilyn is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. With this loan, Marilyn and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Marilyn hopes to make their fishing business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Rizaline

texts.en: Rizaline, age 25, is married to a driver and blessed with one child. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income from this business goes to their savings. Due to insufficient funds from her business she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old, married to Jane, and blessed with five children. His children are aged between 16 and 5 years. He has been in a transport business for the past five years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. (KES means Kenyan Shillings).

He has applied for his first loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan amount to purchase spare parts wheels for the motorbike.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children. Patrick hopes to grow his business and buy a fleet of motorbikes for leasing, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts wheels for the motorbike

loans.name: Marjelyn

texts.en: Marjelyn is a very dedicated woman who wants to become successful in the future. She studied Desk Watch Keeping in a university. She borrowed this loan from GDMPC to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. She wants to have a better job after finishing her studies and she believes that changes anyone to become a better person. In the future, she wants to become successful with her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwahamvi

texts.en:
Mwahamvi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail grocery shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Aeu

texts.en: Aeu, 27, is a local resident in Kampong Chhnang province and a mother of three schoolchildren. She is a farmer who grows rice as the main business to support her family. Moreover, she earns extra income from raising pigs. Now, she can earn about 7 USD per day. This is Aeu's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy solar panels. She hopes that her family can have electricity to use so she can cut down on her use of batteries.

loans.use: To buy solar panels.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en: Bopha is 21 years old, and a daughter of a widowed farmer. She is also a fourth-year accounting and finance student, at university. She is from the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. Due to the lack of finance, she would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fee for the last year at university. With this loan, she will graduate successfully. For her future, Bopha wants to have a job, to save money to run a business and renovate her house. She also wants to pursue a master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff of maize flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Dorcas dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for sale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for sale in her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman, and she has one child who is too young for school. Margaret lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past fifteen years she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Margaret dreams of establishing a restaurant business, in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock to sell, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and rice.

loans.name: El Capulin 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres socios esforzados, quien lo coordina es el señor Pedro, un hombre emprendedor de 56 años de edad, casado y padre de seis hijos de los cuales solamente dos dependen económicamente de él, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace quince años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate, ya que está finalizando la temporada y es uno de los productos que más demanda tiene, con los créditos anteriores logro aumentar el capital de trabajo, lo que lo ha motivado a seguir solicitando el financiamiento de la institución para su negocio; este socio cuenta con un buen equipo de trabajo, quienes lo integran son la señora Lucila de 34 años de edad quien comercializa repuestos de bicicletas desde hace ocho años en su domicilio, y Juan un hombre de 51 años comerciante de estufas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya y Granada de manera ambulante desde hace siete años.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of three hardworking members. It is coordinated by Señor Pedro, an enterprising man, age 56.  He is married with six children, of whom only two depend on him economically. 

He has been selling fruit in the municipal market for fifteen years. The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a crop of avocados, as the season is winding up, and this is one of the products that are most in demand.

With the previous loans he was able to increase his working capital, which has motivated him to continue requesting financing from the institution for his business.

He has a good working team, which comprises Señora Lucila, age 34, who has been selling bicycle parts out of her home for eight years; and Juan, age 51, a stove and vegetable vendor in the Markets of Masaya and Granada for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase a crop of avocados.

loans.name: Nicolas Humberto De Jesus

texts.es: Trabajadores, alegres, respetuosos, colaboradores, son algunos de los valores que poseen los campesinos, esos hombres que laboran la tierra para que miles de personas puedan disfrutar de un saludable alimento y uno de ellos es Nicolás un caficultor que labora en un hermoso paraíso y es uno de los tantos responsables que millones de personas disfruten de un café colombiano y sabemos lo importa que es este producto para las personas por eso se pide su apoyo para este hombre que quiere solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la construcción de una beneficiadora y marquesina para su negocio.
texts.en:
Workers who are happy, respectful and collaborative -- these are some of the values country people have, these men who work the earth so that thousands of people can benefit from healthy foods. 

And one such individual is Nicolas, a coffee grower who labors in a beautiful paradise and is one of the very responsible people who help millions of us enjoy Colombian coffee, We know the importance of this product for many people. 

That's why we are requesting help for this grower who is soliciting a loan to invest in the construction of a large storage container and a shelter for his coffee producing business.

loans.use: construct a storage facility with large capacity and a shelter for use in processing coffee.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, aged between 6 and 11 years. All of the children go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans to sell

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For over three years, Sikukuu has operated a clothes-selling business. She sells from door-to-door and at home, to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothes, to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothes to resell

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo numero 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, además de ello están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de su encuesta de 50 indicadores podrán conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir trabajando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Venancia, en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio, ella a través del esfuerzo y por medio de la venta que hace está mejorando. Venancia vende chipa, una comida típica paraguaya, por medio de este trabajo lucha por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipa, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, y poder continuar con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is in its 14th cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank Program. They are also in the Elimination of Poverty Program, whose 50-indicator survey will enable each one of them to understand her situation, and continue working accordingly.

One of the members is Señora Venancia, who falls into level two on the Poverty Survey, which is in the middle; and through her hard work, and through her sales, she is improving.  Venancia sells chipa (a kind of bread), a traditional Paraguayan food; and by means of this work, she fights to be able to move forward, and to help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of chipa, so that she can continue working as she has been doing, and continue with her sales, fighting to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase chipa (a traditional Paraguayan bread) to sell.

loans.name: Zilda

texts.en:
Zilda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock to resell, including sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to resell, including wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda is 29 years old, a mother of one child and living in Kampong Chhnang province. 

Her main sources of income are from rice cropping and grocery selling. She can earn about 29,600 KHR per day. 

For Chenda, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion on buying a solar panel. 

She hopes that she can improve her family's access to electricity as other families have done.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chnnag Province, Samki Meanchey District

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 38-year-old married mother of two children, ages 8 and 5. She lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo.
 
Josephine makes a living through her sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Josephine wants to improve her store but lacks the financial resources to do so. 

As of now, she is requesting a loan to purchase rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, beverages, condiments, charcoal and others. Through this loan, Josephine will be able to increase her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store.
 
In the future, Josephine  hopes of making her business sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries. beverages, condiments, charcoal and others.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde  una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lina, quien lucha por poder mejorar su vida a través del esfuerzo.
Ella a través de la lucha diaria y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de menudencias y de carbón que hace lucha por ingresos mejores y un mejor estilo de vida para su familia. Ella quiere ir capacitándose para conocer más y poder aplicarlo a su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de menudencias para la venta y también de carbón. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group is part of a poverty elimination programme. Lina is one of its members, who fights to be able to improve her life through her efforts. She works daily and continuously selling scraps and coal in order to get a higher income and a better lifestyle for her family. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of scraps to be sold, as well as coal. She is grateful for the opportunity that she receives, which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy scraps and coal for sale

loans.name: Hasana Shg Group

texts.en:
