Gruhita, 23, is a married adult with two young sons. She is a native of Koraput district, which is located in the western region of the Odisha, India. She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a strong desire for self-improvement. 

She is a small business owner who manages her own businesses, which include a cosmetics business and a general store where she sells products for daily use, such as basic grains, soap, detergents, soda, ice, bread, eggs, and frozen goods, among other items. Her merchandise is high quality and affordable for her customers. She buys her merchandise from markets and distributors from the region. She has loyal customers as well as irregular customers. She started her business with her savings from her previous work. She started with a small window and little by little she invested until she has a well-stocked store. She starts her day very early, opening the doors to her business and tending to her customers.

One of her dreams is to expand her business so that she can increase her profits and make some repairs in her home. For these reasons, Gruhita is seeking a loan to invest in working capital for her businesses by purchasing basic goods such as rice, beans, cosmetics, snacks, etc. By increasing the size of her business, she can purchase products at better prices, stock her store better with the products that are in highest demand, and in so doing, increase her income and offer her customers better prices.

Other members of this group are engaged in different activities and all are very happy with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, snacks, rice, beans, etc., in bulk for her general store

loans.name: Jalakanya - 2 Group

texts.en:
Archana, aged 25, is a self-motivated active woman entrepreneur of Bissamcuttack village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a very hardworking lady and is seated at the left of the front line in the photo with a raised hand. She resides with her husband and a son who is 3 years old. 

Archana has been running a tea stall with leaf plate stitching and selling for the last four years. Her husband is also supporting the business by selling the leaf plates in nearby villages. 

Initially, Archana started this business with a small investment of her own. When Mahashakti Foundation started working in her village she motivated eight other women entrepreneurs and formed a group named “Jalakanya - 2” and took a loan for the development of their businesses.
 
Now Archana’s income is 5,800/- INR per month, but it is not at all sufficient to meet the household expenses. So for further development she will take another loan. From this loan she will purchase sugar, tea, dry milk and a big stock of leaves for stitching leaf plates. Archana hopes to construct a permanent cabin for her business and a good house for her family. 

The other eight members are doing dairy, vegetable vending, leaf plates and fast food stall businesses.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea, dry milk and a big stock of leaves for stitching leaf plates

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa es un responsable ama de casa que vive con su pareja con la cual tiene 4 hijos, en busca de mejorar su situación económica Tomasa decidió optar por el emprendimiento y montar un negocio de venta de comidas por lo cual solicita un crédito para comprar insumos como vegetales. Carnes, panes, gaseosas, este crédito para ella es muy importante pues tendrá capital de trabajo con el que hoy no cuenta su meta es poder brindarle estudio a sus hijos 3 de ellos menores de edad y sacar su casa adelante, pintarla, adornarla, hacerla hermosa cosas que una madre disfruta.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a responsible housewife who lives with her partner, with whom she has 4 children. Trying to improve her economic situation, Tomasa decided to opt to become an entrepreneur and set up a prepared food business. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as vegetables, meats, bread and sodas.

This loan is very important for her since she will have labour capital, which she does not currently have. Her goal is to be able to provide for the studies of her children, 3 of whom are underage, and to improve her house, to adorn it and make it beautiful—the kind of things that a mother enjoys.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as vegetables, meats, bread and sodas, so as to improve her sales by having a greater production volume

loans.name: Sokie

texts.en:
Sokie, a local farmer living in Kampong Chhnang province, is 32 years old. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school, and one is too young. For her living, she earns income to support her family via rice cropping and selling grocery items to earn more income. 

This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to buy a solar panel to update her living conditions. She hopes that her family has electricity to use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel to update her living conditions.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 32 years old and he happily lives in the village Lusahovit in the Tavush region. Gevorg lives with his parents and he also has a lovely family with a beautiful wife and two pretty daughters (school-aged). Gevorg has no higher education. 

Now he works at a construction store as a salesman and, at the same time, with his father he is engaged in farming and agriculture. On his farm he has 6 cows, 3 pigs, 10 chickens. He also planted a lot of apple and nut trees on his plot of land. They already gives a good  and bountiful harvest. From his farm Gevorg's mother sells milk, butter, cheese, meat and eggs. In all, Gevorg says that he is happy with his farming activities. Last year the income from it helped him to buy a car for his family and also a tractor for farming.

Gevorg wants to spend this loan, for the amount of 300,000 Armenian drams, on the purchase of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for 2 years. He also has a retail shop. He is 25 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy more retail goods to sell in his shop. These include sugar, rice and maize flour. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to have a prosperous and sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in his business.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.en: Kurbongul is a smart and hardworking woman. She is 29 years old. Kurbongul is careful mother and only provider for three children. She is divorced and lives with her sister, brother and children. Kurbongul has a fast-food café. She makes and sells hamburgers. Kurbongul began this business two years ago. She works hard. Her working day begins at 7 o’clock in the morning. She makes a daily income from this business but it is not enough. Kurbongul is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her sister as her lovely sister is ill. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her sister

loans.name: Luís Felipe

texts.es:
Luis tiene 56 años de edad, es un tendero muy querido en el barrio por su amabilidad, buen servicio y excelente trato al cliente, presenta una dificultad y es que es una persona muy bajas de recursos y casi no tiene para surtir su negocio como se puede apreciar en la foto, por tal razón quiere solicitart un crédito para surtir su negocio en productos de la canasta familiar en general y aunque le da miedo invertir de verdad su tienda necesita este impulso para vender. 
Es padre de 2 hijos y vela por el cuidado de su mujer.
texts.en:
Luis is 56 years old. He is a well-loved shopkeeper in his neighborhood because of his friendliness, good service, and excellent customer service.

He has a problem, and that is that he is a person of very modest resources, and he almost doesn't have enough to stock his business, as you can see in the photo. That is why he wants to apply for a loan in order to stock his business with basic family needs. Even though it scares him to invest, his store really needs this boost for him to be able to sell.

He is father to two children, and looks out for the well-being of his wife.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic family needs for his store.  He is a man of modest means who needs a boost.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  is a married mother of two kids. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and the school fees for her one school-going kid.

Grace has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from her home to her neighbors. Grace dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Grace wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to sell from her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting 50,000 KES to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
64 años de edad, separado de su esposa y la falta de un brazo no fue ningún tipo de obstáculo para este valiente y luchador hombre que ve en cada instancia de su vida una razón para salir adelante y demostrar que la mayor discapacidad es la mental y que gracias a dios tiene salud y puede trabajar, tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar es padre de 3 hijos dos mujeres y un hombre todos ellos mayores de edad. 
Increíblemente trabaja 12 1 14 horas diarias y tiene ánimos de seguir expandiéndose y mejorar su situación económica por tal razón solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en abarrotes buscando diversificar la oferta de productos, ser más competitivo en el mercado y que su negocio se mantenga por ellos espera un apoyo y no quiere que lo vean como un discapacitado si no como un hombre que luchadora y trabajara pro auto superarse
texts.en:
He is 64 years old and separated from his wife. Missing an arm has not been an obstacle to this brave and hardworking man. He sees in each moment of his life a reason to move forward and show that the greatest disability is in the mind. Thanks to God, he is healthy and can work. He has a shop selling household staple goods. He is the father of 3 children, 2 women and one man, all of which are of adult age. 
Incredibly, he works 12 to 14 hours a day and wishes to continue to expand his business and improve his economic situation. This is why he is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of grocery items with the goal to diversify the product choice, be more competitive in the marketplace and maintain his business. This is why he is requesting support, and he does not want to be seen as a handicapped man, but rather as a fighter and a man who works hard to get ahead by himself.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items in order to diversify his offer to his clients

loans.name: Encarnacion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Encarnación está en el 8vo. ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no piensan emprender una actividad para poder así ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes, la Sra. Teresa, quien se dedica al comercio, es decir a la venta de ropas desde hace un tiempo, tiene mucha clientela ya que es conocida en la zona. Además es funcionaria pública. Según su primera encuesta de eliminación de pobreza ha ido mejorando bastante y quiere seguir haciéndolo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias, y de esa forma poder seguir con su lucha, tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
The Encarnación group is in its 8th semester of the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee program. The majority of the members are engaged in a productive business and those who aren't plan to start an activity in order to improve their living conditions.

One of the members, Teresa, who has made her living in trade, that is, selling clothes, for quite a while, has a lot of customers since she is known in the area. She is also a civil servant. According to her poverty elimination survey, she has improved quite a bit, and she wants to continue doing so.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in purchasing various outfits. This will allow her to continue with her efforts, trying to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy various outfits to sell.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1987. She is divorced and has a child who is six years old. Shahnoza is the only provider for her child and herself. Shahnoza has  worked more than three years in a library. She works well. Shahnoza also studies at the university in absentia. She is a very smart and hardworking woman. She tries to offer good living conditions for her child. Shahnoza is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Hasen

texts.en:
Hasen is 19 years old. He is a smart and clever man. He is not married and lives with his parents. 

Hasen studies at the university. He is a student of the Tajikistan University of Economy and Finance. He is studying in his second year. Hasen is learning IT systems. He studies well and he is one of the best students. 

Hasen is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy. This loan will help him to get a higher education and to be a success in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is 28 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She is married and has a daughter who is three years old. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Munira makes clothes for a living. She makes a variety of different items of clothing for her clients. Her work is of a good quality, which is why many people come to her. Munira has worked in this field for 12 years and has a lot of experience, as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her. She manages all her house responsibilities alone.

Munira is going to buy coal for the winter season to keep her house warm because her child is small. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy coal. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal to keep her house warm in the winter season

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Rachael from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming, but she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married, and together with her husband, is blessed with two lovely children. 

For the past 10 years, she has been practicing mixed farming, and, because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and she is regarded as a mentor. Income from milk, eggs, and maize selling have allowed her to earn a decent income. To make the extra coin, Rachael engages in a small personal business. 

Rachael passionately loves dairy farming and animals on her farm have been given names. Milking and feeding Browny (the name of her cow) makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers, then she can SMS her customers when the milk is ready for collection. Because of using information technology, she has had a comparative edge in her dairy business. 

Demand has been overwhelming, and she needs an extra breed of cow to satisfy fully the demand. She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Rachael does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow, but she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income, and Rachael will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children. 

When anybody listens to Rachael speak, one would be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming, but because of passion and determination she intends to beat all odds. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Rachael, and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 41 years old. She is married and has three children aged between 10 and 15 years.  All of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been working in a business for 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more maize and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 5 and 10 years, all of whom go to school. 

Claudine sells food stuffs and has been doing this from her business for 3 years now. With her loan, Claudine would like to buy beans and maize for resale. 

The profits from Claudine's sales will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Tresia

texts.en:
Tresia is 35 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with three children. She is a farmer and she makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to open a cereals shop.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Tulasi Shg Group

texts.en:
Daimati, the lady standing second from left hand side in the first row wearing a red colored sari, is a 42-year-old married woman with three children who are still in school. She has been running a retail shop for three years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She uses the profit to help her husband pay school fees and sometimes contributes to buy food and pay hospital expenses. 

This will be Daimati's first loan from Peoples Forum. She is happy with the loan. She will use this loan to increase her shop inventory to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of building a wholesale shop. 

Daimati will share this loan with her loan group, "Tulasi Shg," which consists of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Daimati and her group would like to thank Kiva and Peoples Forum for this great help and support.

loans.use: to increase her grocery shop inventory to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting 30,000 KES to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Allahverdi is a 57-year-old IDP (internally displaced person) and he has three kids. He lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. Two of his children are married and live separately. Allahverdi is a blacksmith and his primary business is making doors and fenders from iron, but his income is not enough to cover his family's needs. For this reason, he earns money raising fruits and vegetables and selling them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN and he has 15 years of skill in this area.

People’s demand for fruits and vegetables is very high. Every day they use them preparing different kinds of fruit juice and jam and vegetable salads. People used to buy from private gardens because foods there cost less than at markets.

Allahverdi wants to make his family’s life better. He especially wants to provide for his daughter's future. Allahverdi applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy more fertilizers and fruit tree seeds to increase his income. This is his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and fruit tree seeds

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en: Azimjon was born in 1986. He lives with his family in south Tajikistan. Azimjon is married but does not have a child.  Azimjon is a master of repairing houses. He has been busy with this business more than two years. Azimjon is the main provider of his family, and that’s why he works hard to offer the  family good living conditions. Azimjon’s mother is ill and he must buy medicines for his mother. He has been warned about the health of his mother. He is asking for a loan of 700 USD to buy medicines. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of his mother

loans.name: El Porvenir Rancho Chico Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 años y un bebé de 10 meses, y su negocio es ayudante de cocina.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, optimista, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘El Torno’ una zona agrícola que conecta a productores campesinos y vendedores mayoristas, la producción agrícola que más se oferta es; la carne, los granos, verduras y frutas. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que sobrepasa los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español como segunda lengua (sentada con un bebe en los brazos). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al comercio de verduras, su hijo que estudia en la escuela y su pequeño bebé que esta a su cuidado. Sus ganas de independizarse y tener un negocio estable la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; carnicería, tienda de vídeos, venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la cocina, ella trabaja como ayudante de cocina y se encarga de ayudar al personal en un restaurante conocido; preparando platos y comidas y limpiando la cocina (limpia y pela frutas, verduras, corta pan y carne). También mide y mezcla ingredientes, utilizando básculas y jarras medidoras, prepara platos para servir, prepara comida simple como salsas, sándwiches, sopas, postres, etc. Controla las existencias e informa al supervisor cuando se necesite hacer más pedidos, desempaqueta y almacena las existencias en congeladores, armarios y otras áreas de almacenaje. Mantiene limpia la zona de trabajo (limpiando las superficies de trabajo, los utensilios, los armarios y el equipo de cocina). Mantiene limpia la cocina (barriendo y fregando suelos y sacando la basura). Y escurre y lava los platos y los coloca en el sitio adecuado (en armarios, cajones, etc.). Esta labor la viene realizando hace dos años, y ella piensa que ya es hora de abrir su propio negocio. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es que su hijo tenga buenas oportunidades escolares y laborales. Ella desea independizarse y abrir su propio restaurante y necesita realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a clientes en un lugar cercano a la plaza principal al aire libre.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para independizarse y tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a 30-year-old woman, who lives with her partner and has an eight-year-old son and a 10-month-old baby. She makes a living as a kitchen assistant.

She is resourceful, persevering, optimistic, responsible, hardworking, and a good mother. 

She works in El Torno—an agricultural area known for its warm tropical climate, with temperatures exceeding 30 degrees Celsius year round, and for being a place that connects farmers with wholesale vendors. The most in-demand agricultural products are meat, grains, vegetables, and fruit. 

Maria is of medium height, has a tan complexion, and wears her long black hair tied up. Her mother tongue is Quechua and speaks Spanish as her second language. She lives with her partner, who makes a living selling vegetables; her son, who goes to school; and her little baby, who is under her care. (In the picture, she is the one sitting with a baby in her arms.)

Her eagerness to become independent and have a firmly established business made her put together a communal bank of people in order to request a loan and improve their businesses, which are running a butcher’s shop, running a video store, selling sandwiches, making plaster handicrafts, selling beverages, running a bookstore, and selling clothes.

Maria works as a kitchen assistant and is in charge of helping out the staff of a known restaurant. She prepares dishes and meals, cleans the kitchen, washes and peels fruits and vegetables, slices bread and cuts meat. She also measures and mixes the ingredients, using scales and measuring cups; gets the dishes ready for serving; and prepares simple foods such as salsas, sandwiches, soups, desserts, and the like. She manages the inventory and informs the supervisor when it's time to reorder more supplies; unpacks and stores products in the freezers, pantries, and other storage areas. She keeps the work area clean by washing the work surfaces, kitchen utensils, cupboards, and kitchen equipment. She keeps the kitchen clean by sweeping and mopping the floors and taking the garbage out. She washes and dries dishes and puts them away in the appropriate place (cupboards, drawers, and the like). 

She has been following this occupation for the last two years, and she thinks that it's time to start her own business. She wants to become independent and open her own restaurant, and she needs to buy tables and chairs to set up an area in an open space close to the main square to serve her customers.

For this reason, Maria is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to start her own business and become independent.

This is her second loan cycle with the institution. Her dream is for her son to have a good education and good job opportunities

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to start her own business and become independent.

loans.name: Maximila

texts.en:
Maximila is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as honest. Maximila operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, flour, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge as financial constraints. 

Maximila will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, flour, sugar, and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking fat, flour, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a fridge for meat storage. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for meat storage.

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en:
Dzendere is a married woman, and she has five children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, flour, sugar and other items. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, flour, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 28 years old. She is married and has four children, aged between 1 and 7 years.  Two of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been doing in a business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and trousers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is a 25-year-old married mother of 2 children. The youngest is only 3 months old, while her older child is 7 years old and currently goes to school. 

Anelique sells food stuffs and has been running her business for 6 years. 

With this loan, Angelique would like to buy more sorghum and beans for resale. The profits from her business will be reinvested, and Angelique will buy more food for her customers' home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hard working 41-year-old woman. She is married to Charles, who provides additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children.  Jane has been a farmer for six years, and earns an income of 15,000 KES every month.

Jane now has her third loan of 30,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income from her farm to buy goats and cows, and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to have a bright future and a successful life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 32 years old. He is married and has one child who is eight years old and goes to school. Innocent sells food stuffs and has been doing so for eight years.

With this loan, Innocent would like to buy more maize and soya beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more maize and soya beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Amway products. He wants to work, but needs resources.

loans.name: Angela María

texts.es:
Angela un joven muy capaz, muy luchadora, que tiene un negocio de papelería y miscelánea donde vende artículos como accesorios básicamente para mujer o artículos de uso personal.
Es una mujer soltera y ella le colabora en todo lo que puede a sus padres, incluso en sus peores momentos, aprendió del negocio sola y quiere salir adelante por tal razón se apoya en interactuar solicitándole un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una fotocopiadora para ofrecer este servicio, el resto del capital lo invertirá en surtido para tener una papelería con un completo surtido.
texts.en:
Angela is a very capable and hardworking young woman who has a business selling stationery and other miscellaneous products. She sells items such as basic accessories for women or personal use items.

She is a single woman and supports her parents as much as she can, even in her worst moments. She learned the business alone and wants to get ahead, which is why she is applying for a loan, which she will invest in buying a photocopier in order to offer this service. The rest of the capital she will invest in various things in order to have a fully-stocked stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and paper products to strengthen her business.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El Grupo San Pedro está en su quinto ciclo, todas ellas están luchando por sus familias, para poder darles un mejor estilo de vida al que ellas pudieron tener. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zunilda quien es comerciante, una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, quien se dedica a las ventas en su despensa, que con mucho sacrificio ha podido montar, y donde tiene todo tipo de productos, y con lo cual ha podido ganarse ya una muy buena clientela.
La Sra. Zunilda solicita de este préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás, de manera a continuar con su negocio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Group is in its fifth semester. All the members are fighting for their families, in order to give them a better life than they were able to have. They are part of the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Zunilda, who is a businesswoman. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who makes her living selling things in her store. She was able to start the store through a lot of sacrifice, and she has all types of products there. With this store, she has been able to acquire a very good clientele.

Zunilda is applying for this loan in order to buy more products for her store, such as drinks, groceries, vegetables, fruits, and more, so that she can continue with her business as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy drinks, groceries, vegetables, fruits, and other things.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a repeat client of IMON. She is a very hardworking woman and she has a good credit story. Gulshan is widowed and she does not have any children. She lives alone. Gulshan has worked as a cleaning woman for last six years. She tries to do her job well. 

Gulshan has a small income and that is why she lives poorly. She does not have enough money to buy coal for the winter season. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to buy coal. She awaits your mercy. This loan will help to keep the house of a widowed woman from Tajikistan warm in the cold winter season.

loans.use: to buy coal for the winter season.

loans.name: Nilo Jr.

texts.en:
Nilo Jr. is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in the future. He is studying at university for a career in the maritime industry as a Deck Watch Keeper. 

His parents earn their income from their own farm. Nilo Jr. has four siblings, all of whom live with his family. 

Nilo Jr. has borrowed this loan from Gata Daku Mulit-purpose Cooperative in order to pay the school tuition fees for his first semester. 

In the future, Nilo Jr. wants to find a job that will enable him to support not only himself but also his family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for his first semester.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is 58 years old. She lives in a beautiful place with her husband and 5 children. Their main source of income is from their farm. They own a plot of land where they grow maize, carrots, and onions. They sell their harvest at the local markets, from which they derive a small monthly income. She has been in this business more than 12 years. 

For several years she has been trying to build a new house for her family, as her family is big and needs a big house. She does not have enough income to finish building the house. She is asking for a loan of 7500 TJS to buy building materials such as cement, soil, slate, etc. This loan will help her provide good living conditions for her 5 children. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, soil, slate, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother of one child who is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, Jane has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With this KES 20,000 loan, Jane wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. Mercy operates a food stall where she cooks chapati to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge as poor roads. 

Mercy will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married and has one child. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water.  For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business near neighbors and town dwellers. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding the business to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. He is a father of three sons who are already grown and help their father greatly in his farming activities. Edik used to work at the Kapan city combine for many years, but now his only interest is his farm with its not very rich farm cattle, which Edik hopes to make bigger and richer. On his farm, Edik has two pigs and five piglets. His plot of land also brings some income to his family. He sells produce from his farm, including potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, and also persimmons and grapes. As Edik says, he is already knowledgeable about swine-breeding activities and would like to expand his activities.

Edik seeks a loan of 170,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a pig and also fodder for all his cattle.

loans.use: to buy a pig and also fodder for all his cattle

loans.name: Adalet

texts.en:
Adalet is 42 years old and married with two sons and one daughter. His wife is a housekeeper. The family is IDP and has lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Adalet is a farmer and raises vegetables in his small yard. He has 15 years of experience and earns 170 AZN monthly selling vegetables at local bazaar. He earns additionally money working as a driver when he has free time.

Fresh vegetables are very useful for health, and people can cook delicious national dishes using them (kuku, doghramaj, dovgha, basdirma and etc.). These dishes may be used in either everyday life or on holidays. His family is very big and his monthly income isn’t enough for him to provide for his children’s education. He has applied for 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: Yosuman

texts.en:
Yosuman is a young and smart woman. She was born in 1994. She is not married and lives with her parents. Yosuman studies at the University of Business and Service. She studies in the faculty of economy and studies well. She tries to earn good knowledge and to be a high quality specialist. Yosuman’s parents are workers and they cannot support her, so she must to pay for her tuition. 

Yosuman is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a very hardworking woman. Aside from taking care of her children, Rosebella also helps her husband in their fishing business. For the past 24 years, fishing has been their main source of income.

Rosebella is now asking for a loan to buy materials, like wood and nails, for the repair of their fishing boat, as well as new fishing nets. With this loan, they will be able to improve their fishing business and their income. Rosebella hopes to their business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy materials, like wood and nails, for the repair of her fishing boat, as well as new fishing nets

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora viene trabajando hace ya mucho tiempo, de manera unida y trabajadora, están  en su ciclo numero 28, donde cada una de ellas está luchando por sus familias. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
U na de las integrantes es la Sra. Jacinta, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando a través de su esfuerzo, se destaca por ser una señora muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien se dedica a la costura, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le lleva trabajos para que ella haga.
La Sra. Jacinta pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, y demás, de manera a poder luchar y crecer. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, de manera a poder luchar por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora group has now been working for a long time and they are united and hard-working. They are in their 28th loan cycle, in which each of the women is working hard for her family. They are in the poverty elimination programme, striving to improve their living conditions. 

Jacinta is one of the members and in the latest survey she had a poverty level within level three, which means that she has been improving by means of her hard work. She stands out as a very hard-working and determined woman who earns a living from sewing. She has a very good clientele who always bring work for her to do.

Jacinta is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other items so she can work hard and grow. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting so that she can strive to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other items to continue sewing.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Philip, who was born in the outskirts of Litein, Kenya, and is said to have entered the world smiling. Life for Philip and others in his rural farming village was challenging, requiring families to rely on ingenuity and perseverance in the face of few resources. Philip lives together with his wife, to whom he has been married for over 20 years! His marriage has been blessed with four children, the youngest being 7 and the oldest being 23. 

Philip has been doing mixed-farming for over five years. He considers himself to be more passionate and hardworking than other farmers. He also leaves nothing to chance when carrying out his duties.

Philip is seeking a KES 100,000 loan to purchase farm equipment. Acquisition of these assets is aligned to his plan of growing his agribusiness to the next level. On his farm, he grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. He also keeps ten hens and sheep. For the past few years, his biggest challenge has been the tools used on the farm. They are outdated and worn out, to say the least. As a result, farm work has become strenuous and time consuming. He spends more resources on labor, since working with these tools requires a lot of effort, yet the quality of work keeps deteriorating. 

Philip is going to use this loan to purchase modern farm equipment that will bring effectiveness and efficiency to his farm work. New improved tools will not only save him on labor costs, but will also improve the quality of the work. With your loan, he will grow his business to greater heights and elevate his family's livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Felanzia

texts.en:
Felanzia is a married woman and she has three children. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will make more profits and apply for a larger loan. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Bernadicto

texts.en:
Bernadicto is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

Bernadicto operates a retail business where he sells cereals, a business he has been running for 4 years now. His operation is located in a good area, and his primary activity is retail, selling to individual customers. 

Bernadicto describes his biggest business challenge to be finances. He will use his 70,000 KES loan to buy more supplies of peanuts. His goal is to have a large wholesale operation within 5 years.

Bernadicto hopes that, in the future, he will have increased sales. He will use his anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy farm inputs (seed, equipment, fertilizer, etc.) in order to start farming.

loans.use: buy more supplies of peanuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an oven and tools to operate his own bakery

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en: Shushanik is from Zovasar village, where she lives with her husband and three sons (23, 22 and 15 years old). The whole family is occupied in agriculture. They keep animals (cows, sheep, calves, piglets, and hens) and cultivate potatoes. Shushanik takes care of her small orchard where she grows apple and nut trees for additional income. The requested loan is very important for Shushanik and her family to develop their farming business. They plan to purchase a pig, 10 sheep, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.use: to buy a pig, 10 sheep, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Jessica Andrea

texts.es:
Jesica es la orgullosa madre de 2 hijos una linda niña de 8 años y un varón de 5 años, a pesar de tener 2 hijos es una joven de 29 años con toda la vida por delante, vive con su pareja pero como mujer con espíritu y ambición trabaja independientemente en una tienda de peluquería la cual formo y ha estado llevando con el pasar de los meses pues la inicio hace apenas en el mes de febrero del presente año y está muy contenta por la buena acogida que ha tenido el público pues se destaca como una tienda innovadora.
En busca de seguir por la misma senda quiere solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para siempre innovar y tener para sus clientes productos nuevos y efectivos para embellecer, su meta es trabajar para darles a sus hijos un buen futuro y darse el gran gusto de comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en: Jessica is the proud mother of two children: a beautiful daughter who is 8 years old and a son who is 5 years old. Although she has two children, she is a young 29 year old woman with all of her life in front of her. She lives with her husband, but as a woman with spirit and ambition she works independently in a beauty store that she established and she has improved with the passing of the months since she began it, just in the month of February of this year. She is very happy with the good reception that she has received from the public when her store stands out as an innovative one. She is looking to continue on this path and wants to seek a loan that she will invest in the purchase of beauty products to always innovate and to have new and effective products for her clients to beautify themselves. Her goals are to work to provide her children with a good future and to give herself the great pleasure of buying her own home.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products to have a varied and attractive supply for the public.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair shampoo and hair chemicals to use in his business.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
Milagros se forma en la ciudad de Encarnación, con la unión de vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad, son mujeres que se unieron por luchar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Irma es la Directora General del grupo, ella vende ropas y es empleada, es una señora muy trabajadora y que está luchando para poder dar a sus seres queridos lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar que pase por necesidades.
La Sra. Irma pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Milagros was formed in the city of Encarnación, by neighbours and friends in the city getting together. These women got together so they could work hard together and help their families through this work. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, which will enable them to continue working as they have been doing and improve their living conditions. 

Irma is the General Manager of the group. She sells clothing and is an employee. She is a very hard-working woman who is striving to be able to give her loved ones what she couldn't have and avoid them having to go without.

Irma is asking for this loan to buy various items of clothing to sell, so she can continue with her sales, striving to improve her own and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
Las vencedoras es un grupo unido, que se formo con la idea de que las señoras ayuden a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo unido de ellas. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de cada una y de esa forma poder ir trabajando.
Un ejemplo de lucha y de trabajo es la Sra. Nancy, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora y muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que se esta esforzando. Pide este préstamo para que por medio de el pueda comprar los insumos que necesita para hacer sus comidas.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere lo mejor para sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Las Vencedoras (“The Winners”) is a united group, which formed with the idea of women helping their loved ones through their work. They are in a program to eliminate poverty, through which they will be able to identify the type of poverty that affects them most. In this way, they can continue working. 

One example of the fight and the work is Mrs. Nancy, who sells food that she makes and then sells on foot. She is a very hard-working person, and she is very good at what she does. It is because of this that she works hard. 

She asks for this loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs to make her food.

She is a very persevering person, who wants the best for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food, including meat, vegetables, condiments, and other things.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
17 son las integrantes de este grupo, que se unieron para poder trabajar de manera unida y solidaria, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, de manera a que con ello podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Silvina es una de las integrantes, tiene una despensa en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Es una señora muy sacrificada, que quiere seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento, es por ello que se esta esforzando mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, carne, frutas, panificados y demás, de manera a poder seguir luchando y creciendo. Todas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
There are 17 members of this group, and they came together so that they can work in a united way with solidarity. They are in a program to eliminate poverty, through which they will be able to identify the type of poverty that affects them most.

Silvina is one of the members. She has a store in which she works every day, beginning very early in the morning. She is a woman who has made many sacrifices and who wants to continue growing in her business. It is because of this that she is making a big effort.

She asks for this loan to be able to buy supplies for her store, including drinks, meat, fruit, bread products, and other things. In this way, she will be able to continue fighting and growing. 

All of the members are thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving and, the loan will help them a lot.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, fruit, bread products and other things.

loans.name: Winfridah

texts.en:
Winfridah is a married woman and she has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, toothpaste and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks, toothpaste and other items she sells. Her business goal is to own a mini supermarket within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks, toothpaste and other items she sells.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon is 40 years old. Married with 4 children, he is a very caring father. He is also a hardworking and industrious man. 

Ilhomjon is a master at repairing cars. He has been busy with this skill for more than 4 years. Little by little, with the passing of the time, Ilhomjon has been improving his knowledge and abilities. As a result, his business has also improved. 

Ilhomjon now requires auto repair equipment so he can continue improving his business. He does not have enough savings to buy this equipment, and so he is requesting a loan of 3,000 TJS. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy auto repair equipment.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Maria está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de CONCEPCION, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es un grupo nuevo, donde las integrantes están luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
La Sra.  Juana es una de las integrantes, ella sale a vender a sus chipa, una comida típica paraguaya de su propia fabricación que hace de mañana y de tarde. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones que vaya recibiendo, poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus chipas, como ser harina, almidón, queso, manteca, y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que todas reciben y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Santa Maria is in its first cycle of the women’s committee program. It is from the city of Concepcion, which is an area a little away from the central area and still growing. It is a new group, where the members are fighting to improve their lives. 

Juana is one of the members. She goes out to sell her cheesy buns, a traditional Paraguayan food of her own production that she makes in the morning and afternoon. She wishes that as time passes, and through the help of the trainings that she is receiving, to be able to improve her life conditions. 

She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to be able to continue making her cheesy buns, such as flour, starch, cheese, butter, and the rest. She is grateful for this opportunity that they all receive and that will be much help to them.

loans.use: to buy flour, starch, cheese, butter, and the rest to make cheesy buns.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Virtuosas está en su ciclo número 9º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo dentro del grupo.
Todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras, que con mucho esfuerzo se han unido, pero se destaca entre ellas la Sra.  Ricarda, quien además es la presidenta de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Pide ese préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder surtir su negocio con bebidas, panificados, hortalizas, verduras y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Vituosas (“Virtuous Women”) group is in their ninth loan cycle with a program that is made up of women, where all of the women work and help each other go forward through their effort and continuing work within the group. 

All of the women are very hard working and, above all, are enterprising. With a lot of effort, they have come together, but Mrs. Ricarda stands out among the women. In addition to being the president of the group, she has a store in which she works everyday, beginning very early in the morning.

She requests a loan so that she can buy various supplies to be able to stock her business with drinks, bread products, vegetables, and other things. In this way, she will be able to continue with her work as it is going.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread products, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fatima 2 forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores pueden conocer su situación de vida y poder ayudar así a sus familias.
Sonia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza ha mostrado que esta en un nivel uno, es decir que debe esforzarse un poco mas. Ella es empleada, pero también implementa la venta de cosméticos, es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha pese a los infortunios.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fatima 2 group is a part of the poverty elimination program. Through a survey of 50 indicators, they're able to understand their life situation and thus be able to help their families.

Sonia is one of the members of this group. In her survey of poverty elimination, she's shown she's at level one, which means she needs to exert herself a little more. She is employed, but also sells cosmetics. She's a very hardworking person who strives in spite of hardships.

She's asking for this loan to be able to buy various cosmetics, and thus be able to continue her sales as she's been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving, which will be very helpful for her.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Liseth Dayana

texts.es: Liseth una joven de 20 años de edad del sector de carepa, una zona marginada por la violencia pero llena de personas que quieren superar esta historia darle una vuelta a la hoja y empezar a trabajar por su futuro. Una de estas personas es Liseth que hace un año inicio con su negocio de venta por catalogo y quiere fortalecer su negocio comprando directamente los productos y no por encargo como lo hacía pues de esta manera puede tener mejor utilidad que le servirá para apoyar a su familia que es de tan bajos recursos..
texts.en: Liseth is a young 20 year-old woman from the region of Carepa, an area that is marginalized by violence but full of persons that want to overcome this history, turn a new leaf over and begin working for their future. One of these persons is Liseth, who started her catalogue-order business a year ago. She would like to strengthen her business by purchasing the products directly instead of on demand as she as done so far. In this manner she can make greater profits which she would use to support her family which has a very low income.

loans.use: to purchase products from catalogues such as lotions, and personal care and beauty products

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 21 years old, and he lives in Tulkarem city with his family; he has four brothers. Five years ago Mahmoud started raising goats with his brothers in his own yard, to sell the meat and products in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy goats; this will increase his products and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  Mahmoud is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy goats to increase his products and to increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire more business space (premises).

loans.name: Flavi

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inharime Província de Inhambane tem 31 anos de idade, casada oficialmente mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade  apenas 2 é que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa. 
Trabalha na Educação como docente a mais de 8 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa, com valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e varões. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende dar continuidade com os seus estudos, construir dependências para aluguer e mais tarde adquirir uma viatura
texts.en: Flavi was born in Inharime, in Inhambane Province. She is 31 years old, married, and a mother of three children, two of whom are still minors and attend school. She is also responsible for her niece, who lives with her in her house. She works in education, as a teacher for over eight years. This job provides her with a salary that covers her household expenses. With the loan she is seeking she plans to continue with work on her house, buying construction materials like gravel, cement, and rebar. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku. In the future, she plans to continue with her education, build some rooms to rent out, and eventually buy a car.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, and rebar.

loans.name: Destine

texts.en: Destine is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy salon equipment. Her business goal is to make large profits within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open other businesses. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Jose Obrero”está en su Séptimo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se dedica a la confección, aprendió este oficio y desde ello que trabaja en la costura, es una persona muy luchadora que se está esforzando para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Comenta que se inspira en un mejor estilo de vida para su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos y agujas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que reciben, y que les será de mucha ayuda en los emprendimientos que cada una tiene.
texts.en:
The San Jose Obrero group is in their seventh cycle in the women's committee program, where all members promise to work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the elimination of poverty survey, where all are striving to improve their lives.

One of the members is Maria, who earns a living making clothing. She learned this job and works in sewing as a result. She is a very determined person who is striving to help her family through her work. She said she aspired to a better lifestyle for her family.

She's seeking this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of yarn and needles to be able to continue her work. She's very grateful for the opportunity she's received, and it will be very helpful in the undertakings that each member has.

loans.use: to buy yarn and needles to use in clothing.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a single lady. Her brother who is also shown in the photo deals in a business selling animals. He buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. He makes enough through his business to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her brother’s business, Nusrat has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to expand his business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to expand her brother's business and income level.

loans.name: Janmabhumi Group

texts.en:
Suwartha, the lady standing second from left with her hand raised in the photo, is a very active woman who is 49 years old. She resides with her family in the village of J.K.Pur of Rayagada district in Odisha, India. Bhairabi hails from a very poor Schedule Caste family who is Below Poverty Line. 

Suwartha has been running a general grocery shop in a wooden cabin in her small village for the last seven years with the help of her husband who is also a very mixing and hardworking fellow. Suwartha sells items like rice, potatoes, onions, garlic, biscuits, locally made shakes, soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, etc. in her shop. She started the business with a small investment of her own. Presently, she is earning a monthly income of 5,000 INR. As per the statement of Suwartha, this small income is not at all sufficient to manage the family along with the educational expenses of her children.  So she wants to increase her income by expanding her existing business. She motivated other women of her village and formed a group of four women to take a new loan. With the present loan, she will purchase items like rice, wheat, oil, soap, potato, onion, etc. for her general store. She will also purchase leaves for making leaf plates. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income and make savings so  she will be able to construct a house for her family as well as a permanent cabin for her business. The other three members of the group do businesses like a grocery shop, vegetable vending and leaf plate business.

loans.use: to purchase items like rice, wheat, oil, soap, potatoes, and onions for her general store. She will also purchase leaves for making leaf plates

loans.name: Henriqueta

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacaze Província  de Gaza tem 55 anos de idade casada oficialmente, mãe de 5 filhos maiores de idade apenas 1 frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em sua casa.
É reformada na Saúde onde exercia funções de parteira, auferindo mensalmente um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende terminar a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e pedras e outro que forem necessários. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, e erguer capoeiras para a criação de frangos para a venda
texts.en: Henriqueta was born in Manjacaze, in Gaza Province. She is 55 years old, married, and mother of five children, all of whom are of-age and only one of whom is still in school. She is also responsible for her mother, who lives in her house with her. She is trained in healthcare and works as a midwife, which earns her a monthly salary that goes toward her household expenses. With this loan she plans to complete work on her home, buying construction material such as gravel, cement, stone, and other items as needed. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. In the future, she plans to finish with the work on her house, and build a few chicken coops so she can raise and sell chickens.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, and stone.

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Marta está en su ciclo número 13º son mujeres jefas d familia que luchan por sus seres queridos, ya que quieren darles una vida sin privaciones ni limitaciones.
Todas ellas participan activamente entre las que se destaca la Sra. Marcia, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas.
Ella comenta que aunque hay mucha competencia, siempre trata de hacer la diferencia y lo logra mediante la variedad que tiene, que es lo que mas atrae a los clientes.
Sueña con capacitarse e ir mejorando. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Marta group is in their 13th cycle. They are woman heads of households who strive for their loved ones, as they want to give them a life without hardships or limitations.

All of them actively participate. Marcia, who earns a living selling various garments, is highlighted from among the group members. She says that although she has a lot of competition, she always tries to do something different and succeeds due to the variety she has, which is what most attracts her customers.

She dreams of training herself and continuing to improve. She's seeking this loan to be able to buy various garments, so she can continue with her work as she's been doing.

loans.use: to buy various garments for sale.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 2 filhas menores de idade que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe, 2 irmãos e 2 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.  
Trabalha  na empresa  de Água a mais de 2 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e blocos. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior
texts.en: Latifa was born in Namaacha, in Maputo Province. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters, both of whom are minors and go to school. She is also responsible for her mother, two brothers, and two nephews who all live with her. She has worked at the water company for more than two years and earns a salary that covers her household expenses. With the loan she is seeking, she plans to continue working on her house, buying construction materials such as gravel, cement, and blocks. This will be her third loan with Hluvuku. In the future, she plans to finish the work on her house, and ensure that her children are able to complete their education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as gravel, cement, and blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade her nursery in order to make her space a more agreeable place for the children.

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad el señor José ve más posible cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder montar en una tienda, sueño que antes no era posible pues es una persona humilde del sector de turbo y en esta zona no llega mucha ayuda de una entidad para apoyar proyectos de vida que solo les falta ese capital para iniciar. 
Gracias a un crédito que Interactuar pondrá a su disposición podrá montar su propio negocio de tienda general lo que es motivo para sonreír ya que la operar y será su propio jefe, algo que ha estado buscando hace mucho tiempo y sueña hacer de esta tienda la más representativa de turbo y se compromete a pagar cumplidamente las cuotas pues personas de buen corazón como los prestamistas kiva harán realidad su sueño
texts.en:
At the age of 51, Señor José sees that it is more possible to achieve his dream of being able to open a store and be independent.

Before, this was an impossible dream, as he is a person of modest means from Turbo, a zone that doesn’t get much help from banks to support life projects that only lack start-up capital.

Thanks to a loan that Interactuar will make available to him, he will be able to open his own business, a general store.  This gives him a reason to smile, as he will manage his store and be his own boss.

This is something that he has wanted to do for a long time, and he dreams of making his store the most popular in Turbo.

He is committed to making his payments on time, as good-hearted people like the Kiva lenders are making his dream a reality.

loans.use: to begin work on his dream of opening his own store and being his own boss.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a female Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells scrap metal. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more scrap metal. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to mend the damages and to be able pay for the workers; he wants to rebuild the ceiling and the windows.

loans.name: Annapurna Shg Group

texts.en:
Pratima is a 51-year-old widow who lives in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She married a farmer and from this relationship, has three children. Her children are all adults and one still lives with her. 

Pratima has a store in her home and sells all types of grocery and general store products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, fruits and vegetables and other items. She works everyday from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later. In her store, her customers can find everything necessary and that is the reason why each day she has more customers. Pratima has worked 14 years in the business, which has supported the household even while her husband was alive and she does not earn much on the farm.

Pratima's portion of this loan will be used to buy groceries to stock the store. She has been in the Shg for two years and likes it because her business improves with each training and support provided by the Peoples Forum. Her goal is to continue growing her business day after day.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Taj

texts.en: Taj is 38 years of age. She is a married lady and her husband is also shown in the photo. Her great skill in machine embroidery and an experience of many years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her six children. For the improvement of her business she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities.  It will help her in meeting the orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities.

loans.name: Noor  Ulhawa

texts.en: Noor Ulhawa is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. For the improvement of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.name: Jihobajiri Shg Group

texts.en:
Sumitra is 29 years old, married and has two children. Her family lives in a village in the Koraput district of Odisha state and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for seven years, the current business earns her about 6,500 INR per month. 

Sumitra is an existing client of Peoples Forum who has received previous loans. The past loans have helped her relieve her family's financial burden to a great extent. 

She is now leading a group of 12 members to apply for another loan with Peoples Forum. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

Other members of this group are engaged in different activities and they are very happy with this loan. They are grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Leassane

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 53 anos de idade, é viúva mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 6 netos que vivem em sua casa.
É proprietária de um estabelecimento comercial onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade como: óleo, açúcar, feijão e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos e abrir um salão de beleza.
texts.en: Lassane was born in Namaacha, in Maputo Province. She is 53 years old, a widow, and mother of three adult children. She is responsible for her six grandchildren, who live with her in her house. She is the owner of a general store, where she earns an income that goes toward her household expenses.
