With this loan, she plans to stock up her store, buying daily needs items like oil, sugar, beans, and others. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. In the future, she plans to start a business raising chickens and open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy daily needs items like oil, sugar, and beans, among others.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 26 years old and married with two kids. She is an IDP and lives with her family in a settlement for IDP. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has had a husbandry business raising cows, sheep, etc. and selling meat, milk and wool for 4 years almost. Her monthly income is 150  AZN. 

There are lots of different kinds of delicious dishes in Azerbaijan cuisine that include meat (dolma, kebab, dushbere, qutab, khash). And that's why the people's demand for meat is very high. Milk is also used daily, preparing different sweets (cookies, pies and etc.). Beside that, milk is very useful for health.
 
Elmira's condition is very hard and she needs to increase her income and help her family. She applied for a 1000 AZN loan in order to buy more husbandries. This is her first  loan . Please support Elmira .

loans.use: to buy more livestock for her animal husbandry business

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Expedito  está integrado por 23 señoras, ellas son todas mujeres jefas de familia, que decidieron unirse para poder crecer y salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que se dedica a la compra y venta de reciclajes, comenta que junta los insumos de manera ambulante y después los vende al por mayor para tener una mayor ganancia. Comenta que por medio de este humilde trabajo ayuda a su familia y es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos reciclados, como ser cartones, aluminios, y demás para revender y tener un margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
The group called San Expedito is made up of 23 women. They are all women who are heads of their households who decided to come together to be able to grow and get ahead through the combined work of everyone. 

One of the members is Rosa, a very hardworking and selfless woman who works buying and selling recyclables. She collects the goods by traveling and later sells them wholesale in order to have better profits. Through this humble work she helps her family and it is a respectable and honest job. 

She asks for this loan to purchase recycled products such as cardboard, aluminum, and other things in order to resell and have a profit margin.

loans.use: to buy recycled products such as cardboard, aluminum, and others things to resell.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is a rural woman with her views of life. She is 41 years old and lives with her family in the Vakhsh district, where she is engaged in farming. Her children have helped her in agriculture for five years on the irrigated plot of land where she grows wheat and other agricultural products. In this way she makes a living and provides her family with ecologically friendly products. 

Mavluda now needs a loan. The fact is that she does not have enough funds to do the next sowing. She has already prepared the ground for planting. With the loan amount, Mavluda is going to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer. The loan will help her to do the sowing on time and to continue her agricultural activity.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a growing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier of clothes to other businesses. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a grocery store where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, carrots and other items. Her business is located in a growing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and carrots. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is 26 years old, and lives with his wife in Gaza. He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to repair it again, but he lost all his property, so he is trying now to take the first step until he can back to his normal life. For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to purchase cement and other building materials and also pay for the worker to start working at rebuilding. Yousef is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials and also pay for the worker to start working at rebuilding.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: 51-year-old Razia is a married woman and a mother of two children. The only source of earning in her family is from the rickshaw that her husband (shown in the picture) drives. This rickshaw helps him to provide transportation service in his city to passengers. Currently, Razia has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her husband. In this way her husband would be able to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw. She is hopeful that her husband’s earnings will increase in near future.

loans.use: to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Krishna is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. In 2012, Krishna established her fruits and vegetables business. She started the business to help her husband with their home expenses. Her business is located in a small town called Semliguda and her main customers are Semliguda residents. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 4,000 INR every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of 15,000 INR for each member. Krishna requires a loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell. She hopes that this loan will add to her business and bring in more clients. In the future, Krishna plans to educate her children and expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is a 35-year-old, married woman who has been running a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. She sells milk to the people of her locality. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. For the improvement of her business, she has requested a  Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Amandio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 32 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 1 filho menor de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha no hotel a mais de 8 anos como recepcionista onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e pedras. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e garantir o ensino do seu filho até ao nível superior. O seu maior desafio é ter uma casa condigna
texts.en: Amandio was born in Maputo. He is 32 years old, married, and has one school-aged son, who is his sole dependent. He has worked at a hotel for over eight years as a desk clerk. The job provides him with an income that goes toward his household expenses. With this loan, he plans to continue work on his house, buying construction material like gravel, cement, and stone. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku. In the future he plans to finish the work on his house and ensure that his son completes his education. His main challenge is to have a decent house.

loans.use: to buy construction material such as gravel, cement, and stone.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en: Twenty-five-year-old Remy is a single man from Carles, Iloilo. For the last three years, he has been raising hogs as his livelihood. Remy would like to expand his business to add more piglets but has limited funds. He is asking for a loan to be used for this purpose as well as feed to keep his piglets healthy. Remy hopes that he can sustain his business and make a good profit so he can uplift his present living conditions and help his parents too.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Saulina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala Província de Inhambane tem 34 anos de idade, viúva mãe de 1 filha adotiva menor de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É proprietária de um salão de beleza onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com valor solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio  adquirindo produtos de beleza como cabelos.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu salão de beleza, aumentar o stock dos produtos de beleza e garantir o ensino da sua filha até ao nível superior.
texts.en: Saulina was born in Zavala, in Inhambane Province. She is 34 years old, a widow, and has a school-aged daughter, who is her sole dependent. She is the owner of a beauty salon where she earns an income that goes toward her household expenses. With this loan, she plans to grow her business by buying hair product. In the future she plans to expand her salon, increase her stock of beauty products, and ensure that her daughter completes her education.

loans.use: to buy hair product.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a widowed woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a developing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Shehla

texts.en: Shehla is a 23-year-old lady. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. By this time, she has retained a good number of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  In order to purchase more beads, threads, frames and needles, she has taken a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. She is positive about her future earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames and needles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more animals for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of 2 children. Her husband (the man shown with her above) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. 

Zahida's husband is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. 

For the growth of her husband's business, Zahida has requested a Murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate in order to satisfy the demand of her husband's customers.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 40 years old, married and a mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, she has taken a Muarabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband who has purchased new tires and some auto spare parts. She is positive about her husband’s earnings.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and auto spare parts.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora, madre de 2 hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad, está felizmente casada pero no se resigna hacer las labores del hogar y por eso vende productos de consumo personal para mejorar la salud y ayudar a personas en temas nutricionales.
Quiere impulsar su empresa y lo hará con la ayuda de interactuar y sabe que con esta cooperación de interactuar puede lograr grandes cosas como montar su local, aumentar sus ventas sabe que esta alianza le permitirá realizar los sueños más locos con su negocio que inicio para tener alguna entrada extra y que hoy lo ve como una posibilidad grande de salir adelante.
texts.en: Yolanda is a very hard working and entrepreneurial woman. She is the mother of two children who are 19 and 12 years old. She is happily married but she has not resigned herself to doing housework. Because of this she sells products for personal consumption that improve health and provide people with nutritional information. She wants to boost her business and she will do it with the help of Interactuar. She knowns that with the cooperation of Interactuar she will be able to accomplish great things like dominating her area and increasing her sales. She knows that this alliance will permit her to achieve her craziest dreams for her business that she began to have a an extra income and that today she sees as a possibility to greatly get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in products that help people to improve their health and to obtain better nutrition.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en: Imtiaz is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Some time ago, she started up a poultry business as her husband’s income is insufficient to bear their household expenditures alone. Now she is running her business with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She makes a good amount to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to build a shed roof for her hens and to purchase a stock of feed. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to build a shed roof for her hens and to purchase a stock of feed.

loans.name: Villeta Poty Group

texts.es:
Villeta Poty es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas en el programa de comité de mujeres, ya que a través de el podrán capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virgilia quien tiene una despensa, que fue armando con el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y quiere seguir creciendo con la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de sus programas de impulso a microempresarios. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa con panificados, verduras, frutas, carne, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir creciendo y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Villeta Poty is a new group that has put its hopes in the women's committee program, because through it they will be able to train themselves and improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Virgilia. She has a general store, which she built with continuous effort and work and which she wants to continue growing with the help of Fundacion Paraguaya and its programs to boost small business owners. She is a very selfless woman and a fighter.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in buying various supplies to be able to stock her store with baked goods, vegetables, fruit, meat, drinks, and other goods, in order to be able to keep growing and fighting as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, fruit, meat, drinks, and other goods.

loans.name: Andre

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Homoine Província de Inhambane tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é Pai de 4 filhos dos quais  2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É negociante proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade como: arroz, feijão, açúcar e outro que forem necessários. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio abrindo outros estabelecimentos comerciais. O seu maior desafio é tornar-se num grande empreendedor.
texts.en: Andre was born in Homoine, in Inhambane Province. His is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. His children are his sole dependents. He is a businessman and owner of a general store, which provides him with an income that goes toward his household expenses. With this loan he plans to increase his business by buying daily needs items like rice, beans, sugar, and others. This is his first loan with Hluvuku. In the future her plans to grow his business and open additional locations. His main goal is to become a major businessman.

loans.use: to buy daily needs items like rice, beans, sugar, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild the greenhouses and prepare the land for the new season

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Jeneba. She is married and has two children who are four and nine years old. In 2011, Jeneba established her provisions, soft drinks and cosmetics business. She began her business because she needed to support her husband in the smooth running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Jeneba requires a loan in order to purchase more stock such as sugar, water, soft drinks, luncheon meat, powdered milk and mayonnaise. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Jeneba plans to stock the shop with different items and sell at  wholesale to retail customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as sugar, water, soft drinks,  luncheon meat, powdered milk and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 41-year-old widow who is taking care of four children, and has been a farmer for a period of eight years, earning herself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Emily was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 and intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Emily plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is managing her mango fruit production business, which is how she makes a living. She will buy mango fruit trees for production and will supply fruit vendors in the market and neighboring towns as well. 

She always ensure that she will have all the needed herbicides for increased production. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. The loan is intended to buy herbicides and fruit fertilizer. 

Someday, she hopes to buy at least 5 hectares of land to plant grafted mango seedlings, that will bear fruit in a short span of time.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fruit vitamins to increase mango production.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 27-year-old married lady with four children. Her husband is a freelance plumber. Dalal has started a small business at home selling blankets and bed covers that she buys from distributors at a wholesale price and resells in the neighborhood. She is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of her order and get more discounts to raise her profits.

loans.use: to increase her order of blankets and bed covers.

loans.name: Philisilla

texts.en:
Philisilla is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 28-year-old mother, who lives with her family in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She is blessed with two lovely children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide them a better future. Philisilla was unable to study to get a professional career, because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past five years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living. Philisilla has space on her farm and wants to increase her dairy farming, but the major challenge she faces is lack of feed. 

She is kindly requesting for a loan to buy animal feed. Kerugoya is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Philisilla, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her buy animal feed, which will assist in increasing the quantity of milk being produced by her cow. 

Philisilla plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and to package milk. She wants to be economically empowered. She knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved, and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and to improve her family's living conditions. Philisilla patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Pakeeza

texts.en:
Pakeeza, age 36, is a married woman. Her husband is running a jewelry shop where he sells different artificial jewelry items including earrings, bracelets, rings etc.  He earns a good amount of income to bear their household expenses.  She has three children, and she is motivated to provide them with a good quality life. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. It will help him to purchase more variety of jewelry items including earrings, bracelets and rings to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of jewelry items for her husband's business including earrings, bracelets, and rings to increase sales and profits.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Garnahovit village. The mother of four children, Gayane is involved in agriculture. On her farm, she keeps five cows, four calves, thirty sheep and hens. Gayane's husband helps her to sell the gathered agricultural products in the market and also take care of the farm.

The requested loan will help this couple to develop their farm and make their children's life better.

Gayane is asking for this loan to purchase three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. As for every farmer, it is very important for Gayane to be prepared for the winter season and be able to sustain the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Araujo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Morrombene Província de Inhambane tem 36 anos de idade casado oficialmente pai de 3 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que  se encontram em Inhambane enviando lhes 1.000,00mt mensalmente.
É negociante e proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade como arroz, feijão, farinha de milho e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio e tem como desafio  manter o seu negócio como base de sustentabilidade
texts.en: Araujo was born in Morrombene, in Inhambane Province. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom go to school. He is also responsible for his parents, who live in Inhambane and to whom he sends 1,000 Meticais [MZN] every month. He is a businessman and the owner of a grocery store, which earns him an income that goes toward his household expenses. With this loan, he plans to grow his business by buying staple goods like rice, beans, millet flour, and others. This is his first loan with Hluvuku. In the future he plans to grow his business and his main challenge is maintaining the stability of his business.

loans.use: to buy staple goods like rice, beans, millet flour, and others.

loans.name: Aspram

texts.en:
Aspram is from Agarakavan village where she lives with her retired mother. She has a son who is now in the Russian Federation working abroad. Aspram is a good farmer with many years of experience of running a farm. She keeps livestock of cows, calves, piglets and hens. She uses the gathered milk in cheese and other dairy products and sells them. Aspram also gets income from the sale of wheat, which she cultivates in her plot of land near her house.  Her son is hardly able to cover family's basic costs, so the agricultural income is very important for Aspram.

She has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season. The loan is very important for Aspram to sustain her farm and to be prepared for the coming cold season.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season.

loans.name: Azhara

texts.en: Azhara is 33 years old and married. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is a carpenter by profession. She has three children and a total of five members in her home and her husband is the only earner in the family. It was very tough for Azhara to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband earn more income. For this purpose, she started her business selling bed sheets and blankets in her locality. For the improvement of her business, she has availed a loan Murabaha of 20,000 PKR to purchase more collections of bed sheets, spreads and bed covers. It will help her to increase her sales as well as her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more collections of bed sheets, spreads and bed covers to increase her sales and profits

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 32-year-old, married man who has three children to raise. Wael started two years ago with a small showroom for selling furniture. During those two years Wael built good relations with carpenters and started tailoring the furniture as the client wanted. After getting that experience, he is now applying for a loan to buy wood and fabric to start making furniture by himself, in order to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy wood and fabric for making furniture.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Maputo tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em Goba.
É proprietário de um estaleiro e viaturas de transporte de mercadorias, onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com valor solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de estaleiro adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, varões, chapas, barrotes, pranchas e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende melhorar os seus serviços. O seu maior desafio é ser grande empresário.
texts.en: Augusto was born in Maputo Province. He is 42 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. He also provides for his mother, who lives in Goba. He is the owner of a construction supply yard and of several delivery vehicles, which earn him enough income to cover his household expenses. With this loan, he plans to increase his construction yard business, buying construction material like gravel, cement, rebar, sheet metal, beams, boards, and others. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. In the future he plans to improve his services. His main challenge is in becoming a major businessman.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, rebar, sheet metal, beams, boards, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Buzi Província de Sofala tem 28 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela cunhada que vive em sua casa.
 Trabalha na Saúde a mais de 6 anos como Técnico Farmacêutico e é negociante de roupa usada, onde ganha respectivamente um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com valor solicitado pretende adquirir bens como fogão e aparelho de som.
Futuramente pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de venda de roupa, terminar a faculdade e iniciar uma obra de construção de uma residência.
texts.en: Fernando is based in Buzi, in Sofala Province. He is 28 years old, married, and has a school-aged son. He also provides for his sister-in-law who lives in his house. He has worked in healthcare for over six years as a pharmacist and is also a salesman of used clothing. These activities earn him an income that goes toward his household expenses. With this loan he plans to buy goods like a stove and a sound system. In the future he plans to grow his clothing business, graduate from college, and start construction work on his house.

loans.use: to buy goods like a stove and a sound system.

loans.name: Los Ángeles Group

texts.es: Este grupo está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, quien lo coordina la señora Ángeles de 58 años de edad, viuda, su negocio es el alquiler de sillas, manteles y mesas, este negocio lo impulso hace dos años de los ingresos de la pensión, es el segundo ciclo que trabaja con los financiamientos de la institución, y logró aumentar los productos ofrecidos, ya que invirtió en sillas, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de veinte mesas y cien sillas. Las otras integrantes del grupo son las señoras Guadalupe de 61 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace doce años en su domicilio y en las calles de su comunidad, y María Mercedes de 21 años de edad, se dedica al destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales desde hace tres años en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three enterprising women, and Ángeles is the one who coordinates it. She is 58 years old, widowed, and her business is the renting of chairs, tablecloths, and tables. She started this business two years ago with the income from her pension. This is her second cycle working with the institution’s funding, and she achieved expanding the products she offers after investing in chairs. She requests the current loan to buy 20 tables and 100 chairs. 

The other members of the group are Guadalupe, 61 years old, whose business for the last twelve years has been the sale of second-hand clothing in her home and in the streets of her community, and María Mercedes, 21 years old, who has worked butchering pigs and making tamales for the last three years in her home.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a married mother of three children. She lives a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She has operated a business selling ladies' shoes. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase pairs of shoes for resale. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness.

loans.use: to purchase pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Luz Nery

texts.es:
Las familias del campo se han caracterizado por tener muchos miembros en su familia pues es normal que en una misma casa vivan diferentes familiares, entre estos campesinos se encuentra Luz, una mujer que heredó de su padres un negocio de producción de leche con unos animales que aman de corazón no los sacrifican y solo los sepultan al momento que fallecen por causas naturales o enfermedades incurables, Luz quiere mejorar el negocio y solicita un crédito para la compra de dos vacas lecheras en realidad a justara con un ahorro y el crédito será para no endeudarse con personas que le cobran un alto interés.
Estas vacas le permitirán aumentar su producción de leche y vivir junto con sus 3 hijos, pareja y familiares más cómodamente.
texts.en: The families of the countryside are characterized by having many family members since it is normal that different relatives live in the same home. Among these farmers you may encounter Luz, a woman who inherited a business from her parents producing milk with a few animals that she loves with her heart. She does not slaughter them and she only buries them at the moment they die from natural causes or incurable diseases. Luz wants to improve her business and she seeks a loan to purchase two milk cows  that in reality she will buy with her savings and the loan will be used to avoid lending from people who will charge her high interest. These cows will allow her to increase her production of milk and to live together with her three children, husband and relatives more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase two cows to improve her milk production because liters are being devalued.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a single woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sweets, biscuits, sweaters. Her business is located in a developing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sweets, biscuits, sweaters. Her business goal is to have more clients within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: buy more stock of sweets, biscuits, sweaters

loans.name: Las Glorias Group

texts.es:
Siete mujeres madres mexicanas muy trabajadoras que siempre de alguna manera desean mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por primera vez escucharon hablar de Visión Fund y les emociono poder iniciar con el préstamo alguna de ellas invertirán en sus negocios otras iniciaran alguna actividad económica.  Gloria invertirá en molino de nixtamal, Juanita invertirá en su mueblería, Gloria Karina invertirá en guajolotes, María Alicia y Jenny invertirán en pollos, Jacqueline en tienda de abarrotes y Gloria G. invertirá en ropa.
El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque tres de las integrantes se llaman Gloria se conocen desde hace muchos años,  entre ellas hay una gran amistad, esperan no tener ningún problema de pago.
Gloria M. es la representante del grupo tiene 47 años de edad está casada con el señor Gregorio juntos han formado una familia con seis hijos de los cuales ya solo uno de ellos depende de dicha pareja.
Para Doña Gloria sacar a sus hijos adelante era lo más importante, con el sueldo de su esposo muchas veces no alcanzaba para solventar los gastos de su hogar por eso decidió iniciar con la elaboración de tortillas e iniciarlas a vender pero desafortunadamente una de sus hijas desafortunadamente enfermo gravemente por lo que se vio obligada a dejar el negocio.
Pero hace un año que retomo nuevamente el negocio pero se le ha complicado comprar algunas cosas como el gas y maíz porque ahora están muy caros. “Con las pocas ganancias obtenidas no puedo comprar en cantidades mas grandes se me dificulta mucho” Pero ahora con el préstamo de Vision Fund podrá comprar una tonelada de maíz y dos tanques grandes de gas así no se preocupara en tener que comparar maiz y gas.
Gloria verdaderamente está muy agradecida con Vision Fund y KIVA por el préstamo porque le ayudara en su negocio, dice que en estos tiempos es muy difícil encontrar un préstamo tan fácil pero sobretodo económico.  Su mayor sueño es poder seguir ayudando con los gastos del hogar pero sobretodo con la educación de su hijo que aun esta estudiando la secundaria le gustaría verlo titulado en alguna carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Seven very hardworking Mexican mothers who always wish to somehow improve their living conditions heard of VisionFund for the first time and they were excited to be able to get started with a loan. Some of them will invest in their businesses and others will begin a business. 

Gloria will invest in a nixtamal mill [cooked maize for making tortillas], Juanita will invest in her furniture store, Gloria Karina will invest in turkeys, Maria Alicia and Jenny will invest in chickens, Jacqueline will invest in a corner store, and Gloria G. will invest in clothing.

They chose the name of the group because three of the members are named Gloria. They have known each other for many years, and they share a great friendship. They hope to not have any trouble paying.

Gloria M. is the group's representative. She is 47 years old and is married to Gregorio. Together they have built a family with six children, only one of whom still depends on the couple. For Gloria, giving her children a better life was the most important thing. With her husband's salary, many times she did not have enough money to pay household expenses, and that is why she decided to begin tortilla production and sales. 

Unfortunately, one of her daughters became gravely ill and she was forced to quit the business. A year ago she took up the business again, but it has been difficult for her to buy some things, like gas and corn, because they are now very expensive. 

"With the little earnings I have I cannot purchase larger quantities. It is very hard." But now with the VisionFund loan she will be able to buy a metric ton of corn and two large tanks of gas, so she will not have to worry about buying corn and gas. 

Gloria is truly very grateful to VisionFund and KIVA for the loan because it will help her in her business. She says that nowadays it is very difficult to get a loan so easily, especially a loan of money. 

Her biggest dream is to be able to keep helping with the household expenses but above all with her son's education. He is still in middle school, and she would like to see him graduate from some professional career track.

loans.use: to buy gas and corn.

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jellene

texts.es:
Jellene un hombre responsable, trabajador, muy colaborativo de 49 años de edad, padre de dos hijos ya mayores los cuales crio y levanto gracias a su negocio de transporte de personas, una actividad que adopto ante las escasas oportunidades de empleo y que hoy tiene parada por no tener capital para reparar su carro lo que le ha generado pérdidas muy considerables pues su única fuente de ingreso es este carro que hoy tiene parqueado.
Jellene quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en su totalidad en la reparación de su carro y está muy feliz y motivada con esta ayuda pues podrá volver a las calles a rebuscar el sustento diario para su familia.
texts.en: Jellene is a responsible, hard working and very collaborative man who is 49 years old and the father of two children who are older who he raised and cared for thanks to his business transporting people. He adopted this work because of the scarce opportunities for employment and today he has stopped because he does not have enough capital to repair his car. This has generated considerable losses because his car is his only source of income and today it is parked. Jellene wants to seek a loan that he will invest completely in the repair of his car. He is very happy and motivated by this help because he will be able to return to the streets to seek daily sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to repair his car now that it is his only source of income and it is currently idle.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus  está en su ciclo número 2, es un grupo relativamente nuevo, formado con 18 integrantes, todas ellas muy entusiasmadas en poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Otilia se dedica a la venta de verduras frescas, es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por poder salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Esta con muchas esperanzas de poder capacitarse y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras frescas, de manera a poder crecer en su emprendimiento y así seguir con su trabajo. Ella está luchando por mejorar y seguir por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group named Divino Nino Jesus is on its second cycle. It is a relatively new group, made up of 18 members, all of them very enthusiastic about being able to grow and help their families. They are in the poverty elimination program. 

Otilia makes a living selling fresh vegetables. She is a very selfless woman who fights to get ahead and give her family all that she could not have. She is very hopeful to be able to train herself and be someone in life.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in buying fresh vegetables, to be able to grow her enterprise and thus continue with her work. She is fighting to improve and keep going for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to be able to continue with sales.

loans.name: Cantera Moroti Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cantera Moroti está en su ciclo número 3° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores.
Se destaca de entre ellas la Sra. Nicolasa, quien se dedica a la venta de leche, ella desde muy tempranas horas empieza su trabajo, ya que reparte la leche a sus clientes para la hora del desayuno. Su meta es poder seguir con su trabajo, pero ir mejorando poco a poco por medio de las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche en mayor cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Cantera Moroti Group is on its third cycle of the women's committee program, where all of the women are doing the poverty elimination survey, using the 50 indicators. 

From among them stands out Nicolasa, who makes a living selling milk. She begins her work in the wee hours of the morning, because she delivers milk to her clients for breakfast time. Her goal is to be able to keep doing her work but to improve little by little through the trainings that she will receive.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in purchasing larger quantities of milk, in order to be able to continue with her sales and through that work help her family.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom in his house, which he so badly needs in order to have a good hygienic environment at home.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 29 year old, married man from Khan Younis. He is the father of three young daughters. Yousef is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the kids needs. Yousef decided to find an additional job where he could support his family and improve their living conditions.

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his additional work. This will help him to increase the family income and improve their living conditions. 

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 21 year old, single guy, in his second year at the University, majoring in Marketing. 

Salameh is one of a five member family. Two of his brothers are working to help in supporting the family. Salameh on the other hand has found a job that can afford him pocket money and some of his university fees. 

He is now facing a shortage in covering the semester fees, for that he is requesting an educational loan.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 23-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. Rami works in a factory for making traditional sweets where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family's needs, so he decided to find an additional job so he could support his family and improve their living conditions.

Rami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start a new business. This will help him to increase the family income and improve their living conditions. 

Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to work on it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help his coffee crops.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is 24 years old, and lives with his wife in Gaza. 

He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to repair it again. He requested this loan in order to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to mend the damages, and to be able pay for the workers. He wants to rebuild his house by making a bathroom, small bedroom and a kitchen room. 

Husam is very grateful to everyone who helps him

loans.use: to rebuild his house so it at least contains a bathroom, small bedroom and a kitchen room.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 29 years old. She is married with 2 children, ages 4 months and 6 years. The older one goes to school. Jeanette sells shoes and has been in this business for 10 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is age 36. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 12 years. All of them go to school. He sells foodstuffs and has been running this business for 10 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more beans and groundnuts for resale. The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and groundnuts for resale.
